title: Design of the power supply scheme for small pump stations in the "Double High" sugarcane base
requirement: Design of the power supply scheme for small pump stations in the "Double High" sugarcane base In the construction of small pump stations (installed capacity ≤500kW) at the "High-Quality Sugarcane" base in Guangxi, a 10 kV power supply access, transformer selection, and high-voltage side equipment configuration scheme are provided through grid power supply design to meet the pump station's operation and load requirements while reducing construction and maintenance costs.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for the power supply of small pump stations in dual high bases. Specifically, first, considering that pump stations are mostly in low-load areas, a 10 kV public overhead line "T" connection method is adopted, approved by the power supply department to ensure reliable connection to the pump stations. Second, in transformer selection, priority is given to more cost-effective oil-immersed transformers, and when harmonic suppression and single-phase load support are required, the Dyn11 wiring group is selected. By strictly calculating load and capacity formulas, unreasonable selection is avoided. Finally, in the configuration of high-voltage side switches, 10 kV vacuum circuit breakers are recommended to improve power supply reliability in combination with monitoring systems. When economic conditions are limited, drop-out fuses can be selected, but safety operation and maintenance management must be strengthened. Through the above measures, low-cost and highly reliable power supply for small pump stations is achieved, enhancing the efficiency of base construction.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of high power supply costs and unstable voltage, use technology0 and adopt a 10 kV "T" connection method for the shared overhead line. Obtain approval from the power supply department to ensure the power access quality of the small pump station.

For analysis1, consider the potential issue of the overhead access point load exceeding the standard, clarify the technical requirements for transformer capacity matching and load verification, and combine the technology1 and technology2 solutions. Use oil-immersed or dry-type transformers and prioritize the selection of the Dyn11 connection group to ensure power supply reliability.

For analysis2, in the selection of transformers, considering that the transformer capacity needs to balance cost-effectiveness and load requirements, and combining technology1 and technology2, the capacity is scientifically determined based on the formula S=Σ(P1/(η*cosφ)+P2*K2). The load factor method is used to avoid overload or over-specification issues in the selection process.

For analysis3, to address the issue where high-voltage sectionalizing switches may affect power supply safety, the recommended solution is to use technology3 with vacuum circuit breakers, which can reduce fault impact through automatic detection and rapid tripping. For cost-sensitive areas, technology4, namely drop-out fuses, can be used, but caution must be exercised to avoid safety incidents.

title: Design of the remediation plan for the crest spillway of Yixiantian Hydropower Station project
requirement: Design of the remediation plan for the crest spillway of Yixiantian Hydropower Station project Under the condition that the actual construction plan of the dam crest spillway was not carried out according to the original design, resulting in the check flood discharge not meeting the required standards, propose a spillway rectification plan that meets the requirements to ensure a check flood discharge capacity of 1110.00 m³/s and safe flood discharge at the design flood level.
solution: This paper proposes a combined flood discharge scheme using bottom outlets. Firstly, considering the insufficient discharge capacity (1013.79 m³/s) of the existing polyline weir under the check flood level of 1038.52 m, the bottom outlet technology (technology3) increases the flood discharge capacity of the bottom outlet (1038.52 m³/s combined flow), avoiding the need to remake the dam and spillway. Secondly, this scheme comprehensively considers construction cost and effectiveness, showing feasibility compared to raising the dam crest (technology0), widening the spillway (technology1), or modifying the weir surface (technology2). Finally, through specific designs such as a trumpet-shaped inlet (3.06×2.94 m), a control steel pipe (DN2000), and a butterfly valve, the discharge requirements for both check floods and design floods (1110 m³/s) are met.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the insufficient flood discharge capacity of the trapezoidal weir, technicians proposed solutions such as raising the dam crest (technology0), widening the spillway (technology1), modifying the overflow weir surface (technology2), and combined flood discharge with bottom outlets (technology3) to enhance discharge capacity. Due to the high construction difficulty or cost of other solutions, the combined flood discharge with bottom outlets solution was ultimately adopted. By installing a trumpet-shaped inlet, control valve, and outlet system at the bottom outlet, the combined discharge flow rate meets the requirement (check flood level of 1,086.98 m³/s).

For analysis1, considering that the dam body and the main structure of the spillway are already formed, modifying the overflow weir (technology2) and widening the spillway (technology1) are difficult to implement. Ultimately, the low-difficulty and low-cost bottom outlet combined flood discharge technology (technology3) was adopted, which involves designing a drainage system through the bottom outlet to work in conjunction with the spillway, achieving compliance with flood discharge capacity standards.

title: Research on Safety Evaluation and Reinforcement Design Plan for Qizhan Lamp Reservoir
requirement: Research on Safety Evaluation and Reinforcement Design Plan for Qizhan Lamp Reservoir Addressing the seepage issues of the Qizhanlamp Reservoir dam and the lack of monitoring equipment, complete the safety evaluation and reinforcement tasks under different operating conditions to enhance dam safety and ensure normal operation.
solution: This paper proposes a reinforcement and risk mitigation plan for the Qizhandeng Reservoir. Specifically, first, considering the lack of an impervious curtain in the dam body and the serious seepage issues at the dam foundation, vertical grouting technology is employed. By laying grout holes and injecting cement slurry, the anti-seepage performance of the dam body is improved. Second, to address potential seepage risks caused by operating conditions, concrete impervious panel technology is adopted. C25 concrete impervious panels are installed upstream, with adjustments to the structural thickness and embedded anchor bars to ensure stability and anti-seepage effectiveness. Additionally, to address the lack of monitoring equipment, seepage monitoring and displacement monitoring devices are added. By scientifically setting up observation points and measuring instruments, real-time safety monitoring during operation is ensured. These measures effectively resolve the current leakage risks and monitoring blind spots of the dam, significantly enhancing the safety and operational capacity of the reservoir.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the absence of an anti-seepage curtain in the dam body and the severe seepage issues at the dam foundation, technology0 is adopted. By arranging drainage and grouting holes at the dam crest and injecting cement slurry, leakage is effectively prevented, and the anti-seepage performance of the dam body is improved.

For analysis1 and analysis2, considering the permeability under operating conditions and the significant differences in permeability parameters of different soil layers, technology1 is used to reduce seepage paths and enhance the stability and safety of the dam body by installing concrete anti-seepage panels.

For analysis3, considering the current lack of safety monitoring equipment in the reservoir, technology2 is adopted to install displacement and seepage monitoring systems to monitor dam deformation and seepage in real-time, ensuring the safe operation of the dam.

title: Design study on the prestressed anchor cable arrangement scheme for the bottom orifice gate pier of Sanhekou arch dam
requirement: Design study on the prestressed anchor cable arrangement scheme for the bottom orifice gate pier of Sanhekou arch dam Under the requirements of complex stress conditions, high water head, large thrust, and optimized prestressed design for the bottom hole outlet, complete the structural design of the bottom hole pier of the Sanhekou arch dam, including improving the layout method of the tensile stress area and the parameters of the anchor cable system to enhance stress conditions and stress distribution, ensuring the safety of the pier structure.
solution: This paper proposes a prestressed anchor cable layout design scheme for the bottom pier of Sanhekou Arch Dam. Specifically, first, to address the issues of complex stress conditions and high tensile stress regions at the bottom pier, the main anchor cable layout technique is used, reducing the distribution range of tensile stress through adjustable tonnage and fan-shaped arrangements. Second, to tackle the secondary stress issue at the junction of the pier and the supporting beam, the secondary anchor cable layout technique is introduced, enhancing the constraint performance of the junction and achieving more uniform stress distribution. Finally, to counter potential new stress issues on the top of the pier caused by secondary stress, the top anchor cable layout technique is employed, further dispersing the secondary stress by arranging five anchor cables on the top. Additionally, by using 3D finite element simulation analysis, the reasonableness of the anchor cable layout parameters and the overall structural design scheme is validated under various operating conditions, ensuring that the pier design meets the requirements for load capacity and safety.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex stress conditions and large tensile stress areas of the bottom hole gate pier, using technology0 and the reasonable fan-shaped arrangement of the main anchor cables, significantly reduces the range of the tensile stress area and the maximum tensile stress value of the gate pier.

For analysis1, considering that ordinary concrete structures are difficult to withstand the high stress in areas with large tensile forces, technology1 was adopted. Secondary anchor cables were added to the main anchor cables of the gate pier, enhancing the constraint at the joint between the gate pier and the supporting beam, thereby effectively reducing the stress value to within the range that meets the concrete strength standard.

For analysis2, considering the new secondary stress distribution caused by the action of anchor cables, use technology2 to arrange anchor cables at the top of the gate pier, thereby dispersing stress concentration areas and maintaining a reasonable overall stress distribution.

For analysis3, considering the possibility of shallow stress concentration with a relatively small distribution range, use technology3 to conduct three-dimensional finite element analysis, evaluate and optimize the design under adverse conditions such as earthquakes to ensure the safety of both the local areas and the overall structure.

title: Design of the flood control and beneficial use scheduling plan for Sanlizhuang Reservoir
requirement: Design of the flood control and beneficial use scheduling plan for Sanlizhuang Reservoir Under the premise of flood safety, complete the flood control and beneficial operation tasks of the Sanlizhuang Reservoir, requiring the design of an operation plan to ensure the reservoir can supply water as planned, meet the water supply guarantee rate, prevent flooding, and optimize national economic benefits.
solution: This paper proposes a flood control and benefit scheduling plan for Sanlizhuang Reservoir. Specifically, firstly, considering the risk of no water discharge faced by flood control tasks, the flood dispatching diagram drawing technique and no-discharge zone boundary calculation technique are adopted to clearly define the no-discharge zone, the controlled discharge zone, and the free discharge zone, improving the accuracy of flood control scheduling to ensure safe flood discharge. Secondly, in response to the high water supply assurance requirements of the benefit tasks, the benefit dispatching diagram drawing technique is used to divide the flood regulation zone, expand the water supply zone, and limit the water supply zone, dynamically adjusting the water supply plan. In dry years, the water supply crisis depth can be prevented by adjusting water supply ratios. Lastly, to address challenges posed by larger floods within the standard that may exceed discharge capacity, the scheduling technique for larger floods within the standard is employed. This involves gradually opening gates, controlling flow, and pre-relocating village residents to ensure safe flood discharge and protect people's lives and property. Combined with design indicators and actual project conditions, the scheduling process is optimized from a comprehensive perspective to achieve the optimal national economic effect and improve reservoir management levels.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that floods may cause safety issues and risks of exceeding flood protection standards, use technology0 and technology1 to accurately determine when to open the gates and control water volume by drawing flood control scheduling diagrams and calculating the boundary line of the no-release zone, thereby ensuring flood control safety.

For analysis1, considering the need to prevent water supply depletion and meet water demand for beneficial purposes, technology2 and technology3 are used. By dividing the water supply scheduling zones and dynamically adjusting the water supply volume, it ensures the smooth implementation of the water supply plan, especially in drought years to prevent water supply crises.

title: Design of the treatment plan for the potential landslide body on the left bank of the Liangjiangkou Reservoir
requirement: Design of the treatment plan for the potential landslide body on the left bank of the Liangjiangkou Reservoir Under the conditions of steep terrain, the landslide body located below the normal water level of the reservoir, and potential impact from water level fluctuations and heavy rainfall, complete the landslide reinforcement and remediation task to ensure the safety of the hub dam and prevent the reactivation of the landslide from posing a threat to engineering facilities.
solution: This paper proposes a reinforcement treatment plan for the landslide body on the left bank of the Liangjiangkou Reservoir. Specifically, first, in response to the conditions of loose soil and a steep stratum slope angle in the landslide body, which may pose a sliding risk, slope cutting and load reduction techniques are adopted. By using stepwise terracing and slope thinning to reduce weight, stability is improved. Secondly, to address the issue of reduced shear strength of the landslide body caused by water level fluctuations, consolidation grouting technology is used to enhance the strength of the sliding belt's rock and soil and improve the integrity of the sliding surface. Finally, to mitigate the risk of landslide reactivation caused by heavy rainfall and water infiltration through cracks, water interception and drainage techniques, as well as crack backfilling measures, are implemented. By setting up interception ditches to block surface water infiltration, the impact of water in the softened zone is reduced. Through this combination of technologies, the landslide reinforcement treatment achieved the goals of safety, reliability, and cost-effectiveness, significantly improving the stability of the landslide body. No new signs of landslide or changes in cracks have been observed, ensuring the safe operation of the hub dam.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the conditions of steep landslide slopes, gravelly sandy clay in the soil, and relatively low shear strength, sliding hazards may occur. Therefore, technology0 is used for slope cutting and load reduction, improving the anti-sliding stability of the slope by creating terraced slopes and reducing the slope weight. At the same time, technology1 grouting technology is applied to improve the mechanical properties of the sliding zone and enhance overall stability.

For analysis1, considering that the landslide is located below the normal water level of the reservoir and that changes in the reservoir water level have a significant impact on the landslide body, which may exacerbate the risk of sliding, technology2 intercepting and draining water techniques are employed. An external slope interception ditch is set up to block surface water from infiltrating into the landslide body, and crack backfilling measures are implemented to reduce the risk of softening the sliding zone.

For analysis2, considering that the stability factor of the landslide body does not meet the requirements under heavy rainfall conditions and may become unstable due to rainstorms or impact loads, slope cutting and load reduction technology are employed to reduce the sliding force of the landslide body, and consolidation grouting technology is used to improve the sliding surface, enhancing the bearing capacity and resistance to landslide reactivation.

title: Design of the demolition plan for the rock ridge cofferdam at the water intake of the Central Yellow River Water Source Project
requirement: Design of the demolition plan for the rock ridge cofferdam at the water intake of the Central Yellow River Water Source Project In the main stream of the Yellow River, under the conditions of a narrow construction area, complex environmental conditions, and high protection requirements for surrounding permanent hydraulic structures and residential areas, complete the overall blasting demolition of the rock ridge cofferdam at the water intake (13.2m wide, maximum thickness 5.59m) and underwater cutting and clearing of steel pipe piles, ensuring the safety of surrounding buildings and facilities, while controlling the impact of blasting vibrations and flying debris.
solution: This paper proposes a blasting plan for the removal of the cofferdam at the water intake of the Central Yellow River Water Source Project. Specifically, firstly, considering that the cofferdam is close to the intake tower and surrounding protective buildings and facilities, which may face threats of blasting vibration and flyrock, techniques such as shock absorption holes and pre-splitting holes were used, and effective control of vibration and flyrock was achieved through multi-layer active and passive protection, reasonable hole arrangement, and covering with tires and bamboo slats. Secondly, for the issue of the cofferdam's dense and highly integrated reinforced steel pipe piles, inclined light blast holes were arranged using down-the-hole drilling rigs, and precise detonation was achieved with non-electrical millisecond detonators. The success of the dismantling was ensured by designing single-stage charge amounts and controlling the hole depth. Additionally, due to the proximity to residential areas and operating in a narrow underwater environment, blasting vibration monitoring and coordinated cutting and clearing techniques by divers and machinery were utilized, effectively ensuring safety and efficiency during construction. This plan successfully completed the task of cofferdam blasting and removal, providing implementation guidance for similar water conservancy projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the close distance between the cofferdam and the permanent hydraulic structures, it is necessary to prevent vibration and flying rocks from damaging the intake tower. Therefore, technology0 and technology2 were used, and effective control of vibration and flying rocks was achieved through shock absorption holes, pre-split holes, and multi-layer tire flexible protection.

For analysis1, considering that the integrity of the cofferdam steel pipe piles is enhanced due to mortar injection and is difficult to damage, technology1 is used to achieve effective separation and disintegration of the steel pipe piles from the rock mass through reasonable blast hole arrangement and precise smooth blasting design.

For analysis2, considering its proximity to residential areas, blasting vibrations and flyrock need to be strictly controlled. Therefore, by combining technology0 and technology5, and through reasonable hole arrangements and vibration monitoring, the protection of surrounding buildings is achieved.

For analysis3, considering the issue of low efficiency caused by the narrow construction area, technology4 is used, with divers and machinery working collaboratively to address the limitations on efficiency imposed by the confined construction environment.

For analysis4, considering the potential connection issues or equipment failure in a complex initiation network, use technology3 to ensure successful blasting and achieve the desired effect through the design of non-electric millisecond detonators and precise networking.

title: Specific scheme design and application in the construction of Fengcheng City river channel management project
requirement: Specific scheme design and application in the construction of Fengcheng City river channel management project Under the conditions of environmental sensitivity, high suspended solids concentration in wastewater, and the impact of extensive construction areas, complete the river management project for the Zhen Tou Water (Meilin Section) in Fengcheng City, with the goal of protecting 13,000 mu of farmland, safeguarding a population of 6,000, and enhancing flood control capacity. It is necessary to address pollution impacts and regional ecological issues as a foundation to achieve sustainable development.
solution: This paper proposes a river channel remediation plan aimed at addressing environmental sensitivity, high pollution concentrations, and disturbances across extensive construction areas. Specifically, first, considering the environmental sensitivity and the potential for pollution spread, greening restoration and waste sorting and treatment technologies are adopted. Through post-construction vegetation restoration, and classified recycling and treatment of domestic waste, the regional ecological environment is protected. Second, to address the issue of high suspended solids concentration in concrete wastewater that may pollute the river, a flocculation neutralization + sedimentation treatment process is utilized to separate solid suspended matter from the wastewater for standard compliant treatment or reuse, ensuring stable water quality. Finally, to combat construction disturbances and soil erosion, segmentation-based centralized stacking and greening restoration techniques are employed. Through retaining wall protection and topsoil backfilling, land stability and landscape improvement are achieved. In addition, health checks and protective measures were implemented to ensure the health of construction workers and the safety of the project during the construction period. This plan balances the overall goals of engineering efficiency, ecological protection, and sustainable development. Practical results show that the first year after the economic benefits yielded an additional flood control benefit of 3.134 million RMB, demonstrating feasibility and comprehensive value.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the environmental sensitivity and the presence of facilities such as schools and hospitals nearby, which may face pollution diffusion and vegetation destruction, technology1 and technology3 were used to ensure the continuous controllability of the ecological environment through post-construction regional greening restoration and waste sorting and recycling.

For analysis1, considering that the high concentration of suspended solids in concrete wastewater may pollute the river, technology0 is adopted. Through flocculation neutralization and sedimentation separation techniques, the treated wastewater is reused or discharged after meeting standards, solving the river water quality issue.

For analysis2, considering the risks of soil erosion and soil contamination caused by disturbances in the construction area, technology2 and technology1 were used to stabilize the natural soil after construction and prevent surface runoff damage through sectional piling of waste and topsoil backfill greening.

title: Design of a proactive immune cybersecurity protection scheme for hydropower station power monitoring systems
requirement: Design of a proactive immune cybersecurity protection scheme for hydropower station power monitoring systems Under the conditions of high regulatory requirements and severe cybersecurity threats, complete a cybersecurity protection plan for the hydropower station's power monitoring system with active immunity and comprehensive defense, ensuring system availability under any circumstances, meeting disaster recovery capabilities, and enhancing the application rate of domestic equipment and software.
solution: This paper proposes a hydropower station power monitoring system network security protection solution based on proactive immunity. Specifically, first, considering the issues of strict regulatory requirements and the difficulty of implementing technical measures, domestic equipment, software technologies, and electromagnetic shielding technologies are adopted. By defining technical standards and implementation specifications, the feasibility of the technical solution is improved. Second, addressing the weakness in management functions and emergency measures, three layers of defense redundancy measures are deployed, refining the protection design from both vertical and horizontal dimensions to ensure disaster recovery capability. Third, in response to the increased system operating pressure caused by network security incidents, an internal network security monitoring and auditing platform is introduced, optimizing the incident response mechanism through unified management and real-time monitoring tools. Lastly, to tackle the inadequacy in the rate of system domestication and issues of system credibility, the solution implements a trusted security immunity system based on domestic cryptographic technologies, progressively establishing a fully independent and controllable network security ecosystem to ensure the effectiveness and long-term controllability of defense against attacks. This solution aims to build a proactive immunity and comprehensive defense framework for hydropower network security from the dual core perspectives of technology and management.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the strict regulatory requirements but the insufficient awareness of practitioners, which may lead to difficulties in implementing technical measures, technology1 and technology0 were adopted. By increasing the certification of domestic equipment and implementing electromagnetic shielding for critical nodes, the operability and execution efficiency of technical implementation were improved.

For analysis1, considering that insufficient management functions and emergency awareness may lead to delayed emergency measures and damaged system availability, technology4 is adopted to enhance the disaster recovery capability of the equipment through comprehensive redundancy measures and refine safety management responsibilities.

For analysis2, based on the need for real-time monitoring of the internal network and the potential impact of cyberattacks, technology2 is adopted to centrally monitor network operation information in real time through a unified monitoring and auditing platform, enabling quick responses to security incidents.

For analysis3, considering the threats of potential hidden backdoors and malicious attacks due to insufficient system localization, use technology3 to build a trusted security immunity system, and promote the localization of equipment and software through technology1 to enhance the overall autonomy and controllability of the system.

title: Analysis of the Flood Control and Management Plan Design for Biertokoy River in Wuqia County
requirement: Analysis of the Flood Control and Management Plan Design for Biertokoy River in Wuqia County Under the conditions of the Belterkoy River Basin, complete the flood control management task, constructing a total river section length of 12.055 kilometers, including 9.853 kilometers of levees and slopes on the left bank and 2.202 kilometers on the right bank. It must meet the 10-year flood protection standard, with an engineering grade of Class V. The bank protection facilities must withstand peak flood flows of 180-186 m³/s, providing effective flood control capability.
solution: This paper proposes a flood control solution for the Biertuokuyi River in Wuqia County. Specifically, first, considering the flood control pressure brought about by upstream grassland degradation in the river region, it is recommended to use the concrete panel slope protection technology and gabion foot protection technology to enhance flood control capability through slope and foundation protection, addressing the issue of flood erosion. Second, to tackle the difficulty in project positioning caused by the inconsistent left and right swings of the river channel, anti-scouring calculation and optimized design technologies for dikes are applied. Stability of the river width is ensured through foundation depth and foot protection design, safeguarding construction and the functionality of the dike. Finally, in response to the impact threats posed by high peak flow rates, safety super-elevation calculations and dam crest design technologies are employed. By increasing the dike height and the width of the dam crest, the stability and flood control effectiveness of the dike are ensured. This proposed plan not only meets the flood control requirements of a 10-year return period but also significantly improves regional social stability and residents' living standards. Additionally, with an internal economic return rate of 8.17%, it proves the economic feasibility of the project.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the flood control pressure caused by upstream grassland degradation and desertification intensification, technology0 and technology1 are used to strengthen riverbank protection and foundation safeguarding through the reasonable placement of sequential dam concrete slab revetment and gabion foot protection, thereby addressing the issues of flood erosion and downstream disasters.

For analysis1, considering the difficulty in positioning caused by the uncertain lateral swing of the river channel, technology2 was adopted to optimize the design of scouring depth and scour resistance. By determining the thickness of the toe protection and the foundation embedment depth, the stable width of the river channel design was ensured, resolving the impact of irregularities in the river channel on construction positioning.

For analysis2, considering the impact threat of large flood peak discharge, technology3 is used for safe freeboard calculation and dam crest design. By designing a reasonable dam crest width and safe freeboard structure, the stability and effectiveness of the bank protection facilities are ensured, addressing the risk of embankment failure under large flood peak discharge.

title: Intelligent port and shipping solution design for the "Three to Two" project of the Jining section of the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal.
requirement: Intelligent port and shipping solution design for the "Three to Two" project of the Jining section of the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal. Under the conditions of relatively outdated waterway informatization facilities, insufficient information collection methods, and a complex communication environment, complete the construction of the intelligent port and shipping system for the "Three-to-Two" project on the Jining section of the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal, improve the digitization and automation levels of waterway management, and achieve comprehensive perception, extensive interconnection, deep integration, and intelligent applications for the waterway.
solution: This paper proposes an information construction scheme based on the "Three to Two" project of the Jining section of the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal. Specifically, first, considering the low digitization of channel facilities and insufficient information monitoring, integrated sensing network technology is used to achieve full-scale and information-based integration of management objects such as buoys, water levels, and bridges. Second, to address the issue of insufficient dynamic information collection capabilities, integrated supervision station technology is used in combination with AIS equipment, meteorological instruments, and other integrated configurations to solve the blind spots in multi-source information collection. Finally, considering the long channel distance and high transmission requirements under communication conditions, multiple communication network transmission technologies are employed, using optical cables, communication towers, and other means to establish data transmission channels and provide technical support for end-to-end shipping information service platforms. This achieves multi-terminal coverage and information sharing, offering a reference for information construction of inland waterways in other regions.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the low level of digitization of existing navigational aids, complex environments, and challenges in safety supervision, technology0 integrated sensing network is used. By employing information sensing methods that cover surface, underwater, and aerial environments, it has improved overall monitoring and management efficiency.

For analysis1, considering the issues of insufficient information collection and scattered data, technology0 and technology2 were adopted to construct dynamic sensing and integrated supervision sites. Through precise sensing and hardware integration, comprehensive information collection and enhanced data fusion capabilities were achieved.

For analysis2, considering the complex waterway environment and high communication requirements, technology1 is adopted to form a comprehensive coverage network combining communication towers, optical cables, and wireless networks, ensuring data transmission stability and high coverage in complex terrains.

title: Design of a water pressure testing plan for the water supply project pipeline.
requirement: Design of a water pressure testing plan for the water supply project pipeline. Under the conditions of a 255km-long water transmission line, elevation differences between the pipeline start and end points, and limited water supply conditions in mountainous and hilly terrain, conduct pressure tests on large-diameter water transmission pipelines and related facilities to ensure construction quality meets design requirements and guarantees the safe operation of the pipeline.
solution: This paper proposes a scheme design for the water pressure test of the water transmission line in the Dongshan Water Supply Project. Specifically, first, considering the long length of the water transmission line, a height difference of 40m between the start and end points, and differences in working pressure distribution, a segmented water pressure test technique is adopted, dividing the pipeline into short sections with lengths controlled within 3.5km and ensuring uniform distribution of test pressure through graded test pressures. Second, in cases where some pipe materials have already undergone factory testing and installation joint pressure testing, to improve operational convenience and the accuracy of results, blocking facilities are designed and configured, ensuring test safety and effectiveness through flange connections and steel pipe replacements. Finally, given the inadequate water supply conditions in the mountainous and hilly terrain, pipeline water-filling and pressure-boosting control techniques are adopted. Segmental water filling is carried out using auxiliary pumps in the forebay of the pumping station, gradually increasing the pressure to expel gas step by step until the test pressure is reached. This ultimately ensures that the construction quality of the water transmission pipeline meets design requirements and achieves the goal of safe operation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the total length of the water transmission line is 255 km, the elevation difference between the start and end points is 40 m, and the variation in working pressure distribution, technology0 segmented hydrostatic testing technology is adopted. The pipeline is divided into short sections of no more than 3.5 km, controlling the test pressure for different segments, and combined with technology1 for sectional pressure sealing to avoid issues of pressure imbalance during testing and difficulties in leakage detection.

For analysis1, considering that some pipes have undergone factory tests and joint pressure tests, technology1 is used to design specialized sealing facilities. Through the reasonable configuration of the sealing facilities and the flange connection method, the stability of the test operation is improved. Meanwhile, the segment length is adjusted according to standards to ensure moderate test pressure and accurate results.

For analysis2, considering the insufficient water supply in mountainous terrain and the inability of surface water sources to meet demands, technology2 is applied for pipeline water filling and pressure boosting control. Two-stage water filling control is achieved through auxiliary pumps in the forebay of the pump station, eliminating gases and gradually increasing pressure to ensure sufficient and highly stable water supply while avoiding operational errors.

title: Design of the repair and renovation plan for the sill of the arc-shaped working gate at the bottom hole of the Liupanshui Yushe Water Supply Project dam.
requirement: Design of the repair and renovation plan for the sill of the arc-shaped working gate at the bottom hole of the Liupanshui Yushe Water Supply Project dam. Under the condition of severe damage and leakage of the dam bottom arc-shaped working gate lintel, the repair and reconstruction of the lintel must ensure reliable water sealing under high head (51.0m) and the stable operation of the original gate, while also considering the simplicity of construction and project timeline constraints.
solution: This paper proposes a repair and reconstruction plan for the lintel of the bottom hole arc working gate of the Liupanshui Yushe water supply engineering dam. Specifically, firstly, to address issues such as lintel cracks, detachment, and significant water leakage hazards, a new lintel structural design and welding process optimization technology were adopted, substituting carbon steel welded parts for cast steel parts and re-welding a complete structure. Additionally, phase-one reinforcement bars were repositioned and supplemented to solve safety and construction accuracy problems. Secondly, to tackle the poor sealing effect and leakage problems of the original duckbill-type sealing, two P-shaped top sealing structures were used to replace the existing sealing components, and the sealing position at the top of the gate was elevated to significantly improve sealing performance. Finally, jet-resistant panel technology was added to optimize the gate leaf design within limited space and enhance both the sealing and structural protection performance. In summary, the repair plan has been successfully implemented, achieving the modification goals of lintel sealing and structural stability.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the water leakage and safety hazards caused by lintel cracks and displacement, technology1 was used to replace cast steel parts with carbon steel welded parts, optimize the welding process, and restore the embedded concrete reinforcing bars, ensuring structural reliability and reducing production time.

For analysis1, considering the poor water-stopping performance of the original lintel leading to leakage and cavitation problems, use technology0 to replace it with a double P-shaped overhead water-stopping structure, and adjust the position of the water-stop rubber to better adapt to water pressure conditions, achieving efficient water-stopping.

For analysis2, considering the local space limitations that are not suitable for complex water-stop structure modifications, technology2 is used to add a splash shield on the outside of the blade panel. Through structural optimization, the water-stop performance is significantly enhanced within the limited space.

title: Analysis of the Causes of Cracks in the Fengjing River Gate Bent and Design of the Reinforcement Plan
requirement: Analysis of the Causes of Cracks in the Fengjing River Gate Bent and Design of the Reinforcement Plan Under the conditions of unreasonable design of the framework structure and beam cross-section, large loads, and structural cracks, reinforce and strengthen the frame beams and columns of the Fengjing River sluice to ensure their safety and durability, thereby guaranteeing the normal operation of the sluice.
solution: This paper proposes a plan for crack grouting treatment and reinforcement of bents' beams and columns using the enlarged cross-section method. Specifically, first, considering that overload on the beam structure may lead to crack expansion, crack grouting treatment technology is applied. By embedding grouting nozzles, sealing cracks, and injecting epoxy resin grout, cracks with a width of 0.20 mm or more are sealed to restore the structural strength of the cracked areas. Second, to address stress concentration and insufficient bearing capacity caused by structural design defects, the enlarged cross-section reinforcement method is used. Through rebar planting on both sides (or one side), roughening the surface of the concrete, and pouring new C40 concrete, the load-bearing cross-section of the beams and columns is enlarged, enhancing the flexural and shear strength of the normal and inclined sections, ensuring the safe operation of middle bents and edge bents. Through these measures, the safety and durability of the Fengjing River Gate bents have been significantly improved, thus ensuring the normal operation of the sluice.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenge of cracks caused by insufficient load-bearing capacity due to excessive shear and bending moments in the beam, the technology0 crack grouting technique is adopted. Epoxy resin is injected into cracks larger than or equal to 0.20 mm to seal them, restoring the strength of the cracked area and preventing further crack propagation. At the same time, the technology1 section enlargement reinforcement method is used, which involves rebar planting and pouring new concrete to enhance the structural stress-bearing section, significantly improving the bending and shear strength of both the normal and inclined sections.

For analysis1, considering the issue of cracks caused by unreasonable stress distribution and stress concentration due to design defects in the beam cross-section, the technology1 cross-section enlargement reinforcement technique is adopted. This involves focusing on strengthening the tensile zone on the upper part of the beam, adjusting the cross-sectional shape, and reducing the stress concentration distribution. In addition, cracks with a width of less than 0.20 mm are sealed to further ensure the continuity and durability of the structure.

title: Design of the Repair and Reinforcement Plan for Liu Da Reservoir Spillway
requirement: Design of the Repair and Reinforcement Plan for Liu Da Reservoir Spillway Under the conditions of concrete damage in the spillway of Liu Da Reservoir, rusting of gate sealing devices and embedded parts, insufficient maintenance capacity, and the crest elevation of the gate pier being lower than the standard requirements, complete the reinforcement and repair tasks of the spillway, aiming to improve the flood discharge performance of the spillway, ensure its safe and stable operation, and comply with flood control standards.
solution: This paper proposes a reinforcement and repair plan for the spillway of Liu Da Reservoir. Specifically, first, considering the issues of concrete surface damage and equipment corrosion caused by the long-term operation of the spillway, the original gate pier slot expansion plan and SPC polymer cement mortar are used to construct a new middle pier head and maintenance door slot through slot expansion, and repair concrete surface defects to significantly improve the maintenance capability and durability of the spillway. Secondly, addressing the issue of the gate pier top elevation of the spillway not meeting the safety clearance requirements above the check flood level, the spillway stabilization recheck analysis technique is adopted. Through calculations, it is verified that the reinforced spillway meets the sliding resistance and stress safety requirements under normal water levels and extreme working conditions, ultimately ensuring the flood discharge efficiency and overall operational safety of the spillway.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of concrete damage, insufficient maintenance functionality, and equipment rust and aging in the spillway, technology0 and technology1 were used. Through the slot expansion scheme, new maintenance doors were added to improve the existing maintenance capability, and SPC polymer cement mortar was used to repair the surface defects of the concrete, enhancing the overall structural performance and construction convenience, thereby resolving these issues.

For analysis1, considering that the elevation of the spillway control section pier top does not meet the standard requirements, technology2 is adopted. Through stability calculation and review, the anti-sliding and stress distribution of the reservoir spillway gate chamber under normal and seismic conditions are verified after reinforcement to ensure compliance with standards and safe, stable operation.

title: Key points for the layout design of a certain ore shipment port in Canada
requirement: Key points for the layout design of a certain ore shipment port in Canada Under the harsh Arctic environment and complex port conditions, complete the layout of an iron ore shipping port with 24-hour year-round uninterrupted capacity, including ore terminal design, yard optimization, temporary construction and freight terminal layout, oil depot area design, and module vehicle transportation route planning.
solution: This paper proposes a layout plan for an iron ore export port in the Arctic cold environment. Specifically, first, considering that ice period characteristics may limit year-round transportation, a combination of ice-class and polar bulk carriers (technology0) is designed, using a mix of 1C-class, Newcastle-type, PC3, and PC4 ships to ensure year-round transportation capacity. Secondly, addressing the complex conditions of the terminal and water terrain, a separated pier-type structure terminal design (technology1) is adopted to optimize berthing stability conditions and reduce the impact of icebreaking. At the same time, a zoned yard design (technology2) is introduced to meet the seasonal differences in cargo volumes and handle the demand for 4.7 million tons of ore stockpiled in winter. Additionally, to meet the construction and equipment transportation needs, the plan includes a layout of freighter terminal modules (technology4) and transportation routes for module trucks (technology3) to ensure smooth entry of large modules. Finally, based on the specific needs of extremely cold environments, a polar oil storage area design (technology5) is planned to ensure year-round fuel supply and transportation safety. This plan makes full use of natural conditions and existing resources, achieving close coordination of functional areas and improved efficiency.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the constraints of ice coverage and extreme cold conditions in the Arctic region, which may affect year-round transportation, use technology0 through the combined design of ice-class and polar bulk carriers, along with 1C, PC3, and PC4 class ship types and icebreaker assistance, to achieve year-round transportation operations.

For analysis1, considering the complex terrain of Island B and the impact of freezing, use technology1 with a separated pier design to ensure berthing stability and operational safety while reasonably utilizing natural water depth to reduce dredging requirements.

For analysis2, considering the pressure on yard capacity caused by seasonal imbalances in transport capacity, using technology2 through zoned yard design and capacity optimization can store 4.7 million tons of ore in winter and efficiently ship it in summer.

For analysis3, considering that the transport route for modular vehicles needs to meet the requirements for moving large-sized equipment and may be restricted by terrain and facilities, use technology3 to reasonably plan the on-site route, set appropriate road width, longitudinal slope, and turning radius to ensure transportation safety and efficiency.

title: Design of the renovation plan for the computer monitoring system of Huaguangtan Cascade Hydropower Station
requirement: Design of the renovation plan for the computer monitoring system of Huaguangtan Cascade Hydropower Station Under the conditions of aging systems, single-network operation, and a long renovation cycle, complete the overall upgrade and renovation of the computer monitoring system for the Huaguangtan cascade hydropower station to improve system reliability and stability while ensuring uninterrupted power grid dispatch communication and data transmission during the renovation period.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for upgrading the computer monitoring system of the Huaguangtan cascade hydropower station. Specifically, first, considering the issues of aging equipment and shortage of spare parts in the existing system, H9000 V4.0 monitoring software and new LCU equipment are adopted for replacement and upgrade, which improves the system's stability and reliability. Second, to address the insufficient network reliability caused by single-network operation, a dual-star Ethernet architecture and dual independent fiber optic network structure were employed to ensure redundancy in system communication. Third, to meet the requirement of a long upgrade cycle while ensuring uninterrupted scheduling communication, a transition mode of simultaneous operation of the new and old systems was adopted. By using simulated scheduling communication interfaces, the issues of data monitoring and scheduling interaction during the switch between old and new LCU equipment were resolved. Finally, through the mode of joint development and joint debugging, operational and maintenance personnel participated in the design, installation, and debugging phases, enhancing their operational skills and maintenance capabilities for the new system, ensuring the successful completion of the upgrade and achieving significant results.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the aging of existing system equipment and the shortage of spare parts, technology1 and technology3 were used to improve the reliability and stability of the system by deploying H9000 V4.0 monitoring software and upgrading the on-site LCU equipment.

For analysis1, considering the risk of network failure due to the lack of redundancy design in single-network operation, technology0 was adopted to construct a highly reliable network structure through a dual-star Ethernet architecture and dual independent fiber-optic networks.

For analysis2, considering the long modification period and the requirement for uninterrupted scheduling communication, technology2 was used. Through the transitional mode of simultaneous operation of the new and old systems, real-time data and scheduling communication were ensured during the switching process between the new and old control units. At the same time, combined with technology4, joint development and debugging were adopted to optimize construction efficiency and enhance personnel technical capabilities.

title: Design of the construction scheme for the diversion tunnel of a hydropower station project in South Asia
requirement: Design of the construction scheme for the diversion tunnel of a hydropower station project in South Asia Under the conditions of complex geological structures, poor surrounding rock quality, and complicated stratigraphic relationships, complete the design and construction tasks of the diversion tunnels for a hydropower station in South Asia, including the excavation, support, and lining of two diversion tunnels, while ensuring project safety and cost control.
solution: This paper proposes a construction plan for the diversion tunnel of a hydropower station in South Asia. Specifically, firstly, considering the issue of tunnel instability caused by earthquakes, advanced pipe shed support technology and shotcrete-anchor support technology were employed, achieving enhanced tunnel stability through localized rock mass reinforcement and a long-term shotcrete plan. Secondly, to address the construction difficulties caused by fractured rock mass, advanced bolt or pipe shed technology was used, supplemented with layered excavation and short-step, light blasting construction techniques to prevent collapse and progress delays. Lastly, to tackle the challenge posed by the complex relationship between the rock layer orientation and the tunnel axis affecting tunnel stability, systematic anchor shotcrete technology and tunnel lining technology were adopted, with optimized support parameters and lining thickness ensuring construction safety. For class III, IV, and V surrounding rock masses, a differentiated support thickness design scheme was applied, optimizing stability according to specific tunnel conditions, effectively resolving numerous challenges in the construction of the diversion tunnel.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the instability of the cavern caused by earthquakes, technology0 advanced pipe-roof support technology and technology1 shotcrete anchor support technology were used. Through local rock mass reinforcement and long-term shotcrete protection solutions, the stability of the cavern was improved and the impact of earthquakes on construction was reduced.

For analysis1, considering the safety hazards and construction difficulties caused by the fractured rock mass, technology0 advanced anchoring and pipe-roofing techniques, as well as technology2 layered excavation techniques, are used, controlled through short advancement and weak blasting. Grouting technology is also applied to improve the poor support effect of the surrounding rock.

For analysis2, considering the impact of the complexity of the relationship between the rock layer orientation and the axis on the stability of the tunnel, technology1 system anchor bolt and shotcrete reinforcement technology as well as technology3 lining construction technology are adopted. By optimizing the lining thickness and support parameters, the overall stability and construction safety of the tunnel section are further enhanced.

title: Design and operation summary of the centralized control center scheme for cascade hydropower stations in the Nam Ou River Basin.
requirement: Design and operation summary of the centralized control center scheme for cascade hydropower stations in the Nam Ou River Basin. Under the conditions of a weak communication network infrastructure in Laos, the complex joint economic operation of cascade power stations in the basin, and high safety requirements, complete the construction of a centralized control center for the seven hydropower stations in the Nam Ou River basin, achieving remote centralized monitoring and scheduling, while reducing power generation costs, improving the overall scale efficiency of the basin, and setting high standards for safety and operational reliability.
solution: This paper proposes a construction plan for the centralized control center of the cascade hydropower stations in the Nam Ou River Basin in Laos. Specifically, firstly, considering the challenges of weak communication network infrastructure and large data volumes in Laos, a fiber-optic communication system is used as the primary channel, with a satellite communication system as the backup channel. High-reliability data communication is achieved through SDH optical transmission and seamless switching technology. Secondly, to address the complexity of joint operation and high real-time scheduling demands of the cascade power stations, a computer monitoring system is adopted, utilizing efficient protocols and a distributed network to meet the requirements for real-time monitoring and data interaction. Finally, to satisfy the comprehensive safety requirements for the operation of the centralized control center, dual power supply, UPS redundant power, large-screen monitoring, access control, firefighting, and other supporting facilities are implemented to enhance basic safety. Combined with a digital video monitoring system, key area monitoring and management are strengthened, significantly improving safety and reliability.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the weak communication infrastructure in Laos and the large data volume, the fiber optic communication system in technology0 is used as the primary channel to ensure real-time transmission of large data volumes, while satellite communication in technology1 is used as a backup channel, addressing the challenges of communication switching and insufficient communication reliability.

For analysis1, considering the complexity of joint operations of cascade power stations and the high demand for real-time scheduling, a computer monitoring system from technology2 was adopted. Through a distributed network and high transmission rate, real-time monitoring and scheduling of data were achieved, meeting the requirements for safety and reliability.

For analysis2, considering the high comprehensive operational safety requirements of the centralized control center, use the supporting facility system in technology3 to ensure normal operation through dual power supplies, redundant UPS, and multiple safety protection systems. At the same time, combine the video monitoring system in technology4 to enhance the dynamic monitoring and control capability of the core areas.

title: Design optimization and accuracy analysis of the deformation monitoring network for planar observation
requirement: Design optimization and accuracy analysis of the deformation monitoring network for planar observation Under the uncertainties caused by complex geological conditions due to high slope excavation in the hydropower station and the requirements for monitoring network accuracy and reliability, complete the comprehensive monitoring task for the deformation of the spillway slope, design and optimize the observation plan to reduce observation intensity and improve observation efficiency, while meeting the requirements of controlling the plane mean error of the weakest point in the monitoring network within ±3mm and the elevation mean error within ±5mm.
solution: This paper proposes a plan for optimizing the design of the monitoring network for spillway appearance deformation. Specifically, first, considering that the geological complexity of high-slope excavation may lead to issues such as landslides, the design optimization of the monitoring network is achieved by using accuracy optimization techniques such as edge and corner optimization and redundant component optimization, simplifying the network shape by eliminating redundant observations with large accuracy discrepancies while meeting the requirements for monitoring network point placement. Second, to address the issue of excessive redundant observations in the initial observation plan leading to high fieldwork intensity, the same optimization techniques were used to reduce 170 redundant observations, and the COSA system was employed for adjustment calculations to verify that the optimized plan met accuracy requirements. Finally, to mitigate the potential risk of reduced monitoring network accuracy during the optimization process, the COSA system was used for real-time accuracy evaluation. Thresholds for Ri and K values were reasonably set during the optimization process, and redundant observations were gradually reduced in a layered and sequenced manner, improving observation efficiency, lowering construction costs and external environmental interference, while ensuring the reliability of the monitoring network and the accuracy of monitoring results.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the geological complexity and slope stability influence in high-slope excavation that may cause safety hazards, technologies technology0 and technology1 are adopted, using techniques such as corner precision optimization and redundant component optimization to gradually simplify the monitoring network, improving overall observation efficiency while ensuring that the precision meets engineering requirements.

For analysis1, considering that excessive redundant observations in the initial design observation scheme may lead to low efficiency in fieldwork, technologies technology0 and technology1 are adopted to optimize the observation network design to reduce redundant observations. In addition, adjustment calculations are carried out using the COSA system (technology2) to verify that the optimized scheme meets the accuracy requirements.

For analysis2, considering the potential issue of reduced accuracy and reliability of the monitoring network during the optimization process, technology0 and technology1 are adopted to retain an appropriate number of redundant observations during the optimization. At the same time, the COSA system (technology2) is used to calculate adjustment accuracy, balancing the simplification and accuracy reliability of the monitoring network.

title: Design of the installation plan for the inclined shaft pressure steel pipe of Jurong Pumped Storage Power Station
requirement: Design of the installation plan for the inclined shaft pressure steel pipe of Jurong Pumped Storage Power Station Under the conditions of the inclined shaft tunnel at the Jurong Pumped Storage Power Station, complete the tasks of transportation, sliding, positioning, and installation of the pressure steel pipe, ensuring construction safety, efficiency, and the stability and accuracy of the final installation of the steel pipe.
solution: This paper proposes the installation plan for the inclined shaft pressure steel pipe of Jurong Pumped Storage Power Station. Specifically, first, considering the conditions such as the long inclined shaft (92.1m) and the impossibility for transport vehicles to enter the tunnel, which may pose challenges of transportation and sliding, the direct sliding technology using a double-drum hoist is adopted. Through a dual steel wire rope system, this improves construction efficiency and safety while reducing the need for tunnel roof expansion. Second, to address the complexity of welding operations during steel pipe transportation, the auxiliary installation and welding technology with a construction trolley are used. By ensuring stable locking with steel chain rings and fall protection on the trolley, the convenience of welding work and personnel safety are guaranteed. Finally, to mitigate the risk of overturning or detachment during steel pipe transportation and sliding, the overturning and welding seam strength verification technology is employed to ensure the reliability of the connection between the trolley and steel pipe, further enhancing overall construction safety. The implementation of this plan resulted in no personnel or equipment accidents in practical applications, effectively ensuring installation quality and progress, and providing significant technical support and reference experience for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the conditions that transport vehicles cannot enter the tunnel, there is no construction adit on the upper section, and the inclined shaft is relatively long, challenges such as transportation and sliding difficulties may arise. Therefore, the double-drum hoist technology of technology1 is used for direct sliding, which improves construction efficiency and safety through the double-wire rope system and simplifies the construction operations at the tunnel top.

For analysis0, considering the high-risk transportation challenges of inclined shaft pressure steel pipes, the construction trolley with technology2 was used to assist in the installation and welding process. During the transportation and installation of the steel pipes, the stable traction of the trolley and the anti-fall locking of steel chain rings improved the convenience and safety of welding operations.

For analysis0, considering the risks of overturning or falling that may arise during the transportation and sliding of steel pipes, use technology3 to conduct a comprehensive overturning calculation for the steel pipe trolley and a shear strength check of the welds to ensure the safety and reliability of the transportation process, and to avoid damaging equipment or affecting the installation process.

title: Discussion on the Design of the Implementation Plan for the Mountain Flood Disaster Prevention Project in Sichuan Province
requirement: Discussion on the Design of the Implementation Plan for the Mountain Flood Disaster Prevention Project in Sichuan Province Under the conditions of complex terrain and landforms, frequent heavy rains, extreme climates, and human activities, complete the design of the implementation plan for the mountain flood disaster prevention project in Sichuan Province, including non-engineering measures and the management of key mountain flood gullies, establishing a dynamic graded management list and an integrated management system based on early warning and forecasting technology.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive solution for the mountain flood disaster prevention project in Sichuan Province. Specifically, first, considering the complex terrain, frequent heavy rainfall, and diverse types of mountain flood disasters in Sichuan Province, dynamic hazard zone and hierarchical management technology are utilized. By re-evaluating and dynamically managing the hazard zones in 175 counties, comprehensive monitoring coverage is ensured. Secondly, to address the issue of extreme rainfall and environmental disturbances potentially exacerbating mountain flood disasters, dynamic early warning indicator analysis technology is adopted, and an accurate early warning mechanism is established through a small watershed rainfall forecasting model and dynamic adjustments. Finally, considering the geological conditions and impact scope of key mountain flood channels, flood pressure is alleviated, and densely populated areas are protected by combining mountain flood channel management technologies, such as constructing riverbank protection, dredging river channels, and arranging flood discharge facilities. Meanwhile, based on the upgrading technology of the provincial monitoring and early warning platform, a dynamic multi-level shared monitoring system is established using big data and cloud computing to provide intelligent and real-time support for flood disaster prevention work. Through this integrated management system, the mountain flood disaster prevention project in Sichuan Province can effectively reduce the frequency and intensity of disasters, safeguard people's lives and property, and promote regional stability and development.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex terrain of Sichuan Province and the prominent seasonality of heavy rainfall distribution, technology0 comprehensively reviews and dynamically updates the hazardous area list through dynamic and graded management techniques of hazardous areas, providing a guarantee for scientific and efficient mountain flood disaster monitoring.

For analysis1, considering the suddenness of torrential rain and earthquakes and the combined impact of human activities, the combination of technology1 and technology3, through dynamic early warning indicator analysis techniques and key mountain flood channel management techniques, achieved more efficient defense and management of natural disaster occurrence mechanisms.

For analysis2, considering the need for dynamic management and classification as well as the complexity of widespread hazardous areas, technology2 has achieved dynamic monitoring and effective management of flash flood disasters across the entire region by upgrading and integrating the provincial monitoring and warning platform, supported by digital technologies and a multi-level information sharing mechanism.

title: Design of the seepage control scheme for the dam foundation of a high earth-rock dam with a thick overburden layer abroad
requirement: Design of the seepage control scheme for the dam foundation of a high earth-rock dam with a thick overburden layer abroad Under the conditions of a thick cover layer, high permeability, and high water head, complete the design of the optimized seepage control scheme for the foundation of the high earth-rock dam, achieving optimal configuration of permeability control, seepage stability assurance, and construction efficiency.
solution: This paper proposes a combined anti-seepage scheme for double-row diaphragm walls under complex conditions of deep overburden. Specifically, firstly, considering the strong permeability of the overburden, single-row diaphragm wall technology is initially employed to address leakage and seepage issues, but the hydraulic gradient is excessively high. Secondly, horizontal coverage is added to extend the seepage path and mitigate the concentration of the hydraulic gradient, though it still struggles to meet standard requirements. Finally, to address high water heads, thick overburden, and complex geological conditions, double-row diaphragm wall technology is adopted, featuring a double-wall design with a spacing of 15.0 m and the reasonable distribution of hydraulic head reduction to lower hydraulic action, ensuring that the head difference stays within a safe range. This approach also overcomes construction interference and improves construction efficiency. The proposed scheme is reasonable and reliable, providing a certain reference value for anti-seepage design in dam foundations with similar deep overburden conditions.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the strong permeability of the thick covering layer, which may cause leakage and seepage issues, the technology0 single-row anti-seepage wall technique is adopted. Combined with curtain grouting, seepage damage can be temporarily controlled, but the risk of excessively high hydraulic gradient still exists.

For analysis1, considering that high water head may cause the seepage wall to bear excessively high hydraulic gradients, technology1 was used to extend the horizontal blanket (400.0 m) to reduce part of the water head. Although the hydraulic gradient is lowered, it still fails to meet the standard requirements.

For analysis1 and analysis2, considering the comprehensive and complex conditions of high water head and thick overburden, the technology2 double-row seepage prevention wall technique was adopted. Through a double-layer design (spacing of 15.0 m), a reasonable distribution of water head and hydraulic gradient was achieved, significantly reducing the maximum hydraulic gradient and meeting regulatory requirements. The separate arrangement of the two walls also resolved construction interference and improved efficiency.

title: Research on the Design and Optimization of the Detection Scheme for Seepage Thermal Pulse Time Domain Reflectometry in Earth-Rock Dams
requirement: Research on the Design and Optimization of the Detection Scheme for Seepage Thermal Pulse Time Domain Reflectometry in Earth-Rock Dams Under the conditions of different seepage velocities in earth-rock dams and soil compaction densities, optimize the detection scheme of the thermal pulse time-domain reflectometry technique, including heating time and sensor placement, to improve measurement accuracy and monitoring performance.
solution: This paper proposes an optimization scheme for the thermal pulse time domain reflectometry technology applied to seepage in earth-rock dams. Specifically, first, considering the significant impact of sensor position on measurement accuracy, the HYDRUS-3D software was used for seepage simulation. By simulating the seepage distribution under different pressure heads of the dam, the placement position of the sensors was optimized, embedding them below the saturation line or the seepage face of the dam. Second, to address measurement errors caused by the rapid dissipation of thermal pulse energy under high seepage velocity conditions, the heating time of the thermal pulse was adjusted. Through experimental validation, the heating time was optimized from 8 seconds to 15 seconds to improve monitoring accuracy under high seepage velocity conditions. Finally, the effectiveness of this optimization scheme was verified under different seepage velocities and soil compaction densities, ensuring the measurement accuracy and application performance of the thermal pulse time domain reflectometry technology.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the one-dimensional flow field characteristics of earth-rock dam seepage and the impact of sensor positioning on measurement accuracy, technology0 was used to simulate dam body seepage. Combined with simulation results, the sensor placement was optimized by positioning the sensors below the phreatic line or the seepage surface of the dam body, thereby improving detection accuracy.

For analysis1, considering the measurement error caused by the thermal pulse energy being easily carried away under high-flow seepage, technology1 was adopted, and the heating time of the thermal pulse was increased from 8 seconds to 15 seconds. It was verified that after the extended heating time optimization scheme, the correlation between the simulation results and the measured values improved, thereby enhancing measurement accuracy.

title: Design of a Rainwater Utilization System Based on Annual Runoff Volume Control Rate: A Case Study of a Residential Community in Chizhou
requirement: Design of a Rainwater Utilization System Based on Annual Runoff Volume Control Rate: A Case Study of a Residential Community in Chizhou Under the conditions of heavy rainfall, complex water demand, and the need to achieve an annual runoff control rate of 55%, design a rainwater recycling system plan that meets the needs of landscaping irrigation, road cleaning, and garage washing through measures such as rainwater collection, infiltration, and sunken green spaces, while optimizing water resource utilization.
solution: This paper proposes a rainwater recycling system scheme based on the annual runoff volume control rate. Specifically, first, considering the issues of rainwater discharge and pollution, permeable pavement and sunken green space technologies are utilized to reduce runoff through rainwater infiltration and storage effects; second, to address the water demand for green area irrigation, road cleaning, and garage washing, a rainwater reuse system is adopted to collect rainwater from rooftops and hard pavements, meeting the water demand and reducing dependence on municipal water supply; finally, by comprehensively applying the above technologies, the site achieves a significant reduction in the annual runoff volume, reaching a control target of 55%, while the utilization rate of non-traditional water sources reaches 4.12%. The use of non-traditional water sources accounts for 100% of the water consumption for green area irrigation and road cleaning, significantly improving the efficiency of water resource utilization.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the waterlogging and pollution issues caused by site rainwater discharge, technology1 and technology2 were selected. Permeable pavement was used to enhance infiltration capacity, and recessed green spaces were employed to improve rainwater retention and infiltration capacity, resulting in a significant reduction in total annual runoff.

For analysis1, considering the water needs for greening irrigation, road flushing, and garage cleaning, the technology0 rainwater reuse system is used to collect rooftop and hard pavement rainwater, fully meeting the demand while reducing municipal water consumption.

For analysis2, considering the comprehensive site runoff coefficient of 0.43 and the goal of achieving a 55% annual runoff control rate, a rainfall control volume of 170m³ is achieved through the rainwater reuse system, and a sunken green space stores 708.24m³, meeting the design requirements for rainfall control.

title: Design of Practical Solutions for Port and Shipping Regulation Projects Based on Slope Protection Technology with Bagged Concrete
requirement: Design of Practical Solutions for Port and Shipping Regulation Projects Based on Slope Protection Technology with Bagged Concrete Under the conditions of low water levels in the Minjiang South Port, reduced sediment, the construction of inland Grade IV waterways, and underwater operations, complete the 35-kilometer port navigation rectification and slope protection project, ensuring the stability of the slope protection structure, compliance with C30 concrete and relevant industry construction standards, while also meeting navigation requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a construction plan for port and navigation regulation engineering based on the geotextile concrete slope protection technology. Specifically, firstly, considering the potential risks of insufficient slope stability and structural instability caused by low water levels and sediment reduction, geotextile concrete slope protection technology and fixation methods are used. Through boundary trench excavation, slope surface modification, and stabilization of geotextiles, a highly stable slope protection structure is formed. Secondly, to meet the demands of construction efficiency under navigable conditions and the challenges of limited space, rapid geotextile laying and sectional filling techniques are adopted. By precise positioning and efficient filling, rapid construction is achieved, significantly shortening the construction period. Finally, to address the requirements for uniformity and durability of concrete filling, high-pressure spring tube grouting and curing techniques are used.
