title: Discussion on Site Selection Planning and Scheme Design for Construction and Operation Management Camps of Pumped Storage Power Stations
requirement: Discussion on Site Selection Planning and Scheme Design for Construction and Operation Management Camps of Pumped Storage Power Stations Under the conditions based on the Mianzhu Pumped Storage Power Station, complete the site selection planning for the construction and operation management camp that takes into account power station operations, traffic convenience, land usability, corporate image, and environmental friendliness, as well as the design task for a fully functional solution.
solution: This paper proposes the site selection and design plan for the construction and operation management camp of the pumped storage power station. Specifically, firstly, regarding site selection planning, considering conditions such as proximity to the load center, convenient transportation, and being far from electromagnetic interference, scientific site selection techniques were used, and through comprehensive analysis, the exact site area located in Guangji Town was determined; secondly, concerning the camp layout and building planning, the "one axis, one core, two belts" overall layout planning principle was adopted, with core buildings reasonably distributed according to their functions, ensuring both convenience for work and living while shaping a spacious and modern corporate image; moreover, for landscape design techniques, local natural and cultural characteristics were integrated, adopting green landscape design and local plant matching techniques, complemented by axis greening and mirror water features, creating a harmonious landscape effect combining modernity and tradition; finally, in façade design and material selection, new energy building material technology was used. By efficiently pairing rock wool panels with energy-saving colored steel panels and elegant color design, a green, energy-saving, low-carbon, and modern camp is created.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the need to be close to the load center and avoid electromagnetic interference, technology0 is used. Through a comprehensive analysis of site selection conditions and the surrounding environment, Guangji Town was chosen as the construction site, effectively reducing the distance between the central control center and the power station and avoiding the impact of natural disasters and electromagnetic interference.

For analysis1, considering the complexity of the functions and the need to highlight the corporate image, technology1 is used. Following the planning principle of "one axis, one core, two belts," office buildings, reception centers, dormitories, and other structures are reasonably distributed to create a functional layout that combines orderliness and flexibility.

For analysis2, considering the need to integrate local culture and environmental protection concepts, technology2 is used. Through axis control and the design with local plants, combined with modern landscape elements such as mirrored water features, a modern and minimalist landscape environment that highlights local humanistic characteristics is created.

For analysis1 and analysis2, to meet the green and low-carbon design requirements, technology3 is adopted. By using new energy building materials such as rock wool panels and energy-saving color steel panels, the insulation and energy-saving performance are enhanced, and the combination of beige and gray tones improves the facade design effect and modern corporate image.

title: Research on the Design of Risk Elimination and Reinforcement Scheme for Bazhou District Water Source Reservoir
requirement: Research on the Design of Risk Elimination and Reinforcement Scheme for Bazhou District Water Source Reservoir Under the conditions of leakage risks in the dam structure, insufficient flood control capacity, damaged water release facilities, and high flood design standards, complete the task of designing the risk elimination and reinforcement plan for the water source reservoir in Bozhou District, aiming to ensure that the dam, flood control facilities, water release facilities, and seepage prevention performance of the reservoir meet safety operation standards.
solution: This article proposes the reinforcement and risk elimination plan for the water source reservoir in Bozhou District. Specifically, first, to address the potential risks caused by dam body leakage and uneven filling, the dam body filling grouting and dam foundation (shoulder) curtain grouting techniques are used, effectively eliminating leakage through optimized grouting construction arrangements. Second, to tackle the insufficient flood discharge capacity of the spillway, the capacity is significantly improved through spillway widening, dredging, and reinforcement transformation techniques. Third, to solve the issue of the culvert being non-operational, culvert restoration and protection technologies are adopted, restoring normal functionality by rebuilding and repairing water intake and drainage facilities. Finally, to meet flood control requirements, a combination of wave wall reconstruction techniques and dry-laid stone slope protection repair technologies is utilized. Through demolition and rebuilding, raising the wave wall, and repairing slope protection, the dam's flood resistance and stability are enhanced, thus thoroughly eliminating safety hazards for the reservoir and ensuring the continuous benefits of the project.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the leakage problem caused by uneven dam filling, technology0 is selected. Through the techniques of dam body filling grouting and dam foundation (abutment) curtain grouting, precise control of pressure and material proportioning is implemented during construction to effectively seal leakage points and enhance the overall stability of the dam body.

For analysis1, considering the issue that severe siltation in the spillway may affect its flood discharge capacity, technology2 was adopted. By widening the inlet and outlet, extending the discharge channel, and dredging while raising the sidewalls, the problems of insufficient flood discharge capacity and poor drainage were resolved.

For analysis2, considering the loss of function of the drainage structure due to aging and damage of the facilities, technology3 is chosen. By reconstructing the inlet, updating the gates and opening/closing devices, and restoring the outlet irrigation channel, the drainage function of the culvert is ensured to return to normal.

For analysis3, considering that the dam crest wave wall does not meet flood resistance requirements and high flood design standards, use technology1 to raise the wave wall to 851.20m and reconstruct the deformed sections, while combining technology4 to repair the dam slope protection and add drainage ditches, ensuring safe operation and stability under flood design conditions.

title: Analysis of the design key points for the rainwater control and utilization system of a newly built water supply plant in Beijing
requirement: Analysis of the design key points for the rainwater control and utilization system of a newly built water supply plant in Beijing In a monsoon climate zone and under the conditions of a high proportion of hardened surfaces, complete an integrated water resource management system to achieve the goals of an annual runoff total control rate of ≥85%, a comprehensive runoff coefficient of ≤0.4, and a stormwater runoff pollution removal rate of ≥70%, while also meeting the 1-in-50-year flood control standard.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for the rainwater utilization system of a newly built water supply plant in Beijing. Specifically, first, considering the monsoon climate zone and the issue of concentrated rainfall, a sunken green space system and rainwater storage pond technology are used to achieve peak shaving control and efficient water resource utilization through detention and storage. Second, to address the high runoff caused by hardened surfaces, permeable paving and rainwater pipeline system technologies are adopted. Permeable paving enhances runoff reduction, and rainwater pipelines improve drainage safety. Finally, for multiple evaluation targets, sunken green spaces, permeable pavements, and storage pond facilities are collaboratively arranged, combined with water quality monitoring and flushing assurance measures. Through optimized design, the system fully meets the requirements for annual runoff control rate, pollutant removal rate, and integrated runoff coefficient, while ensuring the flood prevention capability of the system. Ultimately, the goals of water resource conservation, separation of rainwater and sewage, and recycling are achieved.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the uneven annual distribution of rainfall and the concentration from June to September causing high drainage pressure, use technology0 and technology2. Through the distribution of sunken green areas and centralized storage in retention tanks, the system can operate stably during the flood season and improve rainwater utilization efficiency.

For analysis1, considering the high runoff and difficulties in handling caused by hardened surfaces, technology1 and technology3 are adopted. Permeable pavements are used to reduce the runoff coefficient, combined with the rainwater pipeline system to effectively collect and manage rainwater, thereby alleviating the burden on the drainage system.

For analysis2, considering the requirements to meet the annual runoff volume control rate, runoff pollution removal rate, and comprehensive runoff coefficient, coordinate the use of technology0, technology1, and technology2 through the collaborative layout of detention facilities, permeable pavements, and storage tanks, while also introducing the water quality management of technology4 to further enhance pollution removal effectiveness and meet the wastewater reuse standards.

title: Design and discussion of the reserved river formation scheme using geotextile tubes in newly dredged fill areas.
requirement: Design and discussion of the reserved river formation scheme using geotextile tubes in newly dredged fill areas. Under the conditions of high water content and low-strength soil in the newly dredged-fill enclosure area, implement the reserved river construction plan to form a stable river channel structure and meet the requirements of flood control, drainage, ecology, economy, and construction efficiency.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for reserving river channels using mud-filled geotextile tubes in newly dredged soil reclamation areas. Specifically, considering the challenges of low soil strength and wave flow erosion, which may result in slow construction progress and slope sliding, the mud-filled geotextile tube technique is used. By setting up a geotextile tubular framework and drainage measures, a river slope structure is formed, reducing construction risks. Secondly, to meet the ecological and stability requirements of riverbank protection, the greening concrete slope protection technique is employed, which optimizes materials and structural forms to balance cost-effectiveness and ecological benefits. Finally, to ensure slope stability and settlement control, monitoring and quantitative evaluation techniques are applied. Through simulation and verification of design using monitoring data, project quality is assured. By integrating these technologies, the proposed solution achieves the goals of economical, reliable, efficient, and environmentally friendly river engineering, providing a reference for subsequent project implementation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of high construction difficulty and cost due to the low strength of dredged fill soil, the technology0 mud-filled geotextile bag technique is used to preform a river structure within the enclosure and provide a construction platform. At the same time, the use of anti-aging geotextiles reduces the impact of wave erosion, enhances river stability, and lowers construction risks.

For analysis0, considering the insufficient stability of riverbank slopes and the ecological requirements, the technology1 greening concrete slope protection technique is used. Through the combined use of greening concrete and turf slope protection structures, slope stability and ecological effects are improved, ensuring a balance between flood control, drainage, and landscape demands.

For analysis0, to ensure the adaptability of engineering settlement and slope as well as to verify technical feasibility, technology2 monitoring and quantitative evaluation techniques were used. By simulating settlement and slope stability in combination with on-site monitoring, the engineering deformation situation was understood, construction was adjusted in a timely manner, and the overall safety and practicality of the project were ensured.

title: Analysis of grouting feasibility and scheme design for the Xinji Reservoir curtain.
requirement: Analysis of grouting feasibility and scheme design for the Xinji Reservoir curtain. Under the conditions of weak strata such as Cretaceous argillaceous siltstone and silty mudstone, as well as high bedrock permeability and strict seepage control standards, complete the curtain grouting of the dam foundation for the Xinji Reservoir to improve anti-seepage performance and meet the seepage control requirements of no less than 5 meters below the 5 Lu line underground.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for curtain grouting of the foundation of the Xinji Reservoir dam. Specifically, first, considering the weak and highly permeable Cretaceous strata, which may face the challenge of the rock mass failing to form an effective barrier, curtain grouting construction technology is used to inject cement slurry to reduce permeability. Secondly, addressing the complex situation of high permeability in the deep bedrock and stringent underground seepage control standards for the dam foundation, a single-row grouting hole arrangement scheme is adopted, optimizing the hole spacing to 2 meters and the grouting depth to extend below the 5 Lu line to ensure the integrity of the curtain. Additionally, based on the corrosive characteristics of groundwater containing sulfate ions, sulfate-resistant cement is selected to ensure the long-term stability and chemical resistance of the curtain structure. Ultimately, through the implementation of these techniques and construction plans, the permeability of the dam foundation bedrock reduces to less than 3 Lu, meeting the regulatory requirements for seepage control construction, significantly improving the dam's seepage resistance performance and ensuring the project's safety.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of weak and high permeability in Cretaceous strata, the technology0 curtain grouting construction technique was used. By injecting cement slurry material into the bedrock to form a seepage-proof barrier, the permeability of the rock mass was greatly reduced.

For analysis1, considering the high anti-seepage control standards and the deep covering layer issues, the technology1 single-row grouting hole arrangement scheme was adopted. Through optimizing hole spacing and designing to go deeper than 5 Lu lines, the continuity of the curtain and the anti-seepage effect meeting the standards were ensured. In addition, to address the durability issues caused by sulfate ion-containing groundwater, sulfate-resistant cement from technology2 was used, further enhancing the anti-seepage performance and chemical stability of the curtain.

title: Emergency repair scheme design for the 1# inverted siphon project in Zhaopingtai irrigation area.
requirement: Emergency repair scheme design for the 1# inverted siphon project in Zhaopingtai irrigation area. Under the conditions of the siphon project damage, compounded flood peak complexities, and high water flow scouring, complete the emergency repair of the No. 1 siphon project in the Zhaopingtai irrigation area, restore the normal water conveyance and irrigation function of the irrigation area, and the flood discharge capacity of the reservoir, ensuring the project meets the 20-year design and 50-year verification flood control standards.
solution: This paper proposes an emergency repair plan for the No. 1 inverted siphon project in the Zhaoping Terrace irrigation area. Specifically, firstly, considering the damage and cracks on the upper part of the inverted siphon, inverted siphon crack repair technology and tunnel body damage repair technology are adopted, restoring the structural integrity of the tunnel body through epoxy mortar crack injection and on-site reconstruction with C30 concrete. Secondly, under the complex conditions of superimposed flood peak flows, flood design and superimposed calculations are conducted to ensure the repair plan meets the flood prevention standards of 1-in-20-year design and 1-in-50-year verification. Lastly, addressing the high water flow erosion problem in the tailrace channel, upper protective engineering technologies are applied, including the installation of a gravel cover layer, gabion net boxes, and tooth walls extending into the riverbed to comprehensively enhance flood control and erosion resistance. After the repair, the project achieved the dual objectives of water conveyance for irrigation and safe flood discharge, ensuring the agricultural production in the irrigation area and the flood safety of the reservoir.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the destruction of the upper structure of the siphon and the exposure of the tunnel roof, technology0 is adopted. The cracks are sealed using epoxy mortar grouting technology to ensure the integrity of the concrete tunnel structure, and the damaged tunnel structure is repaired using technology3 to restore the functionality of the project.

For analysis1, considering the complex conditions of a peak flood flow as high as 884 m³/s, technology2 is adopted. The repair design and verification are carried out through maximum peak flood overlay calculations to ensure that the repair meets the requirements of the 20-year return period design and the 50-year return period verification standards.

For analysis2, considering the issue of high water volume in the tailwater channel scouring the upper structure, technology1 is adopted. By setting a sand-pebble layer and Gabion mesh covering layer (with a total thickness of 3.5 meters) on the top of the inverted siphon, and arranging tooth walls upstream and downstream to penetrate 2.5 meters and 4.5 meters into the riverbed, the anti-scour capability of the protective structure is enhanced to ensure its stability.

title: Research on the Design of the Operation and Maintenance Plan for the Smart River Informatization Comprehensive Management System
requirement: Research on the Design of the Operation and Maintenance Plan for the Smart River Informatization Comprehensive Management System Under the complex conditions of covering the full business application and lifecycle management of river channels, establish a real-time, visualized, mobile, and comprehensive intelligent river channel integrated information management system, including monitoring equipment operation and maintenance, software platform operation and maintenance, integrated services, and emergency operation and maintenance.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive operation and maintenance plan covering the entire life cycle of river channel informatization. Specifically, firstly, considering the wide coverage of the system and the complexity of multi-source data integration, water environment automatic monitoring and operation technology as well as information data system operation technology are used to ensure data integrity and management efficiency through daily monitoring, data backup, and integration. Secondly, addressing the accuracy and stability issues that monitoring equipment may face during long-term operation, engineering operation status monitoring system operation technology is adopted, and regular remote inspections, maintenance, and repairs are conducted to ensure the stability of equipment and system operation. Finally, to meet the high-performance requirements of real-time monitoring and emergency handling on the platform, information data system technology and emergency response technology are employed. Through comprehensive optimization plans and emergency service teams, unexpected situations in system operation are resolved, ensuring the long-term stable operation of the system.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complexity of multi-source data integration and global operation challenges, the automatic water environment monitoring technology provided by technology0 and technology2, as well as the operation and maintenance technology of the information data system, ensure the accuracy of data collection, integration capability, and long-term scalability.

For analysis1, considering the need for long-term efficient operation of the equipment, which may face issues with monitoring accuracy and response speed, the operational and maintenance technology of technology1 engineering operation status monitoring system was adopted. Through daily inspections, regular maintenance, and comprehensive overhauls during the flood season, the stability of equipment operation was enhanced.

For analysis2, considering the platform's real-time performance, compatibility, and emergency needs, use technology 2 and technology 3, and optimize platform performance and ensure rapid response capabilities in case of accidents through information data system operation and maintenance technology and emergency response technology.

title: Research on the optimization of design parameters for the support scheme of the large deformation buffer layer in a diversion tunnel.
requirement: Research on the optimization of design parameters for the support scheme of the large deformation buffer layer in a diversion tunnel. Under the conditions of high ground stress in soft rock and significant time-dependent deformation of the surrounding rock, optimize the buffer layer material (platform stress σpe and compressibility εpe) and thickness parameters, and design a reasonable buffer layer support scheme to reduce the maximum stress on the tunnel lining by 20%~30% while ensuring the long-term safe operation of the tunnel.
solution: This paper proposes a buffer layer support scheme based on platform stress, compressibility, and thickness optimization. Specifically, firstly, considering the challenge of surrounding rock pressure and the densification phase of the buffer layer potentially weakening its energy absorption capability, buffer layer material parameter optimization technology (σpe=0.5MPa, εpe≥0.6) is used to provide sufficient energy absorption capacity and reduce the degree of plastic damage to the lining. Secondly, addressing the lack of scientific basis for thickness and material parameter design, viscoelastic-plastic model inversion technology combined with thickness optimization technology is employed, optimizing the buffer layer thickness to 10 cm to accommodate the surrounding rock's time-dependent deformation absorption needs during the operational period. Finally, through numerical simulation analysis and comparison of the support effects before and after optimization, the optimization measures are shown to reduce the maximum principal stress of the lining by 20%~30%, significantly improve the stress uniformity of the lining, and ensure the safety of long-term tunnel operation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of surrounding rock pressure reaching 0.36 MPa and the buffer layer easily entering the compaction stage with insufficient energy absorption capacity, technology0 is adopted. By adjusting the platform stress σpe of the buffer layer material to 0.5 MPa and the compressibility εpe to ≥0.6, the buffer layer fully absorbs energy, preventing the lining from bearing excessive concentrated stress.

For analysis1, considering the lack of theoretical guidance in the design of materials and thickness, technology1 and technology2 are adopted. By changing the buffer layer thickness to 10 cm and using numerical inversion technology to simulate the surrounding rock deformation over 50 years of operation, it ensures that the design thickness and energy absorption characteristics of the buffer layer match the deformation characteristics of the surrounding rock.

For analysis2, considering the challenge that a thin buffer layer is insufficient to absorb surrounding rock deformation in the long term, technology1 is adopted. By increasing the buffer layer thickness to 10 cm, its energy absorption capacity is enhanced, while avoiding additional risks caused by excessive thickness, ensuring the optimal support effect of the buffer layer.

title: Key design points of the ferry terminal scheme for a nuclear power plant
requirement: Key design points of the ferry terminal scheme for a nuclear power plant While ensuring the functional requirements of the nuclear power plant ferry terminal, it is necessary to complete the terminal layout and structural design. Under complex tidal currents, wind and wave conditions, and geological factors, a plan must be proposed to meet the needs of patrolling, emergency response, and small-scale personnel and material transportation, while controlling subsequent maintenance costs.
solution: This paper proposes a traffic boat terminal solution that combines layout planning and structural design. Specifically, first, considering the functional requirements of a nuclear power plant, such as preventing emergencies and transporting personnel and materials, as well as potential challenges like wind waves and silt accumulation, a high-pile pier technique is used to set up a five-level boarding platform, and an island-type breakwater is integrated to enhance environmental shielding conditions. Second, to address the issue of silt accumulation in the harbor basin caused by complex tidal currents, floating dock technology is adopted, utilizing an economically low-cost floating box structure to simplify construction and improve adaptability to water levels. Finally, to tackle structural stability issues such as soft cohesive soil foundations and seismic fortification, a gravity block structure is employed to optimize bearing capacity, while reducing excavation volume to lower costs, ensuring the terminal operates efficiently and cost-effectively.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the functional requirements of berthing, protection, and adaptation to different water level conditions, technology1 high-pile wharf technology and technology3 island-style breakwater were used to design a 5-level elevation docking platform while simultaneously providing wave protection, reducing the impact of typhoons or severe weather on functionality.

For analysis1, considering the issue of harbor basin siltation caused by high wind speed waves and sediment-carrying tidal currents, technology2 floating dock technology and technology3 island-style breakwater are utilized. The floating structure adapts to water level changes, while the island-style breakwater is set up to shield against wave impacts and control the siltation issue.

For analysis2, considering the settlement risks of clayey foundations and insufficient seismic stability, the technology0 gravity block structure is used to reduce excavation volume by controlling the weight of individual blocks, while enhancing foundation bearing capacity to ensure seismic stability and long-term durability of the structure.

title: Design and Research on the Safety Reinforcement Scheme of a Reservoir Dam
requirement: Design and Research on the Safety Reinforcement Scheme of a Reservoir Dam Under the conditions of a dam crest elevation of 102.16m, a maximum dam height of 30.45m, uneven fill quality, a seepage evaluation rating of B, and locally high permeability coefficients, complete the design task for the dam risk elimination and reinforcement plan, focusing on improving the compaction of the dam fill and overall stability, reducing seepage risks, and enhancing the operational safety of the dam.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive plan for the reinforcement and upgrading of a reservoir dam. Specifically, firstly, considering the seepage risks that may be caused by uneven backfill quality and low compaction density of the dam body, grouting technology was employed. Low-pressure gravity grouting was used to fill cracks and voids, improving the compaction and stability of the dam body. Secondly, in response to the seepage risk caused by the dam seepage rating of Grade B and improper treatment of the contact points between the backfill layer and residual soil layer, high-pressure jet grouting cutoff wall technology was adopted. High-pressure grouting formed a continuous cutoff wall, effectively blocking seepage paths. Lastly, in light of the high permeability coefficient and significant localized risks in the dam shoulders, multi-head small-diameter deep cement mixing piles were used to form an impermeable structure in the dam shoulder area, enhancing the seepage prevention performance in key areas. With these measures, the research results showed significant improvement in seepage conditions of the dam, with overall stability meeting relevant standards, providing a reference for the reinforcement and upgrading of reservoir dams.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the leakage risks caused by uneven fill quality and low compaction of the dam body, technology0 grouting technology was adopted. Through gravity-based low-pressure grouting, cracks and voids in the dam body were filled, improving the compactness of the fill and reducing the leakage issues.

For analysis1, considering that the dam seepage safety assessment is grade B, on-site investigations found improper connection between the fill and residual soil layers, possibly resulting in leakage paths. By adopting technology1 high-pressure jet grouting cut-off wall technology to form a continuous impermeable curtain wall, the leakage paths were effectively blocked, improving the seepage performance of the dam body.

For analysis2, considering the high permeability coefficient of the dam shoulder and the significant seepage risks, the technology2 multi-head small-diameter deep cement mixing pile technique is employed. By forming a localized seepage cutoff structure at the dam shoulder, the seepage prevention effect is enhanced, and the leakage risk is reduced, effectively addressing the issue of improper treatment at the dam shoulder contact.

title: Design of the dewatering scheme for a deep excavation in a long-distance water transfer project near the Yellow River.
requirement: Design of the dewatering scheme for a deep excavation in a long-distance water transfer project near the Yellow River. Under complex conditions such as highly permeable strata, great excavation depth, and close interaction between surface water and groundwater, complete the dewatering task for the deep foundation pit of the long-distance water conveyance project, ensuring that the water level in the pit is lowered to meet the design requirements of 6–12 meters and satisfies geological stability and construction progress requirements during the construction process.
solution: This paper proposes a dewatering scheme for extremely permeable strata and complex underground water conditions. Specifically, firstly, given the extremely high permeability of the strata and the significant water inflow, the pipe well dewatering technique is employed. By arranging dewatering wells and optimizing calculation, the pumping volume is reasonably controlled. Secondly, to address the challenges of large excavation depth and high water level reduction requirements, finite element seepage analysis technology is utilized. Through simulation calculations, the spacing of dewatering wells is optimized to 10 m, ensuring construction safety and stability. Finally, considering the challenge of rapid surface water replenishment to groundwater, the suspended anti-seepage curtain technique is integrated. Anti-seepage walls with a depth of 15 m are installed 5 m on both sides of the foundation pit, effectively separating the surface water from the groundwater recharge area inside the pit, reducing the operational burden of the dewatering equipment and ensuring the smooth progress of foundation pit dewatering construction.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the formation's extremely high permeability leading to a large water inflow, technology0 was selected. By arranging dewatering wells for large-scale underground water extraction, combined with technology2 for precise calculation of water inflow, reasonable dewatering well arrangements and water volume control were achieved.

For analysis1, considering the large excavation depth and significant water level drawdown requirement, technology2 is used. Through simulation analysis of different dewatering well spacings (5~15 m), the spacing is optimized to 10 m, ensuring the water level drawdown meets design requirements while reducing the number of equipment.

For analysis2, considering the issue of surface water rapidly recharging groundwater, combined with technology1, a 15-meter-deep impermeable curtain is set up 5 meters on both sides of the foundation pit to mitigate the impact of surface water on the dewatering effect of the foundation pit, effectively reducing the requirements for dewatering equipment configuration and operating and maintenance costs.

title: Summary of the Soil and Water Conservation Plan Design for the Flood Control Project of the Daehe River in Huanren County
requirement: Summary of the Soil and Water Conservation Plan Design for the Flood Control Project of the Daehe River in Huanren County During the construction process of the Huanren County Daeer River flood control project, complete the tasks of soil erosion prediction and prevention, including the reasonable zoning and arrangement of measure systems, effectively controlling new soil erosion, protecting the ecological environment, and maintaining the flood control functionality of the project.
solution: This paper proposes a soil and water conservation plan for the flood control management project of Da'er River in Huanren County. Specifically, first, considering the surface damage and soil erosion caused by construction, the techniques of broadcasting grass seeds, planting Amorpha fruticosa, and slope surface soil covering are adopted. By increasing vegetation coverage and the stability of surface soil, the additional soil erosion during the construction and natural recovery periods is significantly reduced. Second, measures such as site leveling are implemented in ecologically sensitive areas to restore the river's flood discharge capacity and enhance the ecological functions of the region in combination with plant coverage. Finally, to address the risks of soil erosion in the construction site areas and cofferdam zones, temporary drainage ditches and site leveling are constructed to optimize water flow management in the construction area, ensuring the realization of the soil and water conservation objectives and achieving the economic and effective implementation of the plan.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the risk of soil erosion caused by earth excavation and exposed surfaces, technology0 and technology1 are adopted. Through surface soil covering and vegetation measures (sowing grass seeds, replanting Amorpha fruticosa), the surface is stabilized, and vegetation coverage is increased, thereby reducing the additional soil erosion during the construction period and the natural recovery period.

For analysis1, considering the ecological environment sensitivity and the risk of soil nutrient loss, use technology0 and technology3, through site leveling and vegetation restoration measures, to enhance regional ecological functions and reduce the impact of soil and water loss on the ecological environment.

For analysis2, considering the issue of severe soil erosion disturbance in the cofferdam construction area and the construction site control area, technology2 and technology3 are adopted. Temporary drainage ditches are used to divert runoff while restoring the flood discharge function of the river in the construction area, thereby effectively preventing the further deterioration of river silting and soil erosion.

title: Design of the Pin-and-Rod Platform Scheme for the Maintenance Gate at the Inlet of Liyuan Hydropower Station
requirement: Design of the Pin-and-Rod Platform Scheme for the Maintenance Gate at the Inlet of Liyuan Hydropower Station Under the actual conditions of the maintenance gate holes at the water inlet and the flood discharge and sand flushing tunnels, complete the safe and efficient task of inserting the gate rod pin while reducing the risk of personnel falling from heights and equipment slipping.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for the rod-through-pin platform of the intake gate maintenance at the Liyuan Hydropower Station. Specifically, first, considering the issues of limited space for pin adjustment and heavy weight, a combination of a gantry platform and a primary platform design is utilized. Through adjustable rollers and screw drive, precise positioning of the pin is achieved, improving operational efficiency. Second, to address the risks of falls and slips due to the lack of an operational platform at height, an integrated design of gantry, primary, and secondary platforms provides a safe and stable working environment. Third, to meet the diverse sizes and adjustment needs of the pins, a rod pin support bracket design is adopted, which solves the problems through track fixation and angle adjustment with clamps. Finally, during pin withdrawal, a pin ejection device is used, achieving efficient removal of the pin axis via a screw and nut mechanism. Moreover, the overall design scheme is validated through finite element simulation analysis to ensure structural strength and reliability, guaranteeing a safe and stable operation process. This scheme effectively resolves the problems of low efficiency and high safety risks in existing operations and can be promoted to similar hydropower station operational scenarios.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of small adjustment space and heavy pin operation, use technology0 and technology1 to achieve precise forward and backward adjustment and safe transmission of the pin through the overhead platform and the first-level platform, thereby optimizing the efficiency of pin operation.

For analysis1, considering the potential risks of falling from height and pin slippage due to the lack of a fixed work platform, a combination of technology0, technology1, and technology2 is adopted. Through the design of multi-layer platforms and the configuration of guardrails, a safe and stable working environment is provided for operators, effectively preventing accidents involving personnel and equipment.

Considering the demand for different sizes of pin shafts and adjustment angles during the pin insertion process, technology3 is adopted to provide a stable bracket adjustment mechanism for pin shafts of various sizes, further improving operational precision and flexibility.

In the pin withdrawal operation, to avoid the inconvenience and inefficiency of manual disassembly, technology4 is used to achieve the efficient withdrawal of the pin shaft through the screw-nut structural design.

Consider strength and reliability analysis in the overall structural design, adopt technology5, and ensure the platform's adaptability and safety under all operating conditions through finite element simulation.

title: Design and Analysis of Dam Reinforcement and Risk Mitigation Plans for Hydraulic Engineering — Taking the Shiziyuan Small Reservoir Risk Mitigation and Reinforcement Project as an Example
requirement: Design and Analysis of Dam Reinforcement and Risk Mitigation Plans for Hydraulic Engineering — Taking the Shiziyuan Small Reservoir Risk Mitigation and Reinforcement Project as an Example Under the conditions of insufficient dam crest elevation, lack of flood control capacity, and leakage in the dam body, complete the design and construction of the reinforcement and risk elimination project for the Shiziyuan small reservoir dam to ensure the dam stability coefficient meets the standard, solve the leakage problem, improve flood control capacity, and enhance reservoir management facilities to meet modern operation requirements.
solution: This article proposes a risk mitigation and reinforcement plan to address the issues of insufficient safety and operational capacity of the small reservoir dam in the persimmon orchard. Specifically, firstly, considering the inadequate flood control standards of the existing dam crest and the collapse threats posed by low dam elevation and poor drainage, the plan uses dam material selection and filling standard techniques, along with back slope optimization techniques, to enhance dam design and optimize drainage structure to improve flood control functionality. Secondly, to solve the severe seepage problem of the dam, the plan adopts cement-soil mixing pile cutoff wall technology to set up an effective impermeable wall between the upstream and downstream slopes of the dam, thereby enhancing the overall stability of the dam. Furthermore, addressing the issue of inadequate spillway capacity, the plan utilizes optimized spillway design techniques to reinforce the diversion walls and chute structure while widening the flow path section. Lastly, to compensate for the deficiencies in the management system, the plan strengthens the comprehensive operational efficiency and safety management of the reservoir by constructing management facilities and installing automated monitoring equipment.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the insufficient existing dam crest elevation and the damaged structure of the upstream and downstream slopes, use technology0 to select suitable dam materials to ensure their physical and mechanical properties meet the standards, and enhance the flood control capacity and upstream drainage performance of the secondary dam by constructing new slope-attached drainage bodies and optimizing the drainage ditch structure with technology2.

For analysis1, considering the weak construction history of the dam body, unknown material properties, and leakage issues, technology1 was used to design a cement-soil mixing pile cutoff wall, which is arranged parallel to the dam axis, greatly reducing leakage and enhancing the stability of the dam body.

For analysis2, to address the deficiencies in management facilities and insufficient monitoring capabilities, technology4 is adopted to achieve technological and modern management and operation of the reservoir through the construction of new management warehouses and intelligent monitoring equipment.

title: Design of the coordination plan for the installation of electromechanical equipment and civil construction in hydraulic engineering.
requirement: Design of the coordination plan for the installation of electromechanical equipment and civil construction in hydraulic engineering. Under the conditions where construction drawings may have deviations, hole positioning accuracy is insufficient, cable holes and lifting rings are not adequately reserved, and secondary concrete treatment is poor, complete the coordination task between the installation of hydropower engineering electromechanical equipment and civil construction, ensuring that installation accuracy and construction quality meet the standards.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive solution to address issues such as construction drawing deviations, insufficient hole positioning accuracy, incomplete reserved structures, and foundation pouring problems. Specifically, first, considering the challenge of increased installation difficulty caused by drawing data deviations, a depth audit technique is employed for precise calibration to ensure compliance with dimensions and elevations. Second, to address the risk of hole deviation caused by template material deformation, template support optimization and high-precision positioning technologies are adopted to enhance template strength and ensure that the holes meet design requirements. Third, for the risks posed by complex cable routing to the protective layer, cable path optimization technology is used to enlarge turning radii and adjust layouts for efficient cable installation. Additionally, for issues caused by omissions of lifting rings affecting lifting operations, specialized techniques for embedding lifting rings are applied with reasonable layout and strength control. Finally, to mitigate risks of poor quality in secondary concrete pouring of foundations, refined processing techniques are employed, including pad welding and area cleaning, ensuring the strength and positional stability of equipment foundations. These measures effectively advance the progress of hydraulic engineering construction and improve project quality.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issue of increased installation difficulty caused by deviations in construction drawing data, technology0 is adopted for in-depth drawing review to calibrate the equipment foundation dimensions and elevations, achieving precise construction.

For analysis1, considering the issue of reserved hole deviations caused by the deformation of support templates, technology1 was adopted to strengthen the template support materials and optimize the positioning line accuracy, ensuring the accuracy of hole positions and dimensions.

For analysis2, considering the risk of protective layer damage potentially caused by complex cable turns, technology2 is used to optimize the cable bending radius and trench layout, avoiding installation difficulties and future failures.

For analysis3, considering the impact of missing lifting rings on equipment lifting operations, use technology3 to reasonably embed lifting rings to enhance concrete strength and the accuracy of lifting positions.

For analysis4, considering that the quality issues of the secondary concrete foundation may affect equipment stability, technology4 is used to clean the concrete foundation and weld shims to ensure sufficient coverage of the pouring and avoid equipment deviation.

title: Research on the Design of an Oil-Water Separation Scheme for the Drainage System of a Hydropower Plant
requirement: Research on the Design of an Oil-Water Separation Scheme for the Drainage System of a Hydropower Plant In the hydropower station plant's leakage drainage system, design and implement an efficient oil-water separation solution for leakage water with complex sources and unstable oil content, ensuring that the treated wastewater meets discharge standards without causing environmental pollution, complies with environmental protection requirements, and ensures the system is stable, reliable, and easy to maintain.
solution: This paper proposes an oil-water separation solution for the leakage drainage system of hydropower plant buildings. Specifically, first, considering the issue of oily wastewater potentially contaminating rivers during normal operation and maintenance, static separation technology based on density differences is employed to remove most of the floating oil through initial settling and layering, achieving primary purification treatment. Second, addressing the complexity of wastewater sources, a multi-stage separation technology is adopted, using primary and secondary separation wells and plate-type oil-water separators to achieve fine treatment of complex oily wastewater, ensuring that discharges meet standards. Finally, to tackle the challenge of deep well oily waste processing, floating oil recovery technology is utilized, with coupled submersible pumps regularly collecting floating oil, enhancing maintenance convenience and improving the stability of long-term system operation. These measures, combined with the actual structural conditions of the plant and environmental protection requirements, provide an economical, efficient, and environmentally friendly wastewater treatment solution.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that oily wastewater generated during normal operation and maintenance may pollute rivers, the technology0 density difference static separation technology is used to remove most of the floating oil through preliminary separation, ensuring primary purification treatment.

For analysis1, considering the complexity of wastewater types and sources, utilize the technology2 multi-stage separation technology combination. By setting up a primary separation well, a secondary separation well, and a plate oil-water separator, handle complex oily wastewater from multiple sources to enhance treatment capacity and effectiveness.

For analysis2, considering the challenges of deep well treatment, technology1 oil recovery technology is adopted. A coupled submersible pump is used to periodically collect the floating oil in the deep water collection well, ensuring the system can operate continuously and stably while facilitating subsequent maintenance.

title: Design of the drainage and dewatering scheme during the construction period of the Jiangsu Zhengji River Water Conservancy Project
requirement: Design of the drainage and dewatering scheme during the construction period of the Jiangsu Zhengji River Water Conservancy Project Under the conditions of the non-flood season, low site precipitation, shallow groundwater table, and significant differences in river flow rates, complete the river channel management tasks for the Zhengji South Branch River and Liangxi River, as well as the construction of structures along the line, ensuring the safety of diversion, dewatering of foundation pits, and cofferdam engineering in the construction area.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive dewatering and drainage solution for the construction of the Zhengji River water conservancy project during the non-flood season. Specifically, first, considering that heavy rain may cause flooding and water accumulation in the construction area, diversion and interception works along with temporary pumping station technologies are adopted. Conventional flow and rainwater accumulation are managed through cofferdams to ensure the construction area remains dry. Second, to address the issue of shallow groundwater levels at the site, the wellpoint dewatering method is employed by reasonably arranging wells (16 wells, 20 meters in depth, and 20 meters apart) to stabilize the groundwater level in the construction area, ensuring the safety of the foundation pit. Finally, for the river works requiring flow control using cofferdams, a homogenous earth cofferdam technique is used. Measures such as optimizing cofferdam slope ratios (1:3 above water, 1:5 below water) and laying access roads are implemented to enhance the cofferdam’s stability and multifunctionality. Additionally, under specific conditions of heavy rain and floods, a temporary pumping station drainage plan has been designed, with each heavy rain event requiring a drainage volume of 932,200 m³, and a total of 1,864,400 m³ for the entire project duration, ensuring smooth drainage and preventing water accumulation in the construction area.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that heavy rain may cause flooding and water accumulation in the construction area, use technology0 and technology3 to conduct regular watershed drainage through cofferdam diversion, and activate a temporary pumping station during heavy rain to quickly pump out accumulated water, reducing the risk of flooding.

For analysis1, considering that shallow buried groundwater levels may lead to seepage and foundation instability, technology2 is adopted. By reasonably planning the spacing of wellpoints (20m) and arranging deep wells (20m), combined with a drainage plan, the groundwater level is lowered to a safe level for construction.

For analysis2, considering the need for homogeneous soil cofferdams to control water flow in river engineering, use technology1 to optimize cofferdam parameters such as slope ratio, water level overtopping, and crest width settings to ensure the stability and reliability of the cofferdam while meeting the requirements of construction access roads.

title: Scheme design for the reinforcement and danger elimination project of Zhongcun Reservoir in Xinfeng County, Jiangxi.
requirement: Scheme design for the reinforcement and danger elimination project of Zhongcun Reservoir in Xinfeng County, Jiangxi. Under the conditions of high permeability of the Nakamu Reservoir dam body, strong permeability of the dam foundation, functional failure of the drainage system, incomplete construction of the spillway, and structural defects in the water conveyance system, comprehensive reinforcement of the main and auxiliary dams, dam foundation, drainage prism, spillway, and water conveyance system is implemented to ensure the safe operation and functional restoration of the reservoir.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive plan for the reinforcement and risk elimination of Nakamura Reservoir. Specifically, first, considering the high permeability of the dam body, plastic concrete cutoff walls and high-pressure jet grouting are used to reduce the permeability of the dam body and foundation and enhance the structural impervious capability. Second, to address the strong permeability and seepage issues of the dam foundation, curtain grouting and cutoff walls are constructed to form a waterproof barrier and enhance the stability of the dam foundation. To tackle the deficiency in the drainage system function, the drainage prism is reconstructed, and slope drainage and filter layer designs are added to restore normal drainage functionality. Addressing the inadequate flood discharge capacity of the spillway, structural risks are eliminated, and drainage efficiency is improved through slope cutting, reconstruction with concrete lining, and heightening the sidewalls. Finally, to mitigate the risk of cracks in the water conveyance system, a new water conveyance tunnel is constructed to replace the original system, ensuring the safety and reliability of the water conveyance function.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the high permeability of the dam body, use technology0 and technology1 to reduce the dam body's permeability and improve overall impermeability by constructing a clay core wall and a jet grouting cutoff wall.

For analysis1, due to the strong permeability of the dam foundation and the issue of seepage bypassing the dam, technology0 and technology1 are used, with the application of plastic concrete cut-off walls and curtain grouting to form an effective water barrier and enhance the stability of the dam foundation.

For analysis2, where the drainage prism failure leads to poor drainage performance, technology2 is used to restore normal drainage function by reconstructing the prism and adding slope drainage and filter layer designs, protecting the dam toe from erosion.

For analysis3, addressing the insufficient overflow capacity of the spillway and unstable slopes, technology3 is used to enhance the drainage capacity of the spillway and ensure slope stability by slope cutting, slope flattening, reconstructing concrete linings, and raising the sidewalls.

For analysis4, addressing the hidden dangers caused by cracks and exposed reinforcement in the water conveyance system, use technology4 to seal the original water conveyance system and construct a new tunnel, ensuring the reliability and safety of the water conveyance function.

title: Stability analysis of the Jitian Port dike in Jiangxi and design of the risk-removal and reinforcement plan
requirement: Stability analysis of the Jitian Port dike in Jiangxi and design of the risk-removal and reinforcement plan Under the conditions of steep local slopes of the embankment body, severe settlement deformation, riverbank erosion and collapse due to scouring, and flood control standards below the 10-year flood level at Chitian Port Embankment in Fengxin County, perform seepage stability analysis, embankment slope stability analysis, and design functional reinforcement plans to ensure compliance with the 10-year flood defense requirements, safeguarding people's lives, property, and agricultural production safety.
solution: This paper proposes a plan for improving the stability and strengthening the safety of the Chitian Port dike. Specifically, first, considering issues such as steep local slopes of the dike body, settlement deformation, and riverbank erosion, dike body slope reinforcement technology was employed. By optimizing the width of the dike crest to 4.0m and the slope ratio to 1:2.5, the overall stability of the dike body was enhanced. Second, to address the problem of the flood control standard being lower than the water level of a 10-year recurrence interval flood, dike body reinforcement technology and U-shaped channel lining technology were applied. The elevation of the dike crest was designed to be raised to 1.2m above the flood level, and the UD100 U-shaped channel lining technology was used to improve channel smoothness, thereby enhancing the dike's drainage capacity. Third, to solve the issue of low permeation and slope stability margins of the dike foundation and slope, seepage and anti-sliding stability design verification technology was employed. By calculating the seepage gradient parameters of the dike slope and foundation, the compliance of the seepage stability design was ensured. Lastly, to tackle the problem of long-term erosion of the riverbank, gabion revetment construction technology was utilized. By filling the gabion boxes with stones and tying them securely, the dike toe and the river's non-flooding surface area were effectively protected.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of steep local embankment slopes, settlement deformation, and riverbank erosion, technology0 is used in combination with slope reinforcement and thickening treatment. By optimizing the design of the slope ratio and embankment crest width, the overall stability of the embankment is improved.

For analysis1, considering the issue of the flood control standard being lower than the 10-year flood level, technology0 is adopted for the embankment design, raising the embankment crest elevation to the flood level plus 1.2m to ensure that the flood control capacity of the reinforced embankment crest meets the regulatory requirements. At the same time, technology1 is used to line the embankment toe ditches with U-shaped channels to ensure smooth drainage.

For analysis2, considering the issue of low safety margins for the stability of the dam foundation and dam slope, technology2 is used for seepage and anti-sliding stability reviews. By calculating the allowable seepage gradient of the dam slope and foundation, its safety is verified. Meanwhile, the design parameters are adjusted in line with the characteristics of fine sand and medium-coarse sand layers at the dam toe to ensure that the seepage stability meets the requirements.

For analysis0 and analysis1, considering the long-term erosion of the riverbanks and the need to protect the local toe of the embankment, the technology3 gabion mattress construction technique is adopted. By filling with stones and binding the cage group, the stability of the embankment toe is enhanced, and riverbank erosion damage is reduced.

title: Research on the Design and Quality Control of Ecological Gabion Riverbank Protection Structure Selection
requirement: Research on the Design and Quality Control of Ecological Gabion Riverbank Protection Structure Selection Under the cold climate conditions of northern regions and the actual river characteristics of the Liaoning area, complete the design and quality control of the gabion ecological riverbank protection structure, including selecting suitable forms of bank protection structures, ensuring the integration of ecological functions, protection stability, and construction cost control.
solution: This paper proposes an ecological gabion revetment scheme for river courses tailored to the cold northern climate and the actual characteristics of river channels in the Liaoning region. Specifically, firstly, considering that the cold climate may lead to fractures and collapses in traditional revetments, gabion cage revetment technology is used, which addresses scouring and frost heaving issues through flexible and porous design. Secondly, to meet the needs of anti-scouring and frost heaving resistance while incorporating ecological functionality, a design combining gabion cages with sloped revetments is adopted, achieving a harmonious integration of revetment and ecology. Thirdly, to improve construction efficiency and control costs, project efficiency and quality control are enhanced through unified construction management and scientifically established plans. Lastly, to ensure the stability of the revetment and the quality of materials, anti-sliding and anti-overturning calculations are performed, alongside seven material quality control steps, ensuring the overall stability of the revetment structure and material standardization, thereby achieving the goals of durability, stability, and ecology.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that cold climates may cause traditional revetments to break and collapse, the 'gabion box revetment technology' of technology0 is used. Through a flexible and porous design, it absorbs the impact of ice flow, reduces frost heave deformation of the bank base, and ensures the overall adaptability of the revetment.

For analysis1, considering the need for erosion resistance and frost heave prevention while ensuring the integration of bank protection with the ecosystem, technology0 and technology1 are used to achieve good coordination between bank protection and the environment through the stability of gabion cages and sloped bank protection, and to prevent structural damage.

For analysis2, considering the need to achieve efficient construction and cost control, technology1 and technology3 are used. Through the economic design of a sloped revetment form, costs are reduced, and unified construction management is combined to improve construction efficiency and quality control effectiveness.

To address the issue of bank protection stability, use technology4 'bank protection stability coefficient calculation' to ensure stability against sliding and overturning through calculations, ensuring the bank protection remains stable under water flow scouring and ice flow impact, resolving potential tilting and sliding issues.

To address the issue of embankment material control, use the 'material quality control design' of technology2. Through 7 quality control steps, ensure that the used gabion boxes, filling stones, and other materials meet the standards, avoiding material issues affecting the embankment's effectiveness.

title: Design and engineering application of dredging, solidification, and resource utilization of sandy riverbed sediment.
requirement: Design and engineering application of dredging, solidification, and resource utilization of sandy riverbed sediment. In slightly polluted rivers, remove silt to improve flood discharge capacity and water quality, complete the tasks of dredging, solidifying, and resourcefully utilizing sandy river sediments, while avoiding impacts on surrounding facilities, reducing environmental pollution, and achieving efficient resource utilization of sand, mud cakes, and leftover water.
solution: This paper proposes a technical solution of 'cutter suction dredger + pipeline transportation + mechanical dewatering method (plate and frame filter press) + resource utilization of sludge cakes, gravel, and remaining water.' Specifically, considering the high precision requirements for river dredging and the need to avoid water agitation, a cutter suction dredger and sludge pipeline technology are used to efficiently remove silt and transport slurry in a sealed manner, effectively controlling water pollution. Secondly, addressing land scarcity and environmental protection requirements, the mechanical dewatering method (plate and frame filter press) is used to efficiently dewater the sediment, reducing the moisture content of the sludge cake to a usable standard. Meanwhile, the sediment and gravel separation and solid-liquid separation systems clean and collect the medium sand in the sediment, achieving resource utilization. Finally, the remaining water is treated and used for on-site sand washing and landscaping, forming a green circular utilization system that effectively meets functional requirements and provides a reference for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the need for high precision in dredging and minimal disturbance to the water body, technology0 is used, namely cutter suction dredgers combined with pipeline slurry transport technology. Through precise construction and enclosed slurry transportation, the impact of construction on the water body and environment is effectively controlled, while ensuring dredging efficiency.

For analysis1, considering the scarcity of surrounding sites, the high moisture content of the sludge cake, and the need for resource utilization, technology1 and technology2 were used. Through mechanical dewatering (plate and frame filtration), the moisture content of the sludge cake was reduced, while the sand separation system separated medium sand. Combined with the residual water treatment system, efficient resource utilization was achieved while meeting environmental protection requirements.

title: Research on the Design of the Reinforcement and Renovation Plan for Siyang Second Pumping Station
requirement: Research on the Design of the Reinforcement and Renovation Plan for Siyang Second Pumping Station Under the conditions of aging hydraulic structures, outdated pump equipment, design defects in flow channels, and seepage in the station body, complete the reinforcement and renovation of the Siyang Second Pumping Station. Specific requirements include improving the efficiency of the pump unit, enhancing the abrasion resistance of the inlet and outlet flow channels, strengthening the carbonation resistance and anti-seepage performance of the station body concrete, and eliminating existing operational safety hazards.
solution: This paper proposes a reinforcement and renovation plan for the Siyang Second Pump Station. Specifically, first, considering the severe aging and carbonation issues of the concrete, concrete repair and protection technologies are adopted, using epoxy materials, coating treatment, and steel reinforcement corrosion repair to restore the structural strength and durability of the station. Second, for the outdated foundation structure and longitudinal vibration issues of the pump equipment, pump base and motor pedestal modification techniques are employed, involving demolition, heightening, and recasting high-performance concrete to address operational stability and maintenance challenges. Third, for the perforation air leakage and increased roughness in the outflow channel, flow channel optimization and self-leveling concrete repair technologies are utilized, applying high-wear-resistant mortar casting and pressure grouting to significantly improve efficiency and sealing. Finally, to solve the water seepage and cracking issues of the station building, concrete repair and seepage treatment technologies are used to seal the cracks in the retaining walls and water seepage points in the walls, comprehensively enhancing safety and durability.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of carbonation and strength reduction caused by concrete aging, technology2 is adopted to enhance durability through repairing loose parts and applying carbonation protective coatings, while preventing steel bar corrosion to achieve structural safety improvement.

For analysis1, considering the outdated structural foundation of the water pump equipment affecting stability, technology0 is adopted to enhance the overall structural rigidity by replacing the equipment and reinforcing the base and foundation, ensuring operational stability and reducing maintenance difficulty.

For analysis2, considering the occurrence of reverse flow caused by perforation leaks in the outflow channel, technology1 is adopted. By optimizing the alignment, using self-leveling concrete, and pressure grouting techniques, the channel is repaired to ensure sealing and improve pump efficiency.

For analysis3, considering the issues of wall cracks and station building water seepage, technology2 and technology3 are adopted. By using epoxy resin coating and fiberglass cloth protection, combined with drainage pipe cleaning, the seepage threat is resolved, and the structural durability is enhanced.

title: Design and optimization of the Yanghe Reservoir reinforcement project
requirement: Design and optimization of the Yanghe Reservoir reinforcement project Under the existing conditions of the Yanghe Reservoir discharge structures, complete the safety and stable operation modifications of the flood discharge tunnel, the optimization and improvement of the emergency spillway, and the expansion design of the normal spillway. This aims to enhance discharge safety, meet flood management requirements, and minimize adverse impacts on downstream protected targets while ensuring the safety and stability of the reservoir dam and the left abutment.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive plan of "converting the flood discharge tunnel to non-pressurized operation, reconstructing the emergency spillway into an auxiliary dam, and lowering and expanding the normal spillway." Specifically, first, considering that the design leakage and cracks of the flood discharge tunnel might threaten dam shoulder safety, the non-pressurized transformation technology is adopted for the flood discharge tunnel, controlling the discharge flow through partial gate opening to avoid the risk of through-cracks in the tunnel body. Second, addressing the issue of uncontrollable flood discharge from the emergency spillway during dam failure, the technology of reconstructing the emergency spillway into an auxiliary dam is employed to fundamentally ensure controlled discharge capacity and enhance downstream safety. Third, considering the impact of topography, site constraints, and ecological environment requirements on the expansion of the normal spillway, the technique of lowering and expanding the normal spillway is applied by reducing the weir crest elevation to 53.51m and expanding it to 5 bays on the right side, thereby enhancing the flood discharge capacity. Additionally, to verify the feasibility of the combined plan, flood regulation calculation technology is used to analyze the flood discharge scheme, and hydraulic model tests of the spillway are conducted to optimize the layout. Ultimately, a comprehensive and reasonable design scheme for flood discharge structures is developed.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that cracks and seepage in the flood discharge tunnel during flood discharge may endanger the stability of the left dam shoulder and the main dam, it is recommended to adopt technology0 unpressurized tunnel modification technology. By limiting the opening of the inlet gate, the flood discharge tunnel can be prevented from operating under pressurized conditions, thereby improving the operational safety of the flood discharge tunnel and the left dam shoulder, while also reducing construction difficulty and investment costs.

For analysis1, considering the current situation where the self-collapsing dam is uncontrollable and poses a threat to downstream protection targets, it is recommended to adopt technology1 to transform the spillway into a secondary dam. By raising the secondary dam to the flood control standard of the main dam, this will completely resolve the issue of uncontrollable outflow from the self-collapsing dam and the safety concerns of downstream protection targets, while significantly reducing the reservoir's losses caused by extreme floods.

For analysis2, considering the limitations of site constraints and protected animal habitats for the normal spillway expansion, it is recommended to adopt technology2 expansion technology. By adjusting the crest elevation to 53.51m and expanding 5 bays to the right side, this solution satisfies site coordination requirements while also meeting the need for spillway capacity expansion.

Regarding all analysis conditions and solutions, to verify the design effectiveness of the modified drainage structure, the technology3 flood regulation calculation technique is used to analyze each scheme. By comparing technical indicators, it is confirmed that the recommended scheme has a high consistency with the original characteristic indicators; meanwhile, the technology4 hydraulic model test is further used to verify and optimize the spillway layout to ensure the recommended design is more reasonable.

title: Preliminary Analysis of Aqueduct Scheme Design and Research for Mountainous Water Transfer Projects
requirement: Preliminary Analysis of Aqueduct Scheme Design and Research for Mountainous Water Transfer Projects Under the conditions of complex mountainous terrain, relatively humid climate, and stringent operational management requirements, complete the scheme design of the aqueduct for the water transfer project across the flood channel, ensuring water transfer safety, construction convenience, environmental protection, and low investment requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for a water conveyance project across flood ditches based on reinforced concrete aqueduct technology. Specifically, first, considering the complex terrain conditions in mountainous areas that may increase construction difficulty, a prestressed reinforced concrete rectangular structure was chosen, and the construction challenges of the viaduct were addressed through the optimization of flume pier types and foundation design. Second, in response to the potential corrosion issues of steel structures caused by humid environments, the use of steel aqueduct technology was abandoned in favor of more durable concrete flume materials, reducing operation and maintenance costs. Finally, taking into account requirements such as convenient operation and management, minimal land occupation, and low investment, a comprehensive comparison of various structural types was conducted, and reinforced concrete aqueducts were ultimately recommended as the main structures across the flood ditches. This ensures the safety, constructability, and economic efficiency of the water conveyance project while improving the overall reliability of the water supply system.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the construction difficulties caused by the complex mountainous terrain and the long span of flood channels, technology0 reinforced concrete aqueduct technology was adopted. Through the reasonable design of prestressed concrete structures and aqueduct pier forms, the stability and constructability of the elevated bridge were ensured, while reducing investment costs.

For analysis1, considering that the high regional humidity aggravates the corrosion of steel structural materials, use the technology0 reinforced concrete aqueduct technology to replace the corrosion-sensitive technology1 steel aqueduct technology. By leveraging the durability of concrete materials, reduce subsequent maintenance costs.

For analysis2, considering the comprehensive requirements of operational management convenience, minimal land use, and reduced investment, the technology0 reinforced concrete aqueduct technology was chosen. Through optimized design and excellent compressive strength, the safety and economic goals of the water conveyance project were achieved.

title: Brief Discussion on the Design of the Excellence-Creation Plan for the Construction Project of the Wohe Mengcheng Hub
requirement: Brief Discussion on the Design of the Excellence-Creation Plan for the Construction Project of the Wohe Mengcheng Hub Under the conditions of flood control and drainage, water storage irrigation, and comprehensive functions of transportation and shipping, complete the construction project of the Wohuai River Mengcheng Hub, ensuring the flow requirements for a 50-year return period check discharge. Adopt the PMC project management general contracting model, aiming at "ensuring the Dayu Award and striving for the Luban Award" to achieve efficient, safe, and high-quality construction and operation.
solution: This paper proposes solutions to meet the high-standard requirements and excellence goals of the comprehensive functions of the Wuohe Mengcheng Hub. Specifically, first, considering the complex engineering scale and functional design, the thin-walled plastic concrete cutoff wall technology is adopted to ensure the safety of the foundation pit, and the design is optimized using BIM+GIS systems to improve construction efficiency through digital methods. Second, regarding the management challenges posed by the first introduction of the PMC model, the responsibilities between PMC and supervision are clarified, and coordination is standardized through the release of management manuals and process documents to ensure smooth overall project progress. Finally, based on the high requirements of the excellence goals, green construction technology is promoted, a comprehensive safety and quality management system is implemented, hazard identification and reward/punishment measures are strengthened, effectively reducing costs and improving project operation efficiency, ultimately ensuring the achievement of the Dayu Award and striving for the Luban Award excellence goals.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the characteristics of large engineering scale and complex functionality, technology1 thin-wall plastic concrete cutoff wall technology is adopted to achieve efficient groundwater control through safe foundation pit design; meanwhile, technology2 information management technology is introduced, utilizing BIM and GIS for design simulation and optimization to improve overall efficiency.

For analysis1, considering the impact of unclear responsibilities and low efficiency under the traditional management model, the technology0 PMC project management model was adopted. By issuing a management manual to standardize the division of labor and processes among participating units, the authority and relationship between PMC and supervision were clarified to reduce friction.

For analysis2, considering the stringent requirements of the excellence goal on all-around performance, technology0 is adopted to ensure management coordination, technology4 is utilized to promote green construction, and technology3 is integrated into specialized safety and quality management techniques.
