Through various supervision and incentive measures, the overall excellence goal of the project is ensured to be achieved.

title: Study on the Water Pressure Test of the Branch Pipe in the Expansion Project of the Chentian River Reservoir
requirement: Study on the Water Pressure Test of the Branch Pipe in the Expansion Project of the Chentian River Reservoir Under the conditions of the branch pipe enduring an overload internal water pressure of 1.76 MPa, a tight schedule, and no stress testing, complete the hydraulic pressure test of the branch pipe to examine the overall structural safety and evaluate its long-term operational capability.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for the water pressure test of the branch pipe in the expansion project of the Centianhe Reservoir. Specifically, first, considering that the branch pipe needs to withstand a design internal water pressure of 1.76 MPa and may face issues such as structural deformation and defect exposure under staged loading conditions, a staged loading water pressure test combined with displacement monitoring technology is adopted to progressively test the safety of the branch pipe and verify whether the structural deformation is within the elastic range. Second, to address the issues of a tight construction schedule and the lack of stress testing, which may result in insufficient test accuracy, a volumetric deformation measurement technique is used to calculate the volume change of the branch pipe through water intake and analyze structural deformation in combination with displacement monitoring. Finally, the test demonstrated that the branch pipe exhibited no leakage or abnormal deformation after the water pressure test, verifying its long-term operational safety. The test method is simple, efficient, and the results are worth promoting.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the branch pipe needs to withstand an overload internal pressure of 1.76 MPa, which may lead to structural deformation and defect exposure issues, technology0 was used for graded loading, combined with technology1 for displacement monitoring. By gradually detecting the displacement and deformation characteristics of the branch pipe, the elastic range and safety performance of the structure were verified.

For analysis1, considering that the lack of stress detection in the experiment might affect the comprehensiveness of the results, technology1 and technology2 were used. Key deformations of the branch pipe were monitored with displacement sensors, and water intake was measured with electronic scales to verify volume changes. A simplified measurement method was employed to address the challenge of insufficient accuracy.

title: Design and analysis of the riprap structure and ecological bank protection scheme of Dianshan Lake
requirement: Design and analysis of the riprap structure and ecological bank protection scheme of Dianshan Lake Under the conditions of river management, complete the riverbank restoration project for Yanjia Port and Xinkaijing River in the Dianshan Lake area. The tasks include river dredging, construction of riverbanks and flood prevention pathways, restoration of greenery and vegetation, and creation of ecological riverbanks to meet the needs of flood prevention, water ecological landscaping, and improve water quality.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for the shoreline protection renovation in the Dianshan Lake area. Specifically, firstly, considering the potential flood control issues caused by river siltation and insufficient water flow capacity, the use of concrete interlocking block slope protection technology is implemented to achieve erosion resistance, soil and water conservation, and ecological restoration through structural stability design and vegetation planting voids. Secondly, to meet the hydrophilicity and ecological requirements of the shoreline, the design of the bridge connection section is combined with a grouted rubble retaining wall and slope structure, meeting the greening and landscaping functions through meticulous design. Additionally, a more cost-effective technical solution is chosen, ensuring construction efficiency, cost control, and ecological benefits throughout the process, ultimately achieving the comprehensive governance goal of the shoreline in the Dianshan Lake area.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the difficulties in river dredging and the requirements for ecological functions of bank protection, technology0 concrete interlocking blocks are used for slope protection. By providing stable block connections and planting voids, along with incorporating a filtration layer to reduce soil erosion, the river’s anti-scour capacity is enhanced, and ecological functions are optimized.

Regarding analysis1, considering the hydrophilicity of the revetment and the ecological restoration needs, it is recommended to use technology0 in the slope protection system due to its good economic performance, high stability, ability to ensure vegetation growth, and simple construction process. Meanwhile, for the existing retained bridge connection section, combine the design of masonry block retaining walls and slope structures to enhance construction adaptability and landscaping effects.

title: Design of the rubber dam scheme for the Wenliang River water source project
requirement: Design of the rubber dam scheme for the Wenliang River water source project Based on meeting the requirements of regional water supply, flood control, and ecological effects, and incorporating the design flow and water level parameters for 20-year and 50-year flood events, select a reasonable water retaining structure solution (rubber dam or river gate) and complete the design of the dam bag and the stability calculation of the dam chamber to ensure the safety, durability, and economic requirements of the project.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for selecting a rubber dam for the New Era Water Source Project of Wenliang River in Feixian. Specifically, firstly, considering the regional water resource shortage and multifunctional demands, the rubber dam scheme (technology0) is adopted, achieving low investment, high-efficiency construction, and landscape optimization through a 121.20-meter dam width layout and a two-section dam bag design. Secondly, to address the challenges of flood flow and water level control (analysis1), flood level calculation and characteristic flood design technologies (technology1) are employed, and the safety of flood discharge at the dam site is verified through multi-condition simulations and checks for 20- and 50-year flood levels. Finally, concerning the mechanical stability of dam bags and dam chambers (analysis2), dam bag design and dam base stability calculation technologies (technology2) are utilized, ensuring the dam bag strength reaches 49 kN/m and the dam base bearing capacity meets the 120 kPa standard, thus achieving a comprehensive design scheme balancing safety and cost-effectiveness.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the characteristics of regional resource scarcity, high engineering importance, as well as requirements for investment and landscape, technology0 was used, and a rubber dam solution was selected. Through a 121.20 m layout and dam bag system, low investment, high-efficiency construction, and excellent landscape effects were achieved.

For analysis1, considering the challenges of flood peak passing capacity and safety redundancy, technology1 is adopted. Through constant non-uniform flow calculation, the water level differences for 20-year and 50-year return period floods are analyzed to ensure that the water levels downstream and upstream of the dam meet design requirements, preventing flood risks.

For analysis2, considering the strength and stability requirements of the dam bag, technology2 is used to validate that the radial strength of the dam bag at 49 kN/m and other stability aspects meet the safety standards through calculations and designs for the radial strength of the dam bag and the anti-slip stability of the dam base.

title: Port shoreline retreat and marine restoration project breakwater scheme design
requirement: Port shoreline retreat and marine restoration project breakwater scheme design Under the conditions of the complex movement characteristics of tidal currents, waves, and sediment along the port shoreline, through the reasonable layout of breakwater design, complete the task of retreating the shoreline and restoring the sea in the port, maintain the stability of the artificial beach, and simultaneously meet the requirements of landscape design and waterfront space.
solution: This paper proposes a breakwater scheme for the restoration project of reclaiming coastlines to the sea at the port shoreline. Specifically, first, considering the instability of artificial beaches under the influence of tides and waves, the MEPBay model is used to optimize the location and shape of the breakwater, and sand-blocking dikes are reasonably arranged to create sheltered conditions. Second, addressing the potential beach erosion or silting issues caused by the complex sediment transport characteristics, the alongshore sediment transport volume calculation is incorporated, and Scheme 2 is ultimately selected, featuring a breakwater with a design length of 1,440 meters to control the sediment transport pattern by blocking SSE waves. Finally, to prevent the sedimentation risks at the southern section caused by an overly long breakwater, sediment transport data at various points and the influence of wave propagation are calculated to ensure the stability of the southern beach along with a landscape-friendly effect.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the significant tidal current direction and wave action may make it difficult to stabilize the artificial beach, use technology0 to optimize the position and length of the arc-shaped sand blocking dike through modeling, and design the southern sand blocking dike to protect the stability of the beach.

For analysis1, considering that the complex sediment movement characteristics may cause beach erosion or siltation in front of the revetment, scheme 2 (length of 1440 meters), which combines technology1 with breakwater design, is used to control the sediment transport pattern by blocking SSE~E waves, thereby maximizing the stability of the beach near the revetment.

For analysis2, considering that an overly long breakwater may lead to sediment accumulation and silting issues on the southern section of the beach, use technology2 to calculate the coastal sediment transport data, and select the 1440-meter breakwater design of scheme 2 to avoid the problem of closed sedimentation in the southern section.

title: Discussion on the Design of the Implementation Plan for the Pilot County of Water System Connectivity and Beautiful Countryside Construction in Hunan Province: A Case Study of Xihe River in Beihu District, Chenzhou City
requirement: Discussion on the Design of the Implementation Plan for the Pilot County of Water System Connectivity and Beautiful Countryside Construction in Hunan Province: A Case Study of Xihe River in Beihu District, Chenzhou City Under the conditions of complex terrain, poor waterbody connectivity, and severe pollution, complete the pilot project for the water system connectivity of Xi River and other major waterways as well as the construction of picturesque rural areas. The goal is to achieve "clear water, smooth rivers, green banks, beautiful landscapes, and harmonious people." By means of water system connectivity, ecological restoration, pollution prevention and control, and the excavation of cultural landscapes, a modern water ecosystem will be built to reflect the harmony between humans and nature, contributing to rural revitalization.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive implementation plan for the connectivity of the Xi River and its surrounding water systems as well as the construction of water-beautiful villages. Specifically, first, considering the complex terrain and problems of water system sedimentation, water system connectivity technology and river dredging technology are used to address issues of waterbody disconnection and insufficient flood discharge capacity through river-lake connectivity, dredging, capacity expansion, and dam renovation. Secondly, to address the problem of unstable embankments caused by encroachment, ecological embankment and slope management techniques are adopted to restore and protect 24 km of shoreline, add river patrol roads, and achieve the integration of ecological restoration and functional harmonization. Additionally, to address water quality pollution during the dry season, anti-pollution and pollution control technologies are utilized, including artificial wetlands and centralized wastewater treatment facilities, to comprehensively manage non-point source pollution and solid waste, ensuring water quality stability. Finally, to tackle the insufficient exploration of cultural aspects, cultural landscape enhancement technology is applied, combining historical resources with existing natural conditions, to create a new integrated cultural tourism-based rural economic model, achieving an organic blend of water culture preservation and rural revitalization.

explanation.content: For analysis0 and analysis1, considering the complex terrain and river siltation leading to poor water connectivity and insufficient flood discharge capacity, use technology0 and technology1 to restore water system connectivity and water ecological functions through river-lake connectivity, water activation in villages, and obstruction removal and dredging techniques.

For analysis2, considering issues such as shoreline encroachment and weak revetments, technology2 is adopted. Through reasonable design of revetment types, repairing sections eroded by water, and incorporating river patrol roads and waterside facilities, the goals of slope stability and riverbank ecological compatibility are achieved.

For analysis3, considering the issues of insufficient water supply and water pollution, technology4 is adopted to control pollution sources and improve water quality through sewage treatment facilities, garbage point construction, and artificial wetland functions.

For analysis4, considering the issue of insufficient cultural excavation, technology5 is adopted to effectively combine culture and natural resources through the promotion wall of Yao culture, the integration of historical resources, and the construction of wetland culture, achieving an organic fusion of humanity and landscape.

title: Design and research on the comprehensive management plan for the section of the Gunlong River at the river mouth.
requirement: Design and research on the comprehensive management plan for the section of the Gunlong River at the river mouth. Under the conditions of the river's winding course, severe damage to bank protection, and insufficient flood discharge capacity, complete the comprehensive management tasks for the section of the Gunlong River near the river mouth, ensuring flood safety, protecting farmland and villages along the riverbanks, and restoring and enhancing the river's ecological functions.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive treatment plan for the inlet section of the Gunlong River. Specifically, firstly, considering the meandering river course, random dumping, and gentle slopes, gabion retaining wall technology is used to reinforce the riverbanks by constructing vertical gabion walls to enhance flood resistance and ecological functions. At the same time, combining ecological bank protection and vegetation restoration techniques, poplars and cotton acacias are planted to form protective forest belts and bank areas, thereby improving the ecological environment. Secondly, targeting the aging of the bank protection and weathering of stones, the original banks are dismantled and reconstructed with three-layer gabion retaining walls to strengthen erosion resistance and ensure the safety of farmland and roads along the banks. Lastly, addressing river siltation and leveling issues, channel leveling technology is used to carry out dredging and leveling operations along the 13,934-meter treatment section, restoring the flood discharge cross-section and optimizing flood discharge capacity, ultimately achieving the goals of flood safety and ecological function enhancement.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the meandering river course and bank slope damage, the technology0 gabion revetment technique was used to achieve structural stability of the river through the anti-scour and durability characteristics of the gabions and effectively improve flood resistance. Simultaneously, combined with technology2 ecological revetment and vegetation restoration techniques, poplar and cottonwood were planted at the revetment to enhance ecological functions.

For analysis1, considering the aging of existing revetment works and stone weathering issues, the technology0 gabion revetment technique was used. By designing a three-layer gabion revetment and enhancing toe protection, the stability of the revetment structure was ensured, solving the problems of revetment collapse and bank slope erosion.

For analysis2, considering the issues of narrowed flood discharge cross-section caused by sedimentation and riverbed instability caused by sand mining, use technology1 river leveling technique to restore the flood discharge capacity of the river through dredging and leveling operations, and solve the flood safety problem through a reasonably designed slope gradient.

title: Route design for the renovation of small cross-section short tunnels in the irrigation area
requirement: Route design for the renovation of small cross-section short tunnels in the irrigation area Under the constraints of aging and damaged tunnel linings, poor surrounding rock conditions, adverse geology, and the impact of structures, complete the safety renovation task of small cross-section short tunnels in the irrigation area to meet the irrigation water supply function and project schedule requirements.
solution: This paper proposes an overall plan for the renovation of small cross-section short tunnels in the irrigation area. Specifically, first, for tunnels with poor surrounding rock conditions and complex adverse geological influences, a rerouting and new tunnel construction plan is adopted, avoiding severely damaged lining and adverse geological areas to ensure construction safety and operational reliability; second, for tunnels located near high-risk structures (such as Tunnel #14), an optimized tunnel alignment is used to bypass building areas, thereby avoiding potential safety hazards caused by construction disturbances; finally, for tunnels with better geological conditions and controllable construction periods (such as Tunnel #18), an on-site expansion plan is implemented, ensuring structural stability and cost-effectiveness through reasonable primary support and secondary lining measures. By comprehensively comparing various tunnel alignment designs and technical measures, this plan provides a safe and efficient solution for the renovation of the irrigation area.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of original lining removal and surrounding rock, use technology0 to construct a new tunnel path with better geological conditions as a replacement, avoiding damaged linings and complex surrounding rock areas to reduce construction and operational risks.

For analysis1, considering the risk of slope instability and landslides, technology3 is adopted to reroute and avoid unfavorable geological areas. The plan involves constructing a new tunnel along the rerouted line (such as Tunnel #7) to ensure the safety and feasibility of the project.

For analysis2, considering the impact of disturbances on the building foundation, use technology0 to construct a new tunnel line bypassing the building area to avoid settlement or cracking hazards (such as tunnel #14) during construction.

For analysis3, considering the favorable geological conditions and controllable construction period, adopt the on-site reconstruction plan of technology1 to demolish and rebuild tunnel 18#, which is economically advantageous and can meet the schedule requirements.

title: Design of the reinforcement plan for the Yanshan Reservoir.
requirement: Design of the reinforcement plan for the Yanshan Reservoir. Under the conditions of seepage in the Yanshan Reservoir dam, no anti-seepage curtain in the seepage flow, and no safety monitoring facilities, complete the reinforcement and hazard mitigation work for the reservoir to improve the seepage resistance of the dam, ensure the structural stability of the dam, and improve the safety monitoring facilities, thereby ensuring the safe operation of the reservoir.
solution: This paper proposes a risk elimination and reinforcement plan to address the safety issues of the Yanshan Reservoir. Specifically, first, considering the problems of seepage in the dam body and poor seepage control effectiveness of construction joints, cement grouting technology is employed. By grouting through drilling, the water permeability of the dam body is reduced to ≤5 Lu, enhancing the seepage prevention performance of the dam. Second, to address the issues of seepage flow in the dam foundation and insufficient seepage prevention on the dam surface, the upstream concrete seepage prevention panel technology is applied. With the construction of new C25 concrete seepage prevention panels, a complete seepage prevention structure is formed, improving the safety and stability of the dam body. Finally, in response to the lack of safety monitoring facilities, dam safety monitoring system technology is adopted, adding various monitoring facilities that cover displacement observation and seepage monitoring to comprehensively grasp the operational status and deformation conditions of the dam, effectively improving the safety management level of the reservoir.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that seepage in the dam body may lead to structural instability, the technology0 grouting technique was used to fill and cement the dam body. This densified the dam through grouting to reduce the permeability of the dam body, enhancing the anti-seepage performance of the dam and ensuring the structural safety and stability of the dam.

For analysis1, considering the issues of seepage pressure at the dam foundation and poor impermeability of the rock mass, technology0 and technology1 were used to install an upstream concrete impervious panel while performing grouting and filling in the dam body. By combining anchor bolts with the dam body, the impermeability of the rock mass was enhanced, effectively solving the seepage problem and improving the stability of the dam foundation.

For analysis2, considering the lack of safety monitoring facilities, the technology2 dam safety monitoring system was used to add observation points and facilities, comprehensively monitoring dam deformation and leakage, addressing the issue of insufficient monitoring and ensuring timely understanding of dam operation conditions.

title: Safety reinforcement scheme design for the Yuyuantan drainage gate
requirement: Safety reinforcement scheme design for the Yuyuantan drainage gate Under the conditions of cracks in the concrete structure, severe corrosion of the metal structure, and aging of the hoist equipment, complete the reinforcement and remediation of the Yuyuantan sluice gate to ensure flood safety and the normal operation of its water supply function, while meeting the safety rectification standards for Class III gates.
solution: This article proposes a risk mitigation and reinforcement plan for the Yuyuantan sluice gate. Specifically, first, considering the issues of concrete cracks and localized carbonation, concrete crack grouting reinforcement, flexible protection technology, and carbonation depth durability treatment technologies are used. Cracks are effectively sealed through grouting reinforcement and hand-scraped polyurea coating, significantly improving the impermeability and durability of the concrete. Second, to address the severe corrosion issues of gates and metal structures, metal structure corrosion repair and coating protection technologies are applied. This involves rust removal, painting, and applying anti-corrosion materials to ensure the reliability of metal components. Finally, considering the aging issues of hoists and electrical equipment, a new 150 kN fixed winch hoist and balanced motor are installed, enhancing operational precision and long-term safety through hoist replacement and electrical equipment updates. This plan comprehensively covers structural, metal, and electrical equipment issues of the sluice gate, ensuring its normal operation and water supply and drainage capacity.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of concrete cracks and local carbonation depth, technology0 is used for crack grouting reinforcement, and surface protection is addressed with hand-scraped polyurea coating; meanwhile, technology1 is used to enhance the durability of the carbonation areas, improving the overall durability and impermeability of the concrete structure.

For analysis1, considering the rusting problem of the gate and metal structure, use technology2 to eliminate deep corrosion pits and flaking rust through rust removal, painting, and anti-corrosion treatment, restoring the normal operating condition of the metal structure.

For analysis2, considering the severe aging of the hoist and the issue of current imbalance, use technology3 to replace the old hoist and hoist motor to enhance the control safety and long-term operational reliability of the entire equipment.

title: Design of Land Retention and Resettlement Plan for the Pearl River Delta Water Resource Allocation Project: A Case Study of Gaosha Village in Dagang Town
requirement: Design of Land Retention and Resettlement Plan for the Pearl River Delta Water Resource Allocation Project: A Case Study of Gaosha Village in Dagang Town In the Pearl River Delta water resources allocation project involving land acquisition in Gaosha Village, Dagang Town, reasonably plan and design the reserved land resettlement scheme to ensure that the village collective can achieve economic sustainability through the reserved land, while resolving historical land issues and meeting the villagers' wishes.
solution: This article proposes three land resettlement options: on-site resettlement, monetary compensation, and property exchange, ultimately recommending a primary focus on on-site land resettlement. Specifically, first, to meet the collective will and sustainable income needs of Gaosha Village, on-site resettlement is chosen, using technology0, by determining the ratio of industrial to operational land (7:3) and utilizing a public trading platform for land circulation to maximize collective village benefits. Second, if insurmountable constraints arise in selecting resettlement locations, monetary compensation (technology1) is combined, adopting dynamic land price adjustments and fund management investment to ensure stable economic support for the village collective. Furthermore, when industrial park property exchange becomes necessary, technology2 is utilized, ensuring long-term income sources for the village collective through reasonable valuation assessments and clarified agreement terms. Through these methods, Gaosha Village aims to achieve dual goals of economic benefits and social stability in the Pearl River Delta Water Resource Allocation Project.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the need for resettlement site selection and sustained revenue from reserved land, the village collective strongly prefers on-site resettlement. Therefore, technology0 is used to designate the proportion of industrial and commercial use (7:3) and promote development through the public asset trading platform, ensuring the sustainability and efficient utilization of the village collective's revenue.

For analysis0 and analysis1, if monetary compensation is needed to offset site selection difficulties and compensation allocation issues, adopt technology1, reasonably determine the monetary compensation standard through a dynamic land price correction formula, and establish a fund management company to ensure the investment management of funds, maximizing the benefits of compensation funds.

For analysis1, considering the feasibility and future profit risks of replacing the industrial park property, use technology2 to clarify property location, valuation, rights handling, and revenue sharing through agreements to ensure the village collective's expectation of long-term stable cash flow income.

title: Analysis of the Design of Riverbank Protection Types and Remediation Measures for the Main and Tributary Channels of Baiyun River
requirement: Analysis of the Design of Riverbank Protection Types and Remediation Measures for the Main and Tributary Channels of Baiyun River Under the conditions of the complex terrain of the Baiyun River and its tributary Shangdianzi River, as well as limited land resources, complete the design of the bank protection type and river channel improvement tasks. The design must meet the 10-year flood prevention standard, ensure flood discharge capacity, and protect the villages, roads, and ecological environment on both sides.
solution: This paper proposes a plan for the design and remediation measures of the bank protection types for the main and tributary streams of Baiyun River. Specifically, first, considering the insufficient flood discharge capacity of the Baiyun River basin and the requirement for the bank protection to meet the 10-year flood standard, gabion baskets are used for bank protection. By optimizing the design of river section protection and erosion resistance, the flood discharge capacity of the Baiyun River channel is improved. Second, for the issue of limited land resources in the section near Shangdianzi River Village, cantilever concrete straight-wall bank protection technology is employed. Through a design with high stability and minimal land occupation, the protective capacity of the village section is ensured. Finally, to address the problems of poor flow erosion stability and vegetation erosion along the main stream bank of Baiyun River, gabion basket bank protection technology is used, and shrubs are planted on the slope of the bank. Through stepped reinforcement and ecological restoration, the issues of protective stability and landscape are resolved, ultimately achieving the goal of improving the overall flood discharge capacity and flood control effectiveness of the river channel.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the insufficient flood discharge capacity of the main and tributary streams of the Baiyun River basin and the need to improve the flood control standard of the revetment, using technology0, the Gabion revetment technology is employed to optimize river section protection, enhance the erosion resistance of the revetment, and ensure the flood discharge capacity for a 10-year flood event.

For analysis1, considering the limited land resources in the village section and the current protective structures failing to meet flood control standards, technology1 is used to effectively optimize the riverbank protection within the village section through the highly stable and durable cantilever concrete straight wall revetment technology, ensuring flood control capability.

For analysis2, considering the poor stability of water flow erosion and vegetation erosion issues along the main stream bank of Baiyun River, technology0 is applied. Using the gabion retaining wall technique, stepped reinforcement will be implemented within a 1.5m range above the riverbed, and shrubs will be planted to address bank stability and ecological issues.

title: Design and analysis of the reinforcement and risk mitigation plan for the Baipenzhu Reservoir earth-rock dam
requirement: Design and analysis of the reinforcement and risk mitigation plan for the Baipenzhu Reservoir earth-rock dam Under the conditions of seepage in the auxiliary dam, high permeability coefficient of the dam foundation, complex overlap of new and old concrete walls, and large reservoir scale, complete the reinforcement and risk mitigation design and implementation for the auxiliary dam of Baipenzhu Reservoir, ensuring a significant reduction in seepage volume and exit hydraulic gradient, and meeting the regulatory requirements for seepage stability and slope stability of the entire dam.
solution: This paper proposes a risk mitigation and reinforcement plan for the seepage problems of the auxiliary dam of Baipenzhu Reservoir. Specifically, firstly, considering the seepage risk caused by the incomplete construction of the concrete anti-seepage core wall, the C25 concrete continuous anti-seepage wall technology is adopted. By constructing a new anti-seepage wall that matches the materials of the first-phase wall, a complete anti-seepage system is achieved. Secondly, addressing the complexity of connecting new and old concrete and potential construction safety risks, high-pressure jet grouting technology is used for joint treatment, ensuring smooth construction through precise control of permeability coefficients and grouting depth. Finally, in response to the requirements of the complex operating conditions of the large-scale reservoir at the auxiliary dam, seepage and slope stability calculation and analysis technologies are employed to recheck the maximum seepage hydraulic gradient and sliding stability. The results show that all operating conditions fully meet the specifications, effectively solving the seepage problem of the auxiliary dam and ensuring the safe operation of the reservoir.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the seepage problem caused by the incomplete construction of the concrete anti-seepage core wall, use technology0. By constructing a continuous C25 concrete anti-seepage wall to connect the left and right dam shoulders with the Phase I concrete wall, a complete anti-seepage system is formed, effectively reducing the seepage flow and permeability gradient.

For analysis1, considering the complexity and safety risks of connecting new and old concrete structures, technology1 is adopted to handle the overlap of new and old concrete walls using high-pressure jet grouting technology, reducing the risk of damage to the old concrete during construction and ensuring the quality of the overlap.

For analysis2, considering the large scale of the reservoir and the complex working conditions, a multi-level analysis is required. Using technology2, seepage analysis calculations and the simplified Bishop method are applied to review the dam slope stability, ensuring the design safety and reliability of the auxiliary dam.

title: Design and Application of the Online Water Temperature Monitoring System for Baihetan Hydropower Station
requirement: Design and Application of the Online Water Temperature Monitoring System for Baihetan Hydropower Station Under the condition of meeting ecological environment protection requirements, conduct around-the-clock, fully automated real-time online water temperature monitoring in areas such as the Baihetan Hydropower Station reservoir area, upstream of the dam, inside the dam flow channel, and downstream of the dam. Obtain precise vertical water temperature distributions and temperature data along the route, provide fundamental data for layered water intake measures with lifting gates, and mitigate adverse impacts on the ecosystem.
solution: This paper proposes an online water temperature monitoring scheme for the Baihetan Hydropower Station reservoir. Specifically, first, considering the negative environmental impacts of high dam operations, an automated reservoir water temperature monitoring system is used to provide critical information for improving downstream water temperature by enabling real-time data collection with wide coverage. Second, to address the monitoring requirements of the reservoir area and intake structure, vertical water temperature profile monitoring technology and embedded detection technologies in intake towers are applied, along with refined adaptive arrangements in river channels and within concrete, to achieve intensive monitoring. Lastly, to meet the demands of complex dam structure monitoring and non-destructive testing, a stainless steel pipe monitoring system is employed on the dam surface, allowing flexible setup of monitoring pipelines during construction to ensure both accuracy and dam safety. Additionally, automated data transmission and a central processing station enable wide-ranging, high-security, and all-weather monitoring, providing critical technical support for multilayer water intake studies and mitigating ecological impacts.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the significant impact of high dam and large reservoir operations on downstream water temperature and the ecological environment, technology3 is used to ensure that the water temperature impact is continuously monitored and analyzed through real-time data collection and upload from multiple monitoring points.

For analysis1, considering the need for monitoring across a wide area, use technology0 and technology1 to densely distribute measurement lines along the storage area and water intake tower positioning. Multiple detection lines are set at different elevation ranges to ensure comprehensive monitoring coverage.

For analysis2, considering the complex characteristics of vertical water temperature stratification in the reservoir area, technology0 is adopted to achieve gradient-based elevation arrangements over a wide range of water depths. A combination of steel wire ropes and PVC pipes is used to ensure precise arrangements and reliable operation and maintenance of the equipment.

For analysis3, considering the special monitoring requirements on the dam surface structure, technology2 is adopted. By using non-destructive stainless steel pipe installation and high-density point arrangement, monitoring accuracy is ensured while avoiding structural penetration risks.

title: Communication scheme design for a cascade hydropower station on a tributary of the Bailong River
requirement: Communication scheme design for a cascade hydropower station on a tributary of the Bailong River Under the conditions of the remote geographic location of the Gannan region, a large number of power stations with small capacity, complex integration, and the need to upload various power communication information, design an efficient, reliable, safe, and temperature-adaptive optical communication scheme for cascade hydropower stations to achieve the "four remote" dispatching goals of the Gannan regional grid.
solution: This paper proposes a communication solution for the cascade hydropower stations on the tributaries of the Bailong River in the Gannan region. Specifically: first, considering the small capacity and large number of stations, as well as the complexity of information upload, G.652 single-mode 12-core OPGW optical cable and SDH fiber optic transmission systems are used to address the efficiency and reliability issues of information upload through stable optical cable links and efficient transmission technology; second, in response to the challenges of Gannan's remote geographical location and the complex access needs of hydropower stations, high-performance optical fibers and synchronous digital transmission systems are utilized to reduce signal attenuation and error rates, while also decreasing construction weight and costs; finally, to address environmental temperature differences and multi-dimensional information transmission needs, PCM access equipment and secondary safety protection devices are employed to ensure system stability, security, and scalability through information categorization and system security isolation, thereby guaranteeing the efficient transmission of dispatch telephones, electric energy delivery, and remote automation information.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the small capacity and large quantity of individual hydropower stations, the use of technology0 and technology1, combined with high-stability OPGW optical cables and efficient transmission SDH equipment, resolved the issues of complexity in information uploading and insufficient communication reliability.

For analysis1, considering the remote geographical location of the Gannan region and the complexity of power station integration, technology0 and technology1 were adopted. Through optical cables with high lateral pressure resistance and low signal loss, as well as synchronous digital transmission systems, reliable long-distance signal transmission was ensured, reducing the error rate and construction costs.

For analysis2, considering the multidimensional information transmission and environmental temperature adaptability requirements, technology0 and technology3 are utilized. By using G.652 optical cables operating under high temperature difference conditions and secondary safety protection equipment, the issue of transmission stability in extreme environments was resolved. At the same time, PCM access equipment is constructed using technology2, enhancing the ability to classify and allocate communication information.

title: Design of the bank slope reinforcement plan for the section from Bailin Bridge to Guangzhou Bridge along the Youjiang River in Baise City.
requirement: Design of the bank slope reinforcement plan for the section from Bailin Bridge to Guangzhou Bridge along the Youjiang River in Baise City. Under the conditions of existing stability and safety hazards in the slope, steep slopes, and complex geological conditions, conduct a stability analysis and design an integrated reinforcement plan for the right bank slope from Bailin Bridge to Guangzhou Bridge section of Youjiang River in Baise City. This ensures slope stability and protective effects, safeguards the safety of bridge structures and residential areas along the route, and meets the minimum stability safety factor requirements stipulated by regulations.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive reinforcement plan for the bank slopes along the Youjiang River in Baise City, from Bailin Bridge to Guangzhou Bridge. Specifically, considering the steep slope ratio, partial top collapse, and insufficient slope stability, Area One (slope length 68.8 m) and Area Three (length 133.1 m) adopt the gravity retaining wall technique combined with slope cutting and load reduction. The retaining wall adjusts in height and width (4.0~6.0 m, top width 1.36~1.82 m), with the slope surface reduced from 1:1.5 to 1:2, and employs mortar stone revetment techniques to prevent localized sliding, optimizing the river's landscape functionality and ensuring the stability coefficient meets requirements. Secondly, for Area Two (length 212 m), where the mixed fill soil layer is thick and the stability coefficient is even lower, mechanical bored cast-in-place pile technology is used, with a pile diameter of 1.5 m, spacing of 2.0 m, and pile length of 31.5 m. Grouting is combined to enhance the cohesion of the fill soil, and landscape stones form a visually appealing waterfall design at the top of the piles, ensuring both the slope protection's aesthetic and stability. Finally, slope analysis and verification ensure compliance with the regulatory requirement of an anti-sliding safety factor above 1.25, achieving safety and protection objectives.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the steep slope ratio, local slope collapses, and insufficient stability factors, technology0 and technology2 are applied in zones one and three. The slope is treated using a combination scheme of gravity retaining walls and slope cutting for load reduction, with masonry stone slope protection to prevent landslides. The anti-slide stability factors all meet the standard requirement of 1.25.

For analysis1, considering that the Zone 2 miscellaneous fill layer is relatively thick and the effective coefficient is low (0.518), technology1 is used. Through mechanical drilling and grouting reinforcement techniques, the backfill soil is reinforced with grouted piles, and crown beams and landscape stones are added to enhance anti-sliding capability. Additional reinforcement is supplemented to form a landscape waterfall, improving stability.

title: Design of the ecological flow release system scheme for the Shitouhe Dam hydropower station
requirement: Design of the ecological flow release system scheme for the Shitouhe Dam hydropower station Under the conditions of a dam-tail diversion hydropower station and complex site hydraulic facilities and river conditions, complete the design and implementation of the ecological discharge monitoring system for the Shitouhe Dam-tail Power Station, ensuring sufficient discharge, measurable and visible data, as well as data storage and remote transmission functions.
solution: This paper proposes a design plan for the monitoring system of ecological flow release at the hydropower station downstream of the Stone River Dam. Specifically, first, considering that the flow release must meet ecological requirements and be easy to monitor, ultrasonic flowmeter technology and pipeline flow design are used to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements through high-precision real-time data collection and pipeline flow measurement. Second, addressing the irregular river channel and steep banks on-site, rectangular waterblocking cross-section construction technology is adopted, providing a stable and reliable foundation for flow measurement through a C25 concrete weir. Finally, to meet the visualization and real-time requirements of monitoring data, a remote monitoring system technology is utilized, ensuring measurable, traceable, and adjustable flow release monitoring through telemetry terminal transmission and real-time camera surveillance. The system operates well overall, has passed acceptance, and provides reliable support for ecological flow release supervision.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the discharge flow needs to meet ecological requirements and be easy to monitor, technology0 and technology1 were adopted. Through the use of ultrasonic flowmeters and pipeline flow monitoring technology, high-precision and real-time flow data collection was achieved, ensuring that the ecological discharge meets regulatory requirements.

For analysis1, considering that the irregular river channel and rapid flow are not suitable for direct monitoring, technology2 and technology3 are adopted. By constructing a stable rectangular water interception section combined with a remote monitoring system, measurable and visible flow monitoring is achieved, while meeting the requirements of real-time monitoring and remote data transmission.

title: Emergency reinforcement and risk mitigation plan design for Shiji Mountain Reservoir
requirement: Emergency reinforcement and risk mitigation plan design for Shiji Mountain Reservoir Under the circumstances of an old dam with leakage and damaged culvert structure at the Shijishan Reservoir, complete the emergency risk elimination and reinforcement tasks for the dam body and culvert, specifically including using anti-seepage wall technology to address dam leakage issues and adopting sleeve lining and grouting technology to reinforce the culvert.
solution: This paper proposes an emergency reinforcement plan for the Shijishan Reservoir. Specifically, firstly, considering the seepage problems that occurred after many years of dam operation, the vertical impermeable wall technology with single-tube high-pressure jet grouting was used. Through the intersection of jet grouting piles forming a continuous wall, this not only addressed the issue of insufficient compaction of the dam's fill soil but also effectively prevented seepage. Secondly, for the aging and structural fractures observed in the water outlet culvert, the culvert reinforcement technology using PE pipe liners was adopted. By using flexible PE pipe lining and injecting cement mortar to fill tightly, the overall durability and deformation resistance of the culvert were improved, eliminating leakage risks. The implementation of the plan not only resolved the safety operation risks but also provided a secure foundation for subsequent irrigation and the comprehensive benefits of the reservoir.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issue of dam body leakage, it is recommended to use technology0, i.e., the single-tube high-pressure jet grouting vertical cutoff wall technology. This involves forming a vertical continuous cutoff wall with jet grouting piles. By optimizing hole layout and reasonably selecting grouting parameters, it addresses the problems of low compaction of the dam's fill soil and inadequate seepage prevention effect, thereby preventing leakage.

For analysis0, addressing the issues of mortar aging and structural fractures in the culvert, technology1—PE pipe lining reinforcement technology for the culvert—was adopted. By inserting a PE pipe into the original culvert and performing compact construction with cement mortar grouting, the anti-deformation ability of the culvert was improved while also repairing aging and leakage problems, thereby ensuring the safety and functional reliability of the culvert.

title: Research on the design scheme of buffer silos at the ore terminal train loading station
requirement: Research on the design scheme of buffer silos at the ore terminal train loading station Under the conditions where the buffer silo must meet the requirements of continuous loading, high efficiency, and uninterrupted operation during the unloading process, complete the design task of the buffer silo at the ore terminal train loading station, ensuring the coexistence of efficient loading and stable conveying.
solution: This paper proposes an optimized design scheme for the buffer silo at the ore terminal train loading station. Specifically, firstly, considering that the buffer silo needs to meet the continuity of loading and the efficiency of the unloading process, buffer silo level setting and storage capacity calculation technology are utilized. Through Formula Q3, low, high, and extreme levels, as well as conveying capacity, are comprehensively considered to balance upstream and downstream demands. Secondly, addressing the issue of loading efficiency being affected by various time factors, a dual-feeding port and four-feeding port design scheme is proposed, enabling the selection of a reasonable structure based on different loading capacities to enhance feeding precision and speed. Lastly, to address the risk of material accumulation that may arise when unloading and loading operations run simultaneously, multi-radar monitoring and calculation technology is applied to overcome the problem of uneven material flow, achieving precise level monitoring and smooth material transfer.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the conflict between continuous rapid loading and unloading efficiency, technology0 is adopted. Through formula Q3 and reasonable material level design, the buffer silo capacity accommodates both upstream and downstream demands, ensuring the stability of the loading operation and the material retrieval line.

For analysis1, considering that loading efficiency is constrained by various time-influencing factors, technology1 is used to enable the design of dual and quadruple feeding ports to adapt to different loading capacities. Along with a reasonable equipment arrangement, this minimizes system resistance and operational delays to the greatest extent.

For analysis2, considering that simultaneous operations of unloading and loading may lead to material accumulation on the conveyor belt, the buffer formula for conveying capacity and high material level limit in technology0 is adopted, combined with multi-radar material level monitoring and control in technology2, to ensure the smooth connection of the conveying and loading system.

title: Design and construction technology for repair and reinforcement scheme after the dock rubble bed is hollowed out
requirement: Design and construction technology for repair and reinforcement scheme after the dock rubble bed is hollowed out Under the conditions of a deeply hollowed-out rubble foundation bed and severe scouring by propeller water flow, complete the repair and reinforcement tasks for the rubble foundation bed at berth #3 of the dock, restoring the foundation's load-bearing capacity, stability, and anti-scouring ability.
solution: This paper proposes a repair and reinforcement plan for the scouring and damage of the rubble foundation at berth 3 of the terminal. Specifically, first, considering that the scouring issue at the bottom of the counterfort may lead to reduced load-bearing capacity, bagged concrete technology and formwork-bag concrete technology are used to repair the basic contours of the scoured area, forming a relatively enclosed area to reduce the loss of underwater non-dispersible concrete. Second, for the severely scoured bottom of the counterfort, underwater non-dispersible concrete technology is used for filling to achieve comprehensive repair. Finally, to address the long-term scouring of the foundation by propeller water flow, formwork-bag concrete technology is adopted to enhance the protective surface and base of the foundation, improving its erosion resistance and ensuring the overall stability of the terminal. After repair and reinforcement, inspection results show that the terminal foundation meets the repair objectives, with no scouring defects at the bottom of the counterfort, significantly improved foundation protective performance, and the elevation of the docking water area meeting design requirements.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the large area of the buttress base and excavation range, as well as its location underwater, technology0 and technology1 are used to repair the basic contour of the excavated area to prevent further deterioration. At the same time, a closed structure is formed with the buttress base plate and the original rubble mattress. Then, technology2 is used to fill the excavated area at the bottom of the buttress to restore its bearing capacity.

For analysis1, considering the propeller water flow scouring issues caused by the berthing and departure of the ship, as well as the further erosion of the exposed bed, technology1 is adopted to protect the sides and bottom of the restored exposed bed. The scouring resistance is enhanced by leveling the concrete with formwork bags.

title: Design of the river channel management plan for the Zhengchuan section of the Gourd River in Qin'an County
requirement: Design of the river channel management plan for the Zhengchuan section of the Gourd River in Qin'an County Under the conditions of aging dikes, narrow river channels, and high regional development demands, complete the 3.5km river management task of the Zhengchuan section of the Hulu River, upgrading the flood control standard to a 20-year flood level, ensuring smooth flood discharge, increasing the development area, and aligning with the overall construction plan of the new district.
solution: This paper proposes a plan for the management of the Hulu River Zhengchuan section. Specifically, firstly, considering the flood risks caused by the aging and disrepair of the embankments, it is recommended to adopt composite cross-section embankment technology, combining sloped gabion revetments with gravity retaining wall structures to enhance flood control capabilities and embankment durability; secondly, to address the issues of narrow river channels and flood hazards, gabion materials with a thickness of 40cm are used, filled with 100-200mm crushed stones to form standard revetments, supplemented by gravity retaining walls to further ensure overall embankment safety and structural stability; finally, to meet the development needs and land area constraints of the Zhengchuan New District, a river realignment planning technique is adopted, adjusting the river to be laid out 30m outside the Tianping Expressway, increasing the development area of the new district to 1,067 acres, achieving contiguous development and integrated planning.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the risks of riverbed erosion and flooding due to the aging and disrepair of the embankment and the lack of protection, technology0, namely the compound cross-section embankment technique, is adopted. This enhances the flood control capacity and durability of the embankment by combining slope-style gabion revetments and gravity retaining walls.

For analysis1, considering the issues of narrow river channels and poor flood discharge, technology1 gabion retaining wall technology is used, with its design thickness and erosion resistance meeting the flow velocity and protection requirements of the Hulu River, supplemented by technology2 gravity retaining wall technology to ensure the stability of the embankment structure.

For analysis2, provide support for the new district development needs by adopting the technology3 river rerouting planning technique, relocating the Hulu River along the outside of 30 meters from the Tianping Expressway, optimizing the layout of the development zone, increasing the planned area to 1,067 acres, and resolving the conflict between the river channel and the new district development.

title: Design and evaluation of a reinforcement scheme for a hydraulic tunnel crossing fractured surrounding rock zones.
requirement: Design and evaluation of a reinforcement scheme for a hydraulic tunnel crossing fractured surrounding rock zones. Under the conditions of steep terrain, fractured surrounding rock, and developed groundwater in the tunnel section from D1+203 to D2+522, complete the construction of the hydraulic tunnel crossing the fault fracture zone, effectively control the deformation and stability of the surrounding rock, and ensure construction safety and the long-term stable operation of the tunnel.
solution: This paper proposes the design and evaluation of a reinforcement scheme for hydraulic tunnels traversing fractured surrounding rock zones. Specifically, firstly, considering complex conditions such as fractured surrounding rock and developed groundwater, which may lead to surrounding rock instability and large deformation, the pre-grouting curtain technology is adopted to enhance the shear strength of the surrounding rock through the cementation effect of the grout. Secondly, advanced small conduit technology is introduced to strengthen local support and further control the deformation of the surrounding rock. Finally, combined with mortar anchor support technology, the overall stability of the surrounding rock is improved, forming a stable mechanical structure. The numerical simulation results verify that this comprehensive reinforcement scheme can significantly reduce the deformation of the tunnel's surrounding rock (e.g., reducing the arch crown deformation to 25.66 mm) and improve the safety factor (reaching 1.722). Construction monitoring data show good adaptability of the simulation results, with an error within 10%, indicating that the reinforcement scheme is scientifically reasonable and capable of ensuring construction safety and long-term stable operation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering conditions such as steep terrain, fractured surrounding rock, and developed groundwater, which may lead to surrounding rock instability and large deformation, technology0 pre-grouting curtain technology is adopted to enhance the shear strength of the surrounding rock through grout cementation. Combined with technology1 advanced small pipe support technology, the local support effect is strengthened, achieving effective support for the fractured zones in the tunnel surrounding rock. Furthermore, technology2 mortar rock bolt support technology is used to enhance the overall stability of the surrounding rock, ultimately achieving control over the deformation of the surrounding rock.

title: Design of the specialized plan for ultra-long-distance multi-point dredging by cutter suction dredger
requirement: Design of the specialized plan for ultra-long-distance multi-point dredging by cutter suction dredger In the 100,000-ton channel reconstruction project at Dongying Port, under complex conditions such as dispersed dumping areas, harsh sea conditions, long-distance transportation, and multi-working condition operations, complete the task of dredging and reclamation of 20.92 million m³ of dredged soil across the entire channel while ensuring construction safety, environmental protection, economic feasibility, and project timeline control. The task should primarily use cutter suction dredgers as the main construction equipment, with the design and application of technical combination schemes covering various processes such as direct discharge, relay discharge, and the combined operations of cutter suction and hopper suction.
solution: This paper proposes a construction scheme for ultra-long-distance multi-point land reclamation using a cutter suction dredger. Specifically, firstly, considering the conditions of long distances and dispersed multi-point dumping areas, it uses equipment selection optimization technology and pipeline optimization technology. By selecting a general three-pump cutter suction dredger and reasonably arranging the main and branch pipelines, stable long-distance dredged soil transportation is achieved. Secondly, addressing the challenge of the construction area being an existing navigation channel and having high environmental requirements, the temporary sludge pit setup technology is adopted. Through the design of temporary navigation channels and sludge storage within the guiding dike, navigation interference and the environmental impact of slurry spilling are avoided. Then, to cope with harsh sea conditions, relay pump design technology is used to select relay points in non-navigable harbor basins and optimize pump residual pressure, stabilizing construction parameters. Finally, utilizing comprehensive economic optimization technology, a process combination scheme is designed to replace high-cost large-scale equipment, reducing construction costs, improving construction efficiency, and ensuring the successful completion of the project tasks.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the need for long-distance (over 26 km) slurry transportation, technology0 and technology1 are utilized. By optimally selecting a general three-pump cutter suction dredger as the main equipment and reasonably arranging the main and branch pipelines as well as submersible/floating pipe combinations, the long-distance transportation capability of dredged soil is ensured while reducing pipe resistance.

For analysis1, considering construction navigation interference and environmental protection restrictions, technology3 was used, and temporary sludge storage pits and navigation channel layout within the guiding dike were set up to avoid dredged soil returning to block the channel and reduce interference with navigating vessels.

For analysis2, considering the impact of severe sea conditions on construction efficiency and potential siltation, technology2 was used. By placing the relay points within non-navigation areas and adopting a relay pump residual pressure design for stable transport, the issue of sea condition constraints was resolved, and work efficiency was improved.

For analysis3, considering the high rental costs of large cutter suction dredgers and resource scarcity, technology0 and technology4 were used to replace some high-rental large equipment with general equipment and combine process site selection strategies, achieving construction cost optimization and ensuring equipment flexibility.

title: Design and optimization of the channel layout solution
requirement: Design and optimization of the channel layout solution Based on the existing port area and channel, and considering the conditions of surrounding terminals and navigation requirements, complete the design of the new channel layout plan and optimize the construction plans for channel widening and dredging to ensure safe navigation for ships while reducing construction and maintenance costs.
solution: This paper proposes a design and optimization plan for the layout of navigation channels. Specifically, firstly, considering the conflict between surrounding water depth conditions and wharf turning basin areas, which may affect the widening design, a dual-side and single-side widening design technique is adopted. By comprehensively evaluating water depth and wharf distribution, a widening method is selected to balance environmental conditions and widening needs. Secondly, to meet the navigation demand and ship type compatibility requirements, which may face challenges in precise calculations, accurate dredging engineering calculation techniques are employed. Through scientific calculations of channel width, elevation, and dredging volume, the dredging range and soil handling methods are reasonably optimized to reduce construction costs. Finally, considering the issues of severe siltation and tidal influences, which might increase the pressure of maintenance dredging in the later stage, navigation capacity and stability analysis techniques are used. By establishing siltation and stability models and determining the annual capacity, a maintenance dredging plan is proposed to ensure long-term operational efficiency.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complexity of the surrounding environment and dock constraints, there may be challenges in widening that affect the dock's turning water area. Therefore, technology0 dual-side and single-side widening design techniques are used to flexibly adjust the widening approach, achieving protection and optimal utilization of existing facilities.

For analysis1, considering that the design needs to meet the operational requirements of the ship while controlling costs, technology1 precise dredging engineering calculation technology is adopted. By accurately calculating channel width, bottom elevation, and ship type, the dredging project volume is optimized to ensure navigation requirements while reducing investment.

For analysis2, considering the complex geological environment of the port and the impact of siltation, the technology2 navigation capacity and stability analysis technique is adopted. By constructing a siltation analysis model and conducting mathematical calculations, maintenance dredging measures are proposed to ensure the long-term operational capacity of the channel.

title: Design of the safety reinforcement plan for the Huaguo Reservoir water diversion tunnel
requirement: Design of the safety reinforcement plan for the Huaguo Reservoir water diversion tunnel Under the conditions of unreasonable layout of the control gate at the water conveyance tunnel outlet, cracks and leakage with cavitation in the tunnel body, equipment aging, and a complex slope environment, complete the reinforcement task for the water conveyance tunnel of the Huaguo Reservoir to ensure water conveyance capacity and operational safety while maintaining minimal changes to the tunnel diameter to meet irrigation and flood discharge requirements.
solution: This paper proposes the design of a reinforcement scheme for the Huaguo Reservoir water conveyance tunnel. Specifically, firstly, considering issues such as cracks, leakage, and cavitation in the concrete structure of the tunnel, carbon fiber sheet reinforcement technology is used to create a composite layer by attaching carbon fiber sheets, significantly enhancing compressive strength. Secondly, to address the problems of insufficient surrounding rock stability and energy dissipation pool aging, full-section grouting technology is employed to reinforce the surrounding rock and lining, increasing overall stability. Thirdly, given the constraints of limited space in the construction area and tunnel diameter, precise construction techniques are adopted to maintain the original tunnel diameter. Finally, high-performance epoxy mortar overlay technology is applied for surface protection to prevent secondary damage caused by erosion during operation, thereby ensuring the long-term safe operation of the water conveyance tunnel.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of tunnel body cracks and cavitation, use technology0 to adhere carbon fiber fabric to the inner wall of the concrete lining, thereby enhancing the tunnel's compressive and impermeability performance to thoroughly repair the tunnel structure.

For analysis1, considering the aging and leakage issues of the outlet control gate, repair the tunnel body structural joints for water sealing through technology2, while improving operational functionality through reinforcement treatment.

For analysis2, considering the safety hazard issue caused by the aging of the energy dissipation pool, technology1 is adopted for consolidation and backfill grouting to address the related issues by improving concrete strength and increasing the stability of the surrounding rock.

For analysis3, the threat caused by loosened weathered slopes is addressed by reinforcing the structure using the principle of auxiliary support combined with grouting technology and clearing the affected area of the slope.

For analysis4, the limited space restricts the application of traditional reinforcement methods. Therefore, technology0 is used for its characteristics of small construction curvature and minimal impact on the hole diameter, ensuring the completion of construction tasks under the existing spatial conditions.

title: Traffic plan design for the intersection of Datubu River and Tianma River in Huadu District
requirement: Traffic plan design for the intersection of Datubu River and Tianma River in Huadu District Under the conditions of meeting the requirements for flood discharge within the embankment, connecting embankments, and upstream and downstream traffic needs, complete the design and construction of traffic facilities for the 0+500 section of the Tianma River, while taking into account the 50-year flood control standard and economic feasibility.
solution: This paper proposes a traffic plan design for the intersection of Dabujing River and Tianma River in Huadu District. Specifically, first, considering the weak foundation and the need to meet both flood discharge and traffic requirements, a box culvert bridge design scheme is adopted. By establishing a 3-hole box culvert structure, lower costs and simpler construction are achieved. Second, to address the flow requirements of the Dabujing River under a 50-year flood standard, hydraulic calculations and structural optimizations are conducted to ensure a flow capacity of 176.5 m³/s, significantly exceeding the design requirements. Finally, to solve the issue of insufficient foundation bearing capacity, ground reinforcement technology is applied, using reinforced concrete square piles to effectively increase the composite foundation bearing capacity to 130.84 kPa, meeting design requirements. The plan balances safety, cost-effectiveness, and construction convenience, providing valuable reference for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the weak foundation conditions and the need to meet flood discharge and traffic requirements, a 3-cell box culvert structure was designed by adopting technology0 (box culvert bridge design scheme), resulting in lower costs and simple construction while satisfying both flood discharge and traffic conditions.

For analysis1, considering the 50-year flood flow standard and flood discharge capacity requirements, technology2 is adopted. Through hydraulic calculations and structural optimization techniques, the total width of the culvert was optimized to 14m, ensuring a flow capacity of 176.5 m³/s, which exceeds the design requirement of 172.6 m³/s.

For analysis2, considering that the basic bearing capacity of only 50 kPa is less than the design standard, foundation reinforcement is carried out using technology1. Reinforced concrete square piles are driven into the foundation of the box culvert and the retaining wall of the connecting section. Calculations show that the composite foundation bearing capacity fsp,k = 130.84 kPa is sufficient to meet the design bearing capacity of 126.85 kPa.

title: Research and design of large-scale dike foundation treatment on weak foundations
requirement: Research and design of large-scale dike foundation treatment on weak foundations Under the conditions of weak foundation soil, complete the foundation treatment design for the downstream levee project of the Xijiang River, ensuring the overall stability of the levee structure, flood safety, and controlling project investment, while ensuring the reliability of the foundation treatment effect.
solution: This paper proposes a combined foundation treatment solution for the weak foundation of the downstream dike project of the Xijiang River. Specifically, firstly, considering the deep soft soil underlying the foundation and the potential damage to the original slope stability caused by embankment filling, a combined technique of bored piles and cement-mixed piles is utilized. The bored piles enhance the anti-slip stability of the dike slope, and the cement-mixed piles increase the foundation soil strength, thereby improving the overall stability of the dike slope foundation. Secondly, based on the high flood control standards and cost control requirements of the Level 1 dike design, a combined composite foundation technique is adopted, involving bored piles (spacing 3m×3m, pile length 30m) and cement-mixed piles (pile diameter 0.8m, pile length 21-30m, arranged in grids or evenly). This approach ensures the overall stability and safety of the dike. Finally, through an economic and technical comparison of several foundation treatment techniques, this combined solution is identified as the optimal solution, balancing treatment effectiveness and cost-efficiency. The construction process is relatively controllable, with a total investment of approximately 57.26 million yuan. The overall stability of the designed dike, as verified by empirical calculations, meets all standard requirements.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the deep soft soil foundation under the dam site, filling the dam body may compromise the original stability of the dam slope. Therefore, technology 3 (bored piles + cement mixing piles) is adopted. Bored piles are used to enhance anti-sliding capability, while mixing piles improve foundation characteristics, thereby increasing the overall stability of the foundation.

For analysis1, considering the high flood safety standards under the design requirements of a level-1 levee and the need for cost control on weak foundations, adopting technique 3 (bored piles + cement mixing piles) can achieve the optimal balance in terms of safety and economic technology.

title: Brief Description of the Design Plan for Changing the Spillway Flat Gate to Arch Gate at Jiao Mu Tang Hydropower Station Project
requirement: Brief Description of the Design Plan for Changing the Spillway Flat Gate to Arch Gate at Jiao Mu Tang Hydropower Station Project Under the conditions of a small reservoir capacity, large upstream flood volume, and the need for frequent operation of the spillway, complete the task of changing the spillway at Jiaomutang Hydropower Station from a flat gate to an arc gate, while also optimizing water flow conditions and improving the reliability of gate operation.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for modifying the spillway by replacing the flat gate with an arc gate. Specifically, firstly, considering the load issues caused by the large size of the flat gate and high water head, an arc gate design and arrangement scheme was employed, optimizing the gate radius and pivot support to improve the force distribution and operational stability of the gate. Secondly, addressing the impact of turbulent disturbances on the gate, the hydraulic experiment and finite element analysis techniques were used to optimize the gate’s resistance and vibration stability, verifying the operational reliability of the arc gate. Finally, the flat gate’s truss design was canceled, adopting hydraulic hoist technology, which reduced wind loads on the dam top truss and simplified construction challenges, while ensuring construction progress. The scheme successfully passed flood season trials, demonstrating stable and reliable performance, further enhancing the spillway's flood discharge capacity and the project’s return on investment.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of large gate size, high water head, and complex water flow, the arched gate design scheme using technology0 optimizes the structure of the arc surface and support hinges to distribute the load and achieve stable operation.

For analysis1, considering the issues of turbulent disturbances during frequent flood discharges and the lifespan of the gate, the hydraulic experiments and finite element analysis technology of technology2 were used to optimize the design and operational safety of the radial gate through research on gate vibration characteristics and turbulence model analysis.

For analysis2, considering the issues of water flow blockage caused by the flat gate and the challenges of high supporting frame design, technology3 is used to eliminate the high supporting frame, combined with technology1 hydraulic hoist technology. This stabilizes the arc gate operation through the hydraulic system and optimizes the dam's aesthetic appearance, effectively solving construction and supporting frame design problems.

title: Research on the Design of Compensation Scheme for Regulating Hydropower Capacity
requirement: Research on the Design of Compensation Scheme for Regulating Hydropower Capacity Under the conditions of distortions in adjustable hydropower pricing, difficulty in cost recovery, and the lack of systematicity in the current capacity compensation model, complete the design task of a practical, feasible, and reasonable capacity compensation scheme for adjustable hydropower.
solution: This paper proposes a two-part electricity pricing scheme for compensating the regulatory hydropower capacity. Specifically, firstly, considering the issues of price distortion and insufficient revenue caused by a single-part electricity price, a fixed capacity pricing mechanism is adopted, dividing hydropower revenue into electricity price and capacity compensation electricity price, thereby incentivizing hydropower investment and construction through reasonable compensation. Secondly, to address the lack of adaptability and systematization in the existing capacity compensation model's calculation methods, the uncompensated cost method is employed, using the accounting approach of total cost minus market-based revenue to ensure that the compensation electricity price calculation results are meaningful and reasonably executable.
