Lastly, to tackle the issues of prioritizing electricity coordination, benefit distribution in cascading systems, and insufficient market incentives, a mechanism coordination correction technique is used, dynamically adjusting the capacity compensation standards through measures such as canceling the priority electricity policy, deducting downstream benefits, and sharing market incentives, further optimizing the efficiency of revenue distribution and market participation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that hydroelectric revenue is difficult to cover construction costs and the value of clean energy, technology0 is adopted to transform the single electricity pricing into a two-part mechanism through a fixed capacity price mechanism, dividing the revenue into capacity compensation and energy compensation parts to ensure the economic viability of clean energy.

For analysis1, considering that the capacity compensation model calculation deviates from actual needs, technology1 was used. By combining total costs and actual marketized returns, a reasonable capacity compensation electricity price was determined to avoid issues of insufficient subsidies or exceeding standards.

Specifically, to address issues such as the coordination of priority electricity policies, the attribution of benefits for cascade power stations, and insufficient market incentives, technology2 is adopted to optimize the electricity price distribution scheme by canceling priority electricity, dynamically adjusting capacity compensation electricity prices, and sharing benefit mechanisms.

title: Comparison of structural types for Borguo Reservoir drainage structures
requirement: Comparison of structural types for Borguo Reservoir drainage structures Under the conditions of complex terrain and geology, weak erosion resistance of the strata, and engineering investment control and operational management, the design and implementation of the Baiguo Reservoir discharge structures need to consider the reasonable selection of flood discharge structure types to ensure safety, cost-effectiveness, and simplicity in operational management.
solution: This paper proposes a scheme for selecting the type of water outlet structure for the Baiguo Reservoir. Specifically, firstly, considering the landslide body on the left bank of the dam site and the complex terrain, which may lead to construction difficulties and safety risks, the flood discharge tunnel technology was not adopted; instead, the side-channel spillway technology was chosen. Secondly, to address the issue of poor erosion resistance in the floodplain alluvial stratum of the energy dissipation section, a rectangular stilling basin with equal width and a reasonable torsional section design were adopted, solving the problem by enhancing foundation stability. Thirdly, based on considerations of engineering economy, the side-channel spillway involves the least amount of construction and total investment, only 21.08 million yuan, significantly reducing the earthwork excavation and concrete usage compared to other schemes. Finally, to meet the requirements for convenient operation and management, the side-channel spillway does not require dedicated personnel for management, making it simpler and safer to operate compared to the flood discharge tunnel scheme. After a comprehensive evaluation of all aspects, the side-channel spillway scheme (i.e., Scheme 3) is recommended as the type of water outlet structure for the Baiguo Reservoir.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the landslide body on the left bank of the dam site and the complex terrain, the flood discharge tunnel scheme needs to be pre-designed within the tunnels affected by the landslide, which may lead to construction difficulties. Therefore, it was not prioritized, and a simpler side-channel spillway technology was adopted.

For analysis1, considering the weak foundation scour resistance of the energy dissipation section of the spillway, a side-channel spillway was selected. The design of a uniform-width energy dissipation pool and a twisted surface section was adopted to enhance scour resistance and ensure foundation stability.

For analysis2, considering the requirements of engineering economic efficiency, the side channel spillway technology requires less engineering work compared to the flood discharge tunnel and broad-crest weir schemes, with an earth excavation volume of 22,000 m³, a concrete usage of 6,600 m³, and a total investment of 21.08 million yuan, making it the most economical choice among the three solutions.

For analysis3, considering the convenience of operation and management, the side-channel spillway without gate control requires no dedicated management, making it easier to operate compared to the flood tunnel scheme, thereby enhancing the feasibility of safe operation.

title: Design of the risk mitigation and reinforcement project for the Jiakou Hub River Barrage
requirement: Design of the risk mitigation and reinforcement project for the Jiakou Hub River Barrage Under the conditions of severe aging and damage in the current project status and insufficient operational capacity, completing the reinforcement and risk mitigation task of the Jiakou Watergate requires achieving the goals of meeting urban and rural water supply, flood control, irrigation, and comprehensive benefits. The project needs to meet the requirements for flow capacity (design flow rate of 500.0 m³/s, verified flow rate of 578.0 m³/s), energy dissipation and anti-scour measures, as well as structural safety and stability, while also restoring its transportation function and ecological benefits.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive risk mitigation and reinforcement plan addressing the current issues of the Jiakou Dam project. Specifically, first, considering bridge deck damage and slope protection risks, the technique of dismantling and rebuilding the dam site is employed to rearrange the dam structure and optimize traffic convenience; second, to address mechanical equipment failures and leakage issues, a new dam is constructed to optimize the hoist and waterproof facilities, improving operational functionality; meanwhile, to mitigate the risk of insufficient overflow capacity, hydraulic calculations of broad-crested weirs and the design of energy-dissipation pools are utilized to ensure that the size of the sluice chamber, the elevation of the base slab, and the anti-scour facilities meet both the check flow and design flow requirements; finally, to ensure the overall structural safety, an integral sluice chamber design is adopted to meet the standards for sliding resistance and foundation stress regulation.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the safety hazards caused by severe damage to the bridge deck and the upstream and downstream revetments, the technology0 gate site demolition and reconstruction technique is adopted. By reconfiguring the river-blocking structure at the original gate site, the existing engineering hazards are completely eliminated, while optimizing the sluice layout to enhance transportation and management convenience.

For analysis1, considering issues of mechanical equipment damage and water leakage, technology0 and technology1 are adopted. The old gate will be removed, and a modern river-blocking gate designed to meet current regulatory requirements will be newly constructed. Additionally, the design of the hoist and waterproof facilities will be optimized to enhance operational reliability.

For analysis2, considering the risk of insufficient flow capacity, technology1 and technology2 are adopted. Through precise hydraulic calculations and energy dissipation impact prevention design, it is ensured that the sluice opening's net width, bottom slab elevation, and other parameters meet the check flow and design flow requirements while enhancing flood discharge conditions.

For all analytical conditions, technology3 was specifically adopted, and through precise design of the gate chamber structure and foundation stability, the regulatory requirements for sliding stability coefficient and foundation stress were met, ensuring structural safety.

title: Design of plastic drainage board drainage consolidation scheme for soft soil foundation treatment in coastal dike engineering in southeastern regions
requirement: Design of plastic drainage board drainage consolidation scheme for soft soil foundation treatment in coastal dike engineering in southeastern regions Under the conditions of high water content, high compressibility, low strength, and low permeability of soft mud soil layers in the southeastern coastal areas, the task of embankment foundation treatment in the Luohan Creek Basin of Xiapu County in the southeastern coastal region is completed through foundation reinforcement methods. It is necessary to ensure that the settlement and sliding stability of the embankment foundation meet the requirements of the "Design Code for Embankment Engineering," and to achieve cost-effectiveness through reasonable design, thereby reducing project investment.
solution: This paper proposes a plastic drainage board consolidation treatment scheme for soft soil foundation levee engineering along the southeastern coast. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of high compressibility and low permeability of the soft soil and silt layer in the Xiapu area, the plastic drainage board consolidation technology is used, combined with the equidistant arrangement design of trench-like geotechnical drainage belts, to accelerate the soft soil consolidation process through short-term consolidation and reduce the risk of uneven settlement. Second, to address the external loading on the levee foundation and staged loading issues, a preloading technique is employed, with vertical consolidation degree and shear strength indicators controlled through a two-stage gradual loading process (achieving a final silt shear strength of 18 kPa). Finally, after the completion of the levee, residual settlement is delayed through on-site monitoring, ensuring construction compliance, and cost allocation is optimized based on investment analysis, significantly reducing the total budget (optimized from 50.19 million to 29.31 million yuan), achieving the goal of a stable, safe, economical, and environmentally friendly engineering design.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the characteristics of high water content and low compressive strength of the silt layer in Xiapu County, technology1 plastic drainage board drainage consolidation technology was adopted. Through drainage consolidation, embankment settlement was reduced, and uneven settlement was prevented, achieving an improvement in embankment stability while being cost-effective, economical, and environmentally friendly.

For analysis1, considering that the design of the embankment needs to meet long-term stability requirements, technology2 staged loading and preload techniques are adopted. By gradually increasing the embankment base shear strength through two-stage loading and optimizing the loading process based on on-site monitoring data, settlement is ensured to remain within a reasonable and controllable range.

For analysis2, considering that rapid loading may lead to local embankment foundation instability, an equilateral triangular arrangement with evenly distributed plastic drainage boards was designed, combined with a staged loading control scheme (technology1 and technology2). Through gradual loading and surface modification, the embankment foundation is stabilized, the impact of overload stress is reduced, and overall investment costs are minimized.

title: Determination of the timing for dynamic management and design of the management plan for the South-to-North Water Diversion pipeline under the influence of coal mining.
requirement: Determination of the timing for dynamic management and design of the management plan for the South-to-North Water Diversion pipeline under the influence of coal mining. Under the conditions where the South-to-North Water Diversion pipeline is affected by coal mining at the 5302 working face, complete the pipeline damage assessment, determine the critical deformation parameters, and implement dynamic management of the pipeline, including elevation restoration and pre-lifting, to ensure normal operation and safety of the pipeline during the mining process.
solution: This paper proposes a dynamic management plan for the South-to-North Water Diversion pipeline. Specifically, first, considering surface subsidence and curvature deformation caused by coal mining, the range and operational parameters for management are determined by dynamically forecasting using the probability integral method combined with the ABAQUS model to calculate the stress distribution of the pipeline. Second, for pipeline damage caused by surface deformation, the reverse lifting method (TLB-40 type air cushion lifting) is used to restore the pipeline elevation, and buried corrugated displacement compensators are utilized to absorb axial deformation stress, ensuring pipeline safety. Finally, lateral horizontal displacement of the pipeline is addressed by incorporating lateral displacement repair technology, and the construction scope is adjusted based on dynamic forecasting. A total of six management projects have been planned to ensure the safe operation of the pipeline throughout the full mining cycle.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the subsidence caused by coal mining requiring precise assessment of dynamic surface deformation, the probability integral method of technology0 is dynamically predicted in combination with the ABAQUS model. Numerical simulation is used to determine the deformation distribution and stress state of the pipeline, providing an accurate basis for remediation.

For analysis1, considering that the surface curvature exceeding the critical deformation value of the pipeline may lead to buckling failure, use technology1 reverse lifting method to restore the elevation of the sinking pipeline, while employing technology3 direct-buried corrugated displacement compensators to absorb axial stress, ensuring pipeline stability.

For analysis2, considering the continuous accumulation of pipeline impacts caused by the dynamic advancement of coal mining, the technology2 lateral shifting repair technique is adopted, combined with the technology1 reverse lifting method and subsidence values predicted through dynamic calculations, to promptly restore pipeline elevation and eliminate horizontal displacement, thereby reducing the accumulation of additional stress.

title: Design of the seepage control and reinforcement scheme for long-distance earth-rock dams
requirement: Design of the seepage control and reinforcement scheme for long-distance earth-rock dams Under the conditions of poor dam fill quality, high permeability, excessive seepage exit height, and severe leakage issues, perform anti-seepage reinforcement design for the 5700-meter-long dam to ensure that the dam's seepage gradient meets regulatory requirements, significantly reduce leakage, and improve overall structural stability and safety.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive anti-seepage reinforcement plan targeting the hidden dangers of seepage and landslides in long-distance earth-rock dams. Specifically, firstly, considering the poor filling quality of the dam body leading to the formation of seepage channels, a multi-head small diameter cement mixing pile diaphragm wall technology is employed for vertical anti-seepage in regions where the dam height is less than 15 meters. By adjusting the permeability coefficient and consolidating the wall, a low water head anti-seepage system is established. Secondly, for areas with higher permeability in local contact sections, high-pressure jet grouting anti-seepage wall technology is adopted for regions where the dam height exceeds 15 meters. Through the consolidation of the body to strengthen the integrity of the dam, the anti-compression capacity against seepage is significantly improved. Lastly, considering the high seepage exit height in some sections, a slope-attached drainage and reverse filter layer technique is used. The reverse filter is applied within 1.5 meters above the seepage exit point on the downstream slope, and a layered drainage design ensures that the infiltration line on the downstream slope is significantly lowered, thus meeting regulatory requirements. This plan achieves economical, reasonable, safe, and reliable anti-seepage treatment for long-distance earth-rock dams, providing important reference experience for similar projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the poor quality of dam filling and incomplete foundation cleaning led to the formation of leakage channels, technology0 (multi-head small-diameter cement mixing pile cutoff wall) is used to implement vertical seepage prevention in areas where the dam height is less than 15 meters. This blocks the flow path of seepage water, reduces the permeability of the dam, and forms a relatively continuous seepage barrier.

For analysis1, considering the high permeability and significant seepage exit risk at the dam body-dam foundation contact section, technology1 (high-pressure jet grouting cut-off wall) is adopted for areas with a dam height greater than 15 meters. The jet grouting process is used to seal the leakage channels and ensure seepage stability at the junction between the wall and the dam foundation.

For analysis2, considering the significantly elevated seepage exit height and locally high permeability gradient exceeding the allowable value, after the anti-seepage treatment of the dam, combined with technology2 (slope-adjacent drainage filter layer), multilayer drainage and filtration structures are laid downstream to effectively reduce the height of the seepage exit point and the seepage flow, ensuring the overall stability of the dam body.

title: Design and Feasibility Analysis of the Inland River Wharf in the Shaxi River Basin of Minjiang River
requirement: Design and Feasibility Analysis of the Inland River Wharf in the Shaxi River Basin of Minjiang River Under the conditions of significant water level differences in the Shaxi reservoir area, complex geological conditions, and limited land resources, complete the design and construction tasks of the inland waterway terminal, including solving the challenges of layout planning, selecting suitable hydraulic structure types, while improving the loading and unloading efficiency of the terminal and ensuring flood control and navigation function requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a reasonable wharf construction scheme tailored to the conditions of the Shaxi River reservoir area. Specifically, firstly, considering the significant elevation differences of the site and the complexity of construction conditions, a gravity block structure was used, combining rubble bedding and prefabricated blocks, to achieve a high-strength and low-cost wharf structure. Secondly, to address the issues of narrow river channels and limited land resources, a continuous full-span layout was chosen, optimizing berth arrangements with the help of natural bank slopes, avoiding river occupation, and saving space. Finally, to optimize loading and unloading efficiency, fixed lifting equipment was adopted, directly accessing goods to avoid horizontal transport vehicles entering the platform, achieving an efficient, safe, and energy-saving operational process. Meanwhile, the structural design and construction techniques meet flood control, drainage, and navigation requirements, providing a reference case for Shaxi and even the Minjiang River Basin.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the significant elevation differences of the site and the high requirements for construction equipment, technology1 gravity block structure is selected. By optimizing the foundation bed and prefabricated block design, the construction progress is accelerated, and structural stability is ensured.

For analysis1, considering the narrow Sandxi River channel and significant water level differences, technology0 contiguous full-span layout and technology2 fixed lifting and unloading equipment are adopted. By arranging berths along the shore and employing a layered lifting design, the site utilization rate is improved, and cargo loading and unloading efficiency is enhanced.

For analysis2, considering the situation where the impact of river sediment is small but the requirements for flood control and navigation are high, the technology1 gravity block structure was used to achieve high-intensity construction without affecting riverbed stability, reducing siltation and navigation interference.

title: Design of the treatment plan for collapsible loess at Ge'laowan Reservoir
requirement: Design of the treatment plan for collapsible loess at Ge'laowan Reservoir Under the conditions of high collapsibility grade and significant self-weight collapsibility, the collapsible loess on the right abutment of the GeLaowan Reservoir dam is to be managed to completely eliminate collapsibility, ensuring safety after the dam stores water. The construction involves a wide area (approximately 200 meters of the dam section) and deep thickness (collapsible soil layer of 5–13 meters) while avoiding any threat to the dam's safety as well as the buildings and residents of adjacent villages.
solution: This article proposes a comprehensive plan for addressing the collapsible loess treatment on the right shoulder of the Ge’ao Bay Reservoir dam. Specifically, first, considering the high collapse grade and substantial collapse amount of the foundation soil, in order to completely eliminate collapsibility, the pre-wetting method is employed as the first step. Through artificial water injection, part of the collapsibility is removed, and the soil moisture content is increased to meet the requirements for plain soil compaction pile construction. Secondly, since the collapsible soil layer is located beneath the dam body and covers a wide area, in order to avoid affecting the stability of the dam body, the plain soil compaction pile method is used to further reinforce the collapsible soil layer, forming a stable foundation. Finally, with full consideration for the safety of the construction area and neighboring villages, water injection volume and vibration intensity are carefully controlled during construction, and the dam body and drilled holes are backfilled and sealed after construction to ensure the safety and feasibility of the entire project. Before construction, simulation experiments are conducted by setting up a water tank at the dam’s base to adjust construction parameters and optimize the plan.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the collapsibility level of the foundation soil is self-weight Grade IV with a large amount of settlement, technology0 is used to partially eliminate collapsibility and increase the soil layer's water content through the artificial pre-soaking method, achieving construction conditions suitable for the compaction pile method. Subsequently, technology1 is used to construct plain soil compaction piles for further reinforcement, ensuring stability within the collapsible soil layer and ultimately completely eliminating collapsibility.

For analysis1, considering that the collapsible soil is located beneath the right dam shoulder and has a significant range of influence, to avoid major damage to the dam body, technology0 and technology1 are adopted in two steps. First, water injection is used to eliminate some of the collapsibility, followed by compacted pile construction to minimize disturbances to the dam body. After construction is completed, the loosened dam body is refilled, and grouting technology is used to seal any potential cracks, ensuring the safety of the dam body.

For analysis2, considering the construction area is only 10 meters away from village residential houses, use low-vibration techniques (such as technology1) during construction and strengthen the control of drilling and water injection to avoid endangering the village's safety due to operational errors. Additionally, ensure proper backfilling of expansion joints and holes to prevent surface changes from affecting the village.

title: Sediment deposition and sediment discharge scheme design for Qingtongxia Reservoir
requirement: Sediment deposition and sediment discharge scheme design for Qingtongxia Reservoir Under the conditions of high siltation, inflow from sediment-rich tributaries, and a significant increase in sediment during the flood season, complete the tasks of silt flushing and sediment discharge for the Qingtongxia Reservoir, and develop and implement specific sediment scheduling and discharge plans to ensure normal operation of the reservoir for irrigation, flood control, ice prevention, and power generation.
solution: This paper proposes a scheduling and sediment discharge plan to address the sedimentation problem in the Qingtongxia Reservoir. Specifically, first, considering the issues of insufficient reservoir capacity and severe sedimentation, the "sediment peak passing through" technique is adopted. This involves lowering the reservoir water level, discharging sediment through bottom outlets, and halting operations to achieve sediment removal and reservoir capacity restoration. Second, in response to the complex characteristics of both longitudinal and transverse sedimentation and erosion as well as the long-term stability of mainstream flow near the dam, the end-of-flood-season strategy of halting operations at the entire plant is employed to scour the reservoir and remove sediment. This is achieved by creating a scouring funnel to enhance sediment discharge near the dam and open sections, while optimizing operations within controlled elevation ranges. Lastly, to address the problems of significant sand peak increases entering the reservoir and operational challenges during the flood season, a technique combining spillway pipes and flood sluice gates is used for coordinated regulation. By dynamically adjusting operation with a focus on the spillway pipes, the sediment discharge target can gradually be achieved while ensuring irrigation and safe operation during the flood season.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the low storage capacity and sediment accumulation issues in the reservoir area, the technology0 sand crest "through passage" sand discharge technique is adopted. By lowering the water level during the flood season and operating bottom outlets for sand discharge, sediment can be expelled from the reservoir, thereby reducing sedimentation in front of the dam and at irrigation water intake points, and mitigating facility threat issues.

For analysis1, considering the longitudinal and transverse sedimentation and erosion conditions, as well as the fixed sedimentation on both banks of the floodplain, the technology1 end-of-flood-season full-plant shutdown flushing reservoir sediment removal technique is adopted. By lowering the water level to empty the reservoir and flushing the sediment accumulation in front of the dam to form a funnel, it can effectively address the issues of main river channel erosion and improve sediment discharge efficiency.

For analysis2, considering the impact of significant sand peak increases during the flood season on sand discharge, combined with the joint regulation technology of technology2's spillway pipe and flood discharge gate, as well as technology0, sand peaks are dynamically regulated and controlled during the flood season through flexible water discharge adjustments to ensure the safe operation of the reservoir during peak floods and achieve gradual sand discharge effects.

title: Ecological slope protection scheme design in the Malian River flood control project
requirement: Ecological slope protection scheme design in the Malian River flood control project Under the conditions of a thick loess cover layer, strong flood scouring forces, and significant differences in riverbank slope topography in various sections, complete the slope protection design for the Malian River flood control project. The design requires ensuring river channel stability, flood safety, and minimizing bank collapses while considering ecological functions and cost-effectiveness, selecting reasonable slope protection materials, and designing appropriate slope protection structures.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive plan for the slope protection design of the Malian River flood control project. Specifically, firstly, considering the thick loess covering layer and the complex terrain of the Malian River, ecological grid slope protection technology is employed to adapt to foundation deformation and optimize ecological benefits. By enhancing flexible slope protection design, the stability and ecological compatibility of the slope are achieved. Secondly, to address the strong scouring force of the flood, wall-type revetment technology is used in the concave bank areas with fast flow and strong scouring force. This resolves the issue of flood erosion damage through a wall structure and an ecological grid foundation. Lastly, to address the segmented differences in the riverbank slope, slope-type revetment technology is applied to the gentle convex banks and straight river sections. By optimizing slope design schemes and enhancing ecological functions, the treatment effect and cost-effectiveness are effectively balanced, meeting the flood control project's requirements for stability, protection, and ecology.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the thick loess cover and complex terrain, the ecological grid slope protection technology (technology0) has the characteristics of good flexibility and adaptability to foundation deformation, which can effectively reduce slope protection fractures and damages. At the same time, it is conducive to vegetation growth and optimizes ecological conditions.

For analysis1, considering the strong scouring force of floods, the slope protection requires high anti-scouring capability. Therefore, the wall-type revetment technology (technology1) adopts an ecological mesh foundation structure in the concave bank area, which can maintain stability under flood scouring conditions. Meanwhile, the slope-type revetment technology (technology2) is suitable for convex banks and straight river sections, alleviating riverbank scouring pressure by enhancing slope design and ecological functions.

For analysis2, considering the differences in bank slope shapes and water flow impacts, wall-type revetment technology (technology1) and slope-type revetment technology (technology2) are adopted in sections to meet the management requirements under different conditions of concave and convex banks. Meanwhile, the economic efficiency and construction convenience of ecological grid slope protection technology (technology0) are taken into account to achieve differentiated design.

title: Design of the seepage control treatment plan for the base of Malu Reservoir Dam
requirement: Design of the seepage control treatment plan for the base of Malu Reservoir Dam Under the complex geological conditions of the upstream areas of the Qingshui River in the Wumu River, a secondary tributary of the Jinsha River, and with the high permeability of the dam foundation, completing the anti-seepage treatment task for the Malu Reservoir dam foundation requires reducing bypass seepage and dam foundation seepage to an acceptable range, ensuring the safety of the dam and the normal water storage function of the reservoir while balancing engineering costs and benefits.
solution: This paper proposes a construction plan to address the seepage problem of the Malu Reservoir dam foundation. Specifically, first, considering the severe weathering of the dam foundation and the development of cracks leading to seepage issues, curtain grouting technology (technology0) is used to reduce the permeability of the rock mass, controlling the water permeability rate to q≤5Lu through a continuous water-blocking curtain. Second, to reduce the length of non-grouting sections in grouting holes around the dam and improve construction efficiency, grouting adits (technology1) are utilized, with the left adit being 93m long and the right adit 210m long. Simultaneously, the construction plan is dynamically adjusted through seepage analysis and uplift monitoring (technology2) to ensure the safety of the grouting process. Lastly, to address the issue of the exit hydraulic gradient of the clay core wall exceeding the allowable gradient under normal storage water levels, an anti-filtration design (technology3) is added to reduce seepage pressure and ensure the stability of the dam’s seepage. After calculation, the annual seepage volume was effectively reduced to 730,200 m³ post-curtain grouting, accounting for 2.15% of the multi-year average inflow volume, significantly enhancing the stability of the dam foundation and the reservoir's water storage function.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the severe weathering of the dam foundation rock mass, its high permeability, and developed fractures, technology0 curtain grouting technology is adopted to reduce permeability. By injecting grout into the rock mass fractures to form a water-blocking curtain, seepage is minimized.

For analysis1, considering the conditions of high permeability and deep aquitard burial, to reduce seepage around the dam, technology1 is used to set up grouting flat tunnels for curtain grouting. At the same time, through the design of curtain grouting, the permeability of the seepage section is reduced to q≤5Lu, effectively controlling the annual seepage volume to 730,200 m³, accounting for 2.15% of the multi-year average inflow.

For analysis2, in view of the issue of excessive exit hydraulic gradient in the clay core wall, a technology3 filter design is adopted, and a filter layer is set to reduce the exit hydraulic gradient, ensuring the seepage stability of the dam body. Meanwhile, technology2 is utilized for real-time monitoring to verify stability.

title: Design and experimental study of a mobile tailwater fish-gathering scheme for a high dam hub
requirement: Design and experimental study of a mobile tailwater fish-gathering scheme for a high dam hub Under the conditions of high water head, narrow river valleys, and high-velocity tailwater flow, to restore the fish migration passage at the Wudongde hydropower station's high dam hub, complete the design and construction tasks of fish aggregation facilities, requiring a significant improvement in fish aggregation efficiency that can cover multiple locations, full depth, and large-flow fish distribution areas.
solution: This paper proposes a mobile tailwater fish collection scheme for high dam hubs. Specifically, first, considering the limitations of fixed fish collection facilities due to high water head and narrow river valleys, the mobile tailwater fish collection box technology and fixed fish collection station technology are used. Through multi-point and full-depth deployment, high coverage and high efficiency fish collection are achieved. Second, addressing the challenge of high-speed tailwater flow threatening the stability of fish collection devices, fish collection box reinforcement and counterweight optimization technologies are adopted. By enhancing the equipment's resistance to flow impact and structural stability, normal operation under complex flow conditions is ensured. Finally, to tackle the efficiency fluctuations caused by tailwater flow changes during power generation state switching, a pulley block and gate slot connection technology is applied. Through improving the flexibility of lifting and deployment, fish attraction effects and collection efficiency are guaranteed even during non-power generation states.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the limitations of fish-collecting facilities caused by high water head and the difficulty of additional construction, a mobile tailwater fish-collecting box (technology0) was designed, combined with a fixed fish-collecting station (technology1). By implementing a multi-point arrangement covering the entire tailwater channel, the coverage range and efficiency of fish collection were significantly improved.

For analysis1, considering that the high-speed flow state of tailwater may affect the stability of the device, the fish collection box reinforcement and counterweight optimization technology (technology2) is adopted. By improving structural stability and material durability, it ensures the safe and effective operation of the fish collection device in complex flow conditions.

For analysis2, considering that the tailwater flow pattern changes with the power generation state, which may cause fluctuations in fish collection efficiency, the technology3 of connecting a movable pulley system with the gate slot is adopted. By flexibly arranging the position of the fish collection box, it quickly adapts to the fish attraction demands of various operating conditions, ensuring long-term stability in fish collection efficiency.

title: Analysis of the Scheme Design for the Continued Construction, Supporting Facilities, and Water-Saving Renovation Project of the Yuanyang Large-Scale Irrigation District
requirement: Analysis of the Scheme Design for the Continued Construction, Supporting Facilities, and Water-Saving Renovation Project of the Yuanyang Large-Scale Irrigation District Under the conditions of aged and neglected main channels, leaking and malfunctioning sluice gates, and low levels of informatization, promote the continuation and upgrading of supporting facilities and water-saving renovation projects in the Yuanyang large-scale irrigation district, renovating channels, structures, and informatization systems to enhance the operational safety of major projects in the irrigation district, improve irrigation water efficiency and management levels, and achieve green development in agricultural ecology.
solution: This paper proposes a renewal and water-saving renovation plan for the Yuanyang Irrigation District. Specifically, first, considering that the main channels are old and severely damaged, potentially affecting irrigation safety, the use of channel removal and cast-in-place lining technology, combined with high-strength concrete lining, geomembranes, and anti-freezing measures, has achieved a balance between water conservation and operational safety. Second, in response to aging gates, water leakage, and malfunctioning opening and closing mechanisms, regulation and diversion gate reconstruction technologies were adopted. Through the reconstruction with cast-in-place concrete and the introduction of remote control functions, efficient operation of the irrigation district gates was ensured. Lastly, addressing the issue of low informatization in the irrigation district, water measurement facilities and informatization system construction technologies were utilized. By adding new monitoring stations and upgrading the dispatch platform, precision water measurement and the modernization process of the irrigation district were achieved, providing essential support for the development of green agriculture.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of severe damage and aging of the main channel, the in-situ lining removal technology technology0 was utilized. By using C35 reinforced concrete lining along with geomembrane anti-seepage and antifreeze measures, the operational risks of the channel were resolved, and water transmission efficiency was improved.

For analysis1, considering the issues of gate aging, malfunction, and poor quality, technology1 was applied for the control sluice gate and sluice gate reconstruction. Through the use of cast-in-place high-strength concrete structures and remote control function upgrades, the operational performance of the gate and the management efficiency of the irrigation area were improved.

For analysis2, considering the issue of low informatization levels in the irrigation area, the technology2 gate flow measurement facilities and informatization system construction technology were utilized. By adding new monitoring stations and upgrading the dispatch management platform, precise water measurement and modernized irrigation area management were achieved.

title: Environmental protection plan design for the construction period of the Huangzang Temple Water Conservancy Project
requirement: Environmental protection plan design for the construction period of the Huangzang Temple Water Conservancy Project Under the strict environmental requirements of national and provincial nature reserves, complete the construction tasks of the Huangcangsi Water Conservancy Hub Project, including ecological protection, dust control, soil and water conservation, and waste and wastewater treatment, while ensuring that pollutant emissions meet the standards for Class I air functional zones and Class I water functional zones.
solution: This article proposes a green construction plan tailored to the environmental requirements of national and provincial nature reserves. Specifically, first, considering that dust pollution in the construction area may severely impact air quality, dust suppression systems, including mist cannon systems and dam spraying systems, are used to control total suspended particulate concentrations by suppressing dust from activities such as blasting and excavation. Second, to address the risks of vegetation damage and soil erosion caused by construction, rock surface covering techniques and grass restoration are applied to protect and green exposed slopes, thus controlling soil erosion. Third, to solve the wastewater pollution issue during construction and living activities, a three-stage sedimentation tank and an integrated domestic wastewater treatment system are employed to ensure that wastewater discharges meet emission standards. Finally, to manage garbage pollution, waste sorting and regular transportation facilities are utilized to maintain cleanliness in construction and living areas. Through these multiple measures, the goal of green construction was collectively achieved and recognized by environmental inspectors, providing excellent environmentally friendly construction experience for hydropower projects.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the strict ecological requirements of the protected area, it is necessary to control dust and wastewater pollution. Technology0 and technology1 are used to suppress dust emissions in the construction area and excavation area respectively. Dust reduction through humidification ensures that air quality meets the standards.

Regarding analysis1, considering the complex terrain and the widespread sources of dust pollution, technology0 mist cannon and technology1 spraying system are used to effectively reduce particulate matter concentration and visible dust height through measures such as humidifying the climatic environment and covering the dust sources.

For analysis2, considering the risk of soil and water erosion in the construction area, technology2 rock surface covering and vegetation restoration technology is used to address the issues of soil and water erosion and ecological damage through dense mesh netting to cover exposed areas, grid support, and slope vegetation planting.

For analysis3, considering the risk of garbage and wastewater pollution in the construction area, ensure wastewater discharge meets standards by using the technology3 three-stage sedimentation tank for treating production wastewater and the technology4 integrated treatment system for domestic wastewater. At the same time, implement the technology5 garbage sorting and treatment facility to prevent the spread of garbage pollution.

title: Electrical scheme design for the efficiency improvement and expansion renovation project of Zhangbei Canal Hydropower Station in Licheng County.
requirement: Electrical scheme design for the efficiency improvement and expansion renovation project of Zhangbei Canal Hydropower Station in Licheng County. Under the conditions of generator equipment aging, line corrosion and aging, and multiple booster transformers, complete the optimization and renovation tasks of the hydropower station's electrical plan to reduce equipment losses, improve operational efficiency and safety, and achieve the goal of easy maintenance and management while maintaining low investment costs.
solution: This paper proposes a hydropower station efficiency improvement and capacity expansion renovation plan by optimizing voltage levels, removing the 10 kV step-up station, and updating equipment. Specifically, first, considering equipment aging and safety hazard issues, the technology of removing the intermediate step-up station and optimizing voltage levels is adopted. By raising the generator output voltage to 10.5 kV, the electrical equipment configuration is simplified, reducing losses and maintenance difficulties. Second, a comprehensive automation system is implemented to achieve informatization and intelligent management of the power station, thereby reducing operational management costs. Finally, by replacing old equipment such as high-voltage switchgear and station transformers, the safety and reliability of operation are enhanced, achieving the goal of efficient operation of the power station while maintaining relatively low investment costs.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the aging of existing lines and equipment in the power station, decreased efficiency, and significant safety hazards, technology0 was adopted. By eliminating the intermediate booster station, the use of aging equipment was reduced, particularly minimizing conductor losses and fault points, achieving the goal of efficient operation. Additionally, by optimizing equipment configuration, maintenance difficulty was reduced, and safety hazard issues were resolved.

For analysis1, considering the complexity of the existing power station voltage level configuration, high losses, and the need to maintain step-up transformers, technology0 is adopted to directly increase the generator output voltage to 10.5 kV, thereby eliminating the step-up transformers, simplifying the circuit connection method, reducing the total number of electrical equipment and direct investment, and effectively improving efficiency.

For analysis2, considering the issues of equipment aging and the unavailability of spare parts, technology2 is adopted to replace the station transformer. At the same time, modern KYN28 switchgear and ZN63 vacuum circuit breakers are used to replace the outdated equipment, improving safety and operational reliability. Additionally, through construction optimization, the workload of generator foundation modification is reduced, effectively controlling construction costs.

title: Design of the treatment plan for the local water accumulation section of Longhai Fourth Branch Canal
requirement: Design of the treatment plan for the local water accumulation section of Longhai Fourth Branch Canal Under the conditions of water accumulation depths ranging from 0.05m to 1.09m and no drainage channels, complete the construction of the Longhai Sifen main canal section from stake number 3+080 to 4+360. It is required to drain the accumulated water to facilitate dry-land construction, ensure that the soil quality meets the design requirements, and comply with the cofferdam design requirements and operational safety.
solution: This paper proposes a construction treatment plan for the waterlogged area of the Longhai Section 4 branch canal between stake numbers 3+080 and 4+360. Specifically, first, considering the challenge of significant water depth and the inability to drain it, a temporary cofferdam construction technique and open pit drainage system are used. By building a cofferdam and using pumps to drain the water inside the cofferdam, the difficulty of dry ground construction is effectively resolved. Second, to address the high moisture content in the soil material at the A2 material site, soil drying techniques are applied to reduce soil moisture content to near the optimal value (17.1%), ensuring that the embankment soil material meets quality requirements. Finally, through the reasonable design of the cofferdam, including a length of 2.74 km, a top width of 4 m, and slope ratio configurations, the structural stability and safe operation of the construction cofferdam are ensured. This solution successfully resolves the construction challenges in the waterlogged sections of the Longhai Section 4 branch canal, providing a reliable guarantee for completing the project on schedule and meeting quality standards.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of significant water accumulation depth and lack of drainage channels, temporary cofferdam construction technology (technology0) and technology2 open drainage system for the foundation pit were used. By constructing a circular closed cofferdam and installing pumps for drainage, the accumulated water inside the cofferdam was successfully removed, thereby creating dry ground conditions for construction.

For analysis1, considering the issue of the current water content in the A2 stockyard being relatively high and exceeding the design requirement (optimal water content is 17.1%), the technology1 A2 stockyard soil turning and drying technique was used. Through plowing, raking, and piling for drying, the soil's water content was reduced, bringing it closer to the optimal level, thereby ensuring that the fill material meets engineering specification requirements.

For analysis2, considering the 2.74km-long cofferdam design requires ensuring stability and drainage safety, the technology0 temporary cofferdam construction technique is used. By reasonably designing the cofferdam slope ratio and top width, it ensures stability during the construction process and avoids issues such as instability or poor drainage caused by unreasonable design.
